Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Pleasant Palomar Westwood”
Reviews.Author: joyful1LasVegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our first choice when we come to visit our daughter at college. The staff is super attentive to whatever you need; and our little dog was royally treated as well (they have your dog's name on a blackboard out front when you arrive!). The rooms are beautifully decorated, and the beds are some of the most comfortable you will ever sleep on! The hotel is close to great restaurants in Westwood. We look forward to staying here every time we are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Shady business practices”
Reviews.Author: Miamikevin
Reviews.Content: I never leave reviews, but felt compelled after me recent stay with these jokers. I was forced out of my apt in la due to toxic mold, and was put up here. First of all, at check in the guy asked me for a credit card and I handed over my debit card. He immediately swiped it without asking me or telling me he was charging $100 for each night of my reservation, $500. This put a hold on my card. He then tried for 250, 150, then finally told me what was happening and tried again for $100. I settled the issue with my insurance company who covered that tab for 'incidentals.'. My 2nd night I got room service, milk an cookies for a whopping $15, no big deal right? The next day at lunch I came back to the hotel to walk my dog, and when I came back my key didnt work. The lady at the front desk, supposedly the guest services supervisor Emily, told me she needed to talk to me. They then asked for my debit card again, and I told them they couldn't use it, and that my insurance company had already faxed over another cc authorization for my incidentals. She then asked me to settle my tab for $15 even though I checked out the next day. Horrible customer service, which left me feeling like they thought I we a broke thief that would run out on my milk and cookies tab, give me a break. My apt renovation took longer, so ins. Company extended my reservation. When I got to the hotel the next day at noon to walk my dog, they denied any knowledge of my reservation and made me checkout. This put myself and my dog on the streets, made me late for my work that afternoon, and they knew full well what my situation was. My ins rep later told me that they blatently lied about not having my reservation, and it seems they wanted me out bc I did not provide my own 'incidentals' payment. They were rude, never apologized, and tried to run my debit card a total of 7 times throughout my stay. Stay away from these phonies, it seems like a nice place but if one thing goes wrong you'll soon realize that these ppl care about nothing but taking your money.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel - You Should, Too”
Reviews.Author: ElaineAndGreg
Reviews.Content: If you've never stayed at a Kimpton Hotel, you should. They are funky, comfortable, welcoming and . . . well . . . fun. This hotel is one of their best and by far the best hotel I have stayed at in the Los Angeles area. The Palomar is in Wilshire Blvd. along a series of apartment buildings right next to a residential neighborhood. While the exterior fits in well with the area (i.e. unexceptional), once you step inside you know you're in for a treat. The lobby is wonderfully decorated in kind of a funky art deco style. It's well-appointed, but has personality and pizzazz. They were playing European swing music when I arrived. The rooms are also decorated with style. It is not a bland "this looks nice for everyone" look, but off beat and yet in excellent taste. While in sort of an art-Deco style, the room was very modern, including a large flat-panel TV, a clock radio with an input for your iPhone, etc.. There is no coffee maker in the room, but they have wonderful free coffee in the lobby, which tasted great and was and not much less convenient than if it were in my room. There are lots off unusual amenities. When I was there, there was a "wine hour" with complimentary wine served between 5 and 6. They allegedly welcome pets, with kind of a station for dogs in front. At another Kimpton hotel I stayed at, they had dog biscuits in the mini bar. At this hotel, they had two bicycles in the lobby available to borrow to ride around the neighborhood. Incidentally, this hotel is about two blocks from the cemetery housing Marilyn Monroe, Jack Lemmon, Billy Wilder, George C. Scott, and other celebrities. It is also a short walk (or bike ride) from Westwood Village (with many shops and restaurants) and the Armand Hammer Museum, as well as UCLA. It is not far from Beverly Hills on one side, and freeway access on the other. It was only about 20 minutes from LAX in moderate traffic. The staff was genuinely nice and helpful. I had the sense they were delighted to see me and to make sure my stay was as nice as possible. This included not only the reception area, but also the cleaning staff and valet parking out front. There is free internet access if you are a Kimpton member. This isn't difficult and doesn't require some sort of elite status. The internet access was fast, easy, and seemed to work all over the hotel. I am generally not a fan of hotel restaurants, but I have had dinner here twice and both times it was very good. I travel a lot on business and generally the best hotels can do is to make my stay not only bearable but comfortable. This hotel made me enjoy myself and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sibling birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: aharrell87
Reviews.Content: After staying at a different Kimpton Hotel in Chicago, I definitely prefer them over other "chain" hotels and boutique hotels. So when my family came out to LA, I knew where they should stay. Upon arriving to the hotel, we made a stop in Westwood Village for lunch which isn't too far from the hotel. We valeted with the hotel and the minute we pulled in, the valet were very polite and professional. They greeted us, asked if we needed assistance with our bags, very nice. We didn't need assistance with our bags, and proceeded to check-in. The front desk was very friendly and wished my sister Happy Birthday. After check in, we got settled and visited the restaurant for the birthday dinner, let's just say it didn't disappoint, fantastic hotel restaurant. All in all, it was a great memorable stay for my family and I. We will definitely be recommending this hotel for anyone wanting a enjoyable and safe hotel in LA.

Reviews.Title: “No return phone call after problem with stay”
Reviews.Author: showaltermt
Reviews.Content: Plus: I liked the room, location is good (Westwood downtown area maybe a half mile), staff on site seemed generally friendly, hotel was clean. Minus: I didn't like the bed in either of our two rooms, so I asked for a roll away to try that out and they charged me for it, seemed a little lame. The heated pool could have for sure been warmer, it was the end of March, warm enough out to spend a little extra money and get it past cold. The real bad: We valeted, our iPad was 100% stolen from our van. We know you aren't supposed to leave things, but we never in our life had a problem. My wife mentioned it in the hotel and I told her it would be fine. Weak. The hotel still charged us for valet (I am out $700 on this already right?) and then ignored my request to have the valet company and/or hotel manager contact me (neither bothered). The valet workers weren't the friendliest by any means, and at least one was apparently a thief. Again, I understand it's my job to not leave it, but when I hand you the keys I should still count on you to not steal from me, and when I let you know someone did have the courtesy to follow up. The hotel is making the first and last impression a less than stellar one in my opinion, by having this company represent them. And the manager doesn't even take the time to contact me, no apology, no refund on parking?? We have stayed in Kimpton properties in the past (on a pretty regular basis) and after this one ignoring me I won't be again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Contemporary, Close to UCLA & Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Rock-Subculture
Reviews.Content: As a preface, I travel to a limited degree to review rock concerts, and have begun to include hotel and resort reviews as well, which I am republishing here is modified form. This review is for the Hotel Palomar Los Angeles, a Kimpton Hotel in Westwood, California, during a trip to attend a charity event at UCLA. Room Type/Class: Deluxe King Room Date: August 3-4, 2011 Overall Rating: 4/5 With this stay, I was looking to stay somewhere newer, clean, and contemporary, that was within reasonable walking distance to UCLA for a concert and not too far from Beverly Hills (via car) where I also had a meeting scheduled. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor, I selected Hotel Palomar, as it seemed to fit my criteria. The property is easy enough to find, and they offer valet parking. Check-in was smooth. The hotel is very hip and modern in appearance. The room had more style than most hotels (how many places have you stayed that try to pull off some leopard print?). The room was of a decent size with bed, dresser, and desk, and the bathroom was consistent with the decor throughout. My room faced out toward UCLA with related views. UCLA is walking distance, but it is quite a walk - probably better served driving. It was a short stay, so I don't really have any additional thoughts to share. It was a nice, clean hotel, and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “High-end service & accommodations”
Reviews.Author: MayorDelMundo
Reviews.Content: The Palomar in Westwood provided for a very pleasant stay once again. From the pre-stay welcome note to the outstanding complimentary wine hour, they are courteous and on top of everything. Even a local running routes map was available, and local taxis within a 3-mi radius were reimbursed up to $10. The only negative from my 2-week stay was a slightly stained comforter one day, and it was replaced the next. I highly recommend them for an LA base, whether it's business or vacation bringing you there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tedsexcellentmusic
Reviews.Content: We love Kimpton Hotels and the Palomar is one of the best. Great location, near to Beverly Hills and a quick drive to Santa Monica. People are warm and friendly. Wine tasting at 5 pm. Bikes to ride around UCLA campus. Great bar with good happy hour. We will be staying again

Reviews.Title: “The perfect home-away-from-Home in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Writerontherecord
Reviews.Content: LA can be such an alienating place: vast distances, few pedestrians, immaculate gardens and tangled traffic. Even though I grew up there - and visit frequently - its easy to get turned around in terms of neighborhoods and desitinations. Which is why I LOVE staying at the Palomar... With its central, and enviable, location just off the 405 on Wilshire Blvd in Westwood, the hotel allows easy access to LAX, Santa Monica, Beverly Hills and, really, just about anywhere I've ever wanted to get to. You can even walk a few blocks to restaurants, movie theaters, shopping, and supermarkets. But even better, the Palomar chain prides itself in friendliness, with a touch of quirl: wine in the lobby at sundown, coffee in the lobby in the AM, dogs encouraged, movies outdoors by the pool on warm summer nights. I LOVE IT! Canyou imagine this sort of joie-de-vivre at the Four Seasons or Peninsula? On the "this is fantastic" list: the Palomar rates can be incredibly good, and the reservation staff has already helped me find the very best deal available. I've had to stay for a week at a time with my son and best of all are the Spa Suites: complete with a sleeper sofa in an adjoining living room that can be closed off with sliding doors. Very cosy. each room has its own huge flat-screen TV, with a shared (enormous) bathroom: it doesn't get any better than this for the price! Be sure to sign up for the free rewards program which allows you to "Raid the Minbar" for $10-worth of goodies - always a treat - and be amazed by the genial friendliness of the staff. My only complaint is the steep price for overnight parking, a necessity for most, but one of the issues with staying anywhere in LA, where cars are essential. Otherwise, the Palomar - stylish, comfortable, and in such a lovely location - will always be my first destination in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Solid LA Hotel Choice in W LA”
Reviews.Author: SuperTien
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice rooms, comfortable beds. Workout room a bit on the small size but service was good as usual from Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST TIME”
Reviews.Author: brad r
Reviews.Content: This did not disappoint, we had a fab time location was great and as usual the staff we amazing was there for work and play rooms were abit small and need more TLC some oversights on the cleanliness of room but overall great will be back

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but service a little cold”
Reviews.Author: GregWBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel in 2 years as we enjoyed the location being close to a supermarket and good restaurants. The area is very clean and well maintained, however the rooms are very small and can get very hot and stuffy with no fresh air alternative. The staff are ok , but given that we have stayed at many hotels in the US the level of customer service we felt was generally ok, but appeared to not have the personal touch of many other hotels. To summarise we felt the staff attitude to be a bit cold. The hotel has all the amenities that you would want but if we go back to LA we will be trying another venue.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and area of LA”
Reviews.Author: ashleyet18
Reviews.Content: GrEat hotel - Palomars always deliver. Very stylish and upscale. Beds aren't the most comfortable (like heavenly beds or sleep number beds at radisson) but still nice. Live the proximity to Rodeo Drive and Santa Monica. The best part of this location is that it is a safe area of town to get up and run in early in the morning. I felt complete safe to run outside at 5 am from wilshire to Beverly hills and the staff informed m this is the best area of town for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near Westwood”
Reviews.Author: Jeff J
Reviews.Content: The Paolmar is a very nice hotel and a very good value. They have done a very nice job with the interior, and the staff is attentive and friendly. The facility itself shows some age under the refined exteriors (eg, loud A/C that blasts cold air on and off thought the night), but the benefits far out-weigh the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Even the room by the elevator was nice!”
Reviews.Author: Meerkat_Mom
Reviews.Content: So I asked for a Vista Room upgrade when I checked in, and was given a room with a very pleasant view of the surrounding neighborhood, but groaned when I realized we were right next to the elevator. But kudos to the sound engineers - you could barely hear the mechanism, and it didn't interfere with our sleep at all. The room was not huge, but pleasant enough. I'd go stir crazy after very long, not being able to open windows or have more of a suite-type room, but for one night, it was fine. The amenities were, as for all Kimpton hotels, very nice, but the prices of the minibar were exceptionally high. A Luna Bar for $6.00, really?? Location is very handy to UCLA and Westwood Village. You could walk there if you don't mind a fairly long walk. However, no one in LA walks, of course. Valet parking at $33 was another big ticket item. There is some street parking but it's a ways away. And the parking patrol is very active - we missed our meter while shopping at Westwood Village - missed it by 90 seconds and they'd already ticketed us! Yikes. We didn't feel quite as warmly welcomed as at other Kimptons - the valets and doormen sort of ignored us going in and out, no offer of help, so that was odd. The lounge also didn't seem that welcoming. We do like the Kimpton chain but this wasn't our favorite. Or maybe it's just that we're not in love with the car culture of LA...

Reviews.Title: “Back again to excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: locomotive38
Reviews.Content: If there is a greater pleasure than discovering great hospitality, it is returning to confirm that first impressions were true. My recent stay at the Palomar on Wilshire in Westwood was most agreeable in every way. The knowledge that once I cleared the Los Angeles' airport and its feeder freeway that feeds on one's time,the 405, that what awaited me was welcome comfort (or comforting welcome) of the hotel, propelled me to its front door and cheerful staff. My room was perfect, the gym vital, the elevator greetings testimony to the high quality of my fellow guests, and for the first time, I did my business by inviting folks to breakfast and lunch at the cafe...which they were happy to do! And I didn't have to drive all over L.A! And thus discovered how many pleasures were in walking distance of the Hotel. Final hint; if a guest wants to visit Beverly Hills to see Ferrari's and Bentley's in their native habitat, or sample cosmetics in the manicured hands of Nieman Marcus demonstrator ladies, take the bus right down Wilshire and let someone else worry about parking. O.K. That concludes my remarks. I will be back at the Hotel in early June wearing one of my five Adidas ensembles. Please greet me!

Reviews.Title: “Great pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: tim5055
Reviews.Content: You can probably see a theme in my reviews..... Work booked my 4 day stay at the Palomar. When the taxi stopped out front and there was a dog water bowl next to the front door I knew I was in the right place. Comfortable modern decor in the well appointed rooms, friendly staff and a wine reception every afternoon from 5 - 6 PM made for a great base for work. Each afternoon I was able to visit with patrons dogs in the lobby. Free wifi if you join their loyalty program. If you are looking for a Westwood base this is a great place

Reviews.Title: “way below expectation”
Reviews.Author: Susanna H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in rooms 916 and 918 on 3/29/12. Noticing the tables and wine glasses were not clean when I first got in the rooms. overall, we like the modern decoration in the room.However, when we got on the bed to rest at night, we found that it is filled with dust everywhere. Two of my friends have allergy that they are sensitive and couldnt rest well under situation like this. Doesn't someone in housekeeping check the room after the lady finish cleaning the room? How can it be so dusty in the room? I am satisfied with the service of this hotel. In contrast, i am very disappointed with the cleanliness of the rooms that is below my expectation. Suggestion: 1. Please remove/change the black blanket on top of the bed that thing causes dust too. 2. window is somewhat dirty too. Housekeeping need to do a better job on cleaning the rooms and be sure to check and make sure it is clean before letting guest check in PLEASE!

Reviews.Title: “Stomping, Stomping and more Stomping...Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaJosh
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to find this hotel as it is close to UCLA (our children have an eye appt. there every 6 months). Our check-in went great and the very friendly staff gave us a nice room on a high floor with a view. The lobby is small but very nice with modern decor. Nice restaurant and bar area located in lobby area. The pool is heated, but a jucuzzi would be nice on a cold day (which it was). Fitness center is pretty nice with water, towels, etc and a view of Wilshire. The cardio has built in tv's so don't forget to bring headphones. The room was small but clean and nicely appointed. Great flatscreen TV and 2 robes in the room. The problem started around 10:30 PM when i woke up to hear music and stomping in the room located above us. My wife had already been awake and said that it had been going on for a while. I called to ask if there was a club located above our room and the front desk person said no. When i told her about the problem she apologized and said that she would take care of it. It literally sounded like a bunch of kids were running back and forth in the room and jamming out to music (which was coming through the vents). After about 20 minutes things calmed down but then started up again after a while. I called down again (at almost midnight!) and the same (nice) gal was very empathetic and said that she would personally go up and take care of the situation (also offered to bring ear plugs up). She must have because it all stopped pretty quickly. I travel a lot and it has been quite a while since i have had this kind of a problem with noise. These people (above us) were flat out inconsiderate but there may also be an issue with proper insulation. All i can say is don't stay in room 1518! The front desk issued a credit of $50, which probably should have been more like $80 considering that it was really hard to get a good nights sleep after being woken up shortly after falling asleep The service was great except for at the restaurant. Given the location we may give it another try or more than likely will give the W a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value a step away from Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Momof2teensNyc
Reviews.Content: We recently went out to Los Angeles as a family on our way out to Claremont to visit the Claremont Colleges. I really liked this hotel a lot for the money. I did a lot of research first and was pleasantly surprised. We were very well received by the front desk and car valet service and that made us feel welcome right away. The lobby and hotel overall were very well appointed. It is very much a chic, boutique hotel. Sleek and yet comfortable. Our room was a type of suite. You enter into the living room suite with fold out double sleeper sofa, large flatscreen tv and desk and there are two sliding heavy doors which lead to the master bedroom which has its own flatscreen tv and king sized bed. The bathroom is accessible from the bedroom. It is a huge bathroom, and has an oversized bathtub as well as sleek shower stall. The only slightly odd thing was that there are these sliding frosted glass windows from the master into the bathroom, which we kept shut. If you are enjoying a romantic vacation for two, this might (and I stress "might") be enjoyable, but ....or maybe you want to watch the tv from the bathroom toilet. Hmmm....we all thought the window was a little weird, and even when closed, it does have some gaps which don't really afford you full privacy in there. Otherwise, believe me, the suite and bathroom were spacious and amazing. The windows are floor to ceiling glass and the view was very open and lovely. The sheets were a nice high thread count - which matters to a lot of us- and were very clean. Some of the furniture surfaces in the rest of the room, such as the desk, looked like they could have been more thoroughly cleaned, but the bathroom was very clean. It was great to be able to have our tv in the bedroom, and our teen daughters with their own tv in the LR. Now for just a few other negatives....The valet parking, which is $30 a day, got lax about giving us a ticket when they took our car, and on the day we had to leave, they couldn't find our car and acted like a bunch of clowns. Victor at the Front Desk is very in the know about everything in LA and Hollywood, and so was one of the women at the front desk, but there was another one who was kind of clueless and had absolutely nothing to recommend to us as an activity on a rainy day. (Yes, it does rain in LA!! And it was 47 degrees - totally flukey) So when it came to Universal Studios, the lady at the front desk told us to avoid it, but later on I overheard someone else saying that they went to Universal Studios that day in the rain when we skipped it and "They were totally set up to handle the rain and take care of customers in the rain." Fortunately, they did all agree that the place for us to go for breakfast was the Griddle (Cafe?) restaurant, and though there were a lot of people waiting, we were able to get a table really quickly and were thrilled. There was also a bit of confusion when we first got to the hotel and asked if they were still serving dinner anywhere in the hotel. The guy at the desk told us we could get light fare/snacks in the bar and then another person at the hotel said they had changed the menu in the bar, and ran off to get the new menu which was identical to the menu which was in the bar in the first place....and then guess what? They had already stopped serving food a half hour before anyway. That's okay though cause the bar smelled like a frat house though the decor was super cool and the couches and chairs were set up in a really well thought out way. We ended up going up to our room and ordering club sandwiches from room service, which, as with most hotels, took a half an hour as they warned it would. So just a little Snafu there. All in all, I would probably stay there again because it had a very cool design and was a sexy boutique hotel with nice bed linens, but they need to get a little more consistent in their valet service, concierge and staff service and maybe just a little more on the cleanliness front.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Igor U
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel last November and it was a very good experience. Rooms are clean; front desk, valet and service are great. Everybody on their staff was friendly and helpful. Good restaurant not only for breakfast but also for family dinner. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENCE ACROSS THE BOARD IN ACCOMMODATIONS AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: VAChuck
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Palomar. The room was very clean, reasonably spacious, and well appointed.The service, including free morning coffee and evening wine tasting, was appreciated. We were allowed to check in early. The restaurant on the premises is staffed by cheerful people and the food, if not gourmet, is quite acceptable. The ambience is a little dark for our tastes but nothing that bothered us. There are nearby restaurants on the UCLA campus that were good for casual food.The hotel, which is on Wilshire near UCLA, has an excellent location. The front desk staff is knowledgeable about tourist destinations and helpful with maps and brochures. We used The Palomar as a base to see the Getty Villa, the Getty Center, LACMA (largest museum west of the Miss. River), Huntington Library, Walt Disney Concert Hall, Manhatten Beach, Santa Monica Pier, and the Hammer Museum. The valet parking was $30 which appeared pretty reasonable for LA. This is our third Kimpton Hotel and we have found each of them to be delightful and very well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: bigidyo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar exceed all of my expectations. The hotel is in a location that is very convenient to UCLA, Beverley Hills and Santa Monica. I stayed just one night at Hotel Palomar for the Los Angeles Marathon. I requested a late check out of 1pm and the lady at the front desk graciously accommodated me without any hassle. Thank you very much Hotel Palomar! I'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “As Usual...Excellence from Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: For sure, Kimpton hotels spoil their guests and this hotel is no exception! My stay was only 2 short days - I could have easily stayed another month! Everything about this hotel is top notch. Service is impeccable and rooms are immaculate. Overall the hotel is very well maintained and gives a wonderful, welcoming vibe. While not in the heart of downtown (not necessarily a bad thing), I would absolutely make Palomar my first choice when coming back to the LA area. Thank you again, Kimpton, for delivering another great hotel experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay overall!”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: As with all Kimpton Hotels, the room was very clean and well-appointed. The beds were comfortable, and at the time of check-in we were offered a complimentary upgrade to a Deluxe room type. The view was amazing and unobstructed. I ordered a pay-per-view movie but it stopped halfway through so I contacted the concierge. They offered to remove the this from the bill. I tried watching another movie the following night and had no problems, so it must've been some glitch. In-room dining was fantastic; I ordered a turkey melt and it came extremely fast and the food was hot. The server who delivered was also extremely polite. All in all, a wonderful stay! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Palomar hotel”
Reviews.Author: rivermom1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. We had not stayed at a Kimpton property before. Chose this as a nice hotel near UCLA in the Westwood area. It is a boutique hotel on Wilshire Blvd in the neighborhood of Westwood. The hotel is comfortable and I thought the room was reasonable size and well appointed. The bath was small but not so small as to be cramped.(Word of caution-the tub is slippery because there is nothing on the bottom to prevent slips which my husband had. Ask for a rubber tub mat!) The room and hotel were very clean and well maintained. They have a pool and a nice but small pool lounge area with comfortable chaises and fireplace though it was never going which was a shame since it was cool enough and the fireplace in the lobby was going. I never figured out why the pool one wasn't fired up. Staff was very helpful and had genuine smiles. The hostess in the restaurant, Raquel, was extremely nice and when we told her at breakfast that we were a bit pushed for time, she gladly just took our order and made sure everyhting was brought to us ASAP. A rare treat to meet her. Everyone else also nice (except maybe the hostess on Saturday-not very friendly but oh well). When I asked the front desk man where to go to print my boarding passes he said just tell him and he would do it and he did while I stood there. When was the last time that happened to you?? I think this is a good choice if you are needing to be in the UCLA area. Also, the hotel is just a straight cab ride down Wilshire to Santa Monica and the beach. Going the other direction on Wilshire takes you to Rodeo Drive in about two miles. Within a 5 to 10 minute very pleasant walk you can go to the botanical gardens at UCLA (free) and enjoy a peacful wander while surrounded by busy LA!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jcoll40
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the convenience of this hotel in getting around to all our destinations without any hassle. The staff is friendly, efficient and knowledgable. Our first time in LA in 30 years, we weren't familiar with driving in the City. We like the Kimpton brand and this one is the best we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best options not far from UCLA”
Reviews.Author: SnowjoHK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to be close to the UCLA Ronald Reagan Hospital, which is a 5 minute drive away. The W Hotel was more expensive and other hotels within walking distance to UCLA looked too dated, whereas the Palomar was renovated around 2008. The front desk had noted my preference for brighter rooms on higher floors in my loyalty club signup, and kindly gave me a south-facing (even #) room on the top floor with a great view. The bed was comfortable with very smooth soft sheets, and the TV was large. Being a refurbished older hotel (a Doubletree in its former existence), the bathrooms are not luxe but the fixtures and lighting were fine and I appreciated the powerful Speakman shower head - much better than rainshowers IMO - and the curved tub/shower curtain rod which made the shower more spacious. They provide funky zebra print cotton robes and newspaper during your stay. It was very quiet for the most part except for Friday night when I could hear a group of people next door chatting and playing music. Apparently the pool is not bad but I didn't have a chance to use it. Valet/bellhop service was great and the front desk was efficient. There's a nice circular driveway for valet parking drop-off (the only option), and just outside the front door is a sign welcoming guests' dogs along with doggie water bowls. I didn't see any dogs while I was there though, and didn't detect any indication of a pet having been in my room. I ended up not eating there since I didn't have time for a sit-down breakfast in the restaurant and I felt the room service was expensive even before the 20% PLUS $3 charge. They didn't have any gluten-free bread or cereal options even though I asked ahead, so I ended up buying my own breakfast at Whole Foods in Westwood. Had they been more helpful in the food department I would have been really impressed. Parking is $30 a day, but I didn't have any other choice. The location on Wilshire was convenient for getting to UCLA, as long as you loop behind the hotel to turn right on Selby where there's a traffic light for making a left on Wilshire.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Choice in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: Austinex
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is the only Kimpton Hotel in Los Angeles, and will appeal to those who appreciate the Kimpton brand and amenities. On the small side, but not quite a boutique hotel, the Palomar is comfortable and chic. I stayed with a friend for five days in February, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.Whether you might want to stay there, however, depends on what you plan to do in L.A. We spent one full day at the Getty Villa and another at the Getty Center, which are both just up the Pacific Coast Highway in Malibu, so very convenient. Visiting spots in downtown L.A., given the traffic, isn't quite so pleasant. Since neither of us was familiar with Los Angeles, we found the staff at the Palomar to be very helpful. Upon learning that we were taking a walking tour of historic downtown architecture, he recommended that we might also want to go to Pasadena and tour the Gamble House, We did, and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “World class service”
Reviews.Author: imnottan
Reviews.Content: You can tell thought goes into how this hotel opperates, rooms are clean and modern. Staff is always smiling

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCuratolo
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay at Hotel Palomar. Staff was very helpful and courteous, e.g., car was brought up promptly when requested. They held a package that arrived several days before my visit without complaint or issue. Rooms are clean, appropriately sized, and comfortable. Only complaint was pillows were quite thick and hard - uncomfortable. We were visiting friends in Beverly Hills, so location was great for us. Will return again when visiting the BH area.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: MelissaR212
Reviews.Content: The hotel's website and overall positive reviews sold us on The Palomar for a 2 night stay in Los Angeles. The hotel, while not exactly in the boonies is in a no man's land neighborhood which is fine if you're visiting UCLA or there on business, but not for much more. It's a hotel that's trying too hard to achieve cool and seems to miss the mark. The area is mainly residential and practically deserted come nightfall. Our room had a city view, but the windows were so filthy it didn't even matter. Overall, the housekeeping was subpar. Worst of all: The walls are paper thin. You can hear every toilet flush, and the water (sinks and showers) running. Yes, there's a wine hour, which is a nice idea, but basically it's swill. At the rate we paid, over $250., the room wasn't clean, the towels were thin and scratchy, and the room small and stuffy, not to mention the toilet and water noise. That said, the staff is very friendly. In all fairness, I think we were looking for more of a neighborhood vibe, and another area such as S. Fairfax or West Hollywood would've suited us better but the Palomar is definitely overpriced for what it offers. It felt cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadiashahmalik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the Kimpton Brand. Ever since our first stay at the Epic, a Kimpton brand hotel in Miami, we try to only stay at Kimptons. Hotel Palomar is nicely decorated w/ red and black, the rooms are clean, bathrooms are nicely sized and well decorated, and the location is nice. I guess I've set my standards pretty high since staying at the Epic, so maybe expectations are unrealistic. There wasn't anything negative about this hotel. The staff was really nice and the stay was comfortable. I guess I just feel that this hotel was nice but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: SShar725
Reviews.Content: The best I can say is that the hotel room was very comfortable (we stayed in the spa-suite). However, the service not so much. The first two days there was no hot water and I had to call the front desk to inform them. They fixed it within an hour but the same night..same thing. They send another engineer to the room and fixed it. Very inconvenient. The food from room service is not good at all. There was a big water stain on the couch in the room. And after all was said and done, not even ONE complimentary breakfast...they just replied: 'we will inform the management' - guess that is a talking point they were trained to say, and often.

Reviews.Title: “Another Top Notch Kimpton Experience”
Reviews.Author: abrous
Reviews.Content: I booked an overnight stay at Hotel Palomar LA for a romantic Valentines weekend and the staff at the hotel were more than accommodating and attentive. I had reached out to the Concierge, Hami, for some special requests and they were fulfilled to perfection by him and his staff. Not only did they help me make the weekend extra special, but they also upgraded my room because they recognized it was a special occasion. My entire experience at the hotel was most pleasant, from the friendly and attentive valet staff to the front desk and service from BLVD 16 their in-house restaurant. The room was very well kept and clean, spacious and a pleasure to stay in. The hotel itself was decorated in a modern style that reminded me of Ian Schrager hotel designs. This past visit just reinforces my loyalty to the Kimpton group of hotels. I'd recommend the Hotel Palomar to anyone who is looking for a central location in the Westwood area.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel, but the Staff are the Stars!”
Reviews.Author: stugrmi
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights in early February, and I could not find a fault with this Hotel, its comfy, its plush, its upmarket without being snobby, the food is good, the rooms are great, the facilities excellent, including a great outdoor heated pool with seating area and log fire, the wine hour and early morning coffee in the lobby are nice touches, the live music on a Thursday evening was outstanding, the beds are comfy, the toilets are clean and modern, the TV in the room was an excellent size with a good choice of channels, I find it hard that anyone would be unhappy after staying here. But, the thing that makes this Hotel stand out from any other I have stayed at was the Staff, from the door people, the reception staff, the waiting staff, the bar staff, the cleaners, room maids,to the maintanence people, all frinedly, polite. nothing was too much trouble, all prepared to go the extra mile to make the guests feel at home and comfortable, they are a credit to Kimpton and indeed to LA. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough, it really made our stay in LA fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “This is a tough one...”
Reviews.Author: stephanie p
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel is the Palomar in Chicago, so my expectations were set before I got here...I usually LOVE Kimpton properties...they are a splurge for me...but this one isn't great. The staff is friendly, coffee is good...room is clean...but it doesn't feel like a kimpton. We stopped in the bar last night for a cocktail and dessert, and like everything else here, it was off the mark. It was still early, so things were quiet... We asked for a dessert menu, and when the bartender slid it to us, it picked up the pieces of food stuck to the bar from a previous guest, so now we ate looking at a dirty menu... Not appetizing. Again, the hotel is clean, except the bar :-)... I would stay in a location that has intereting shops and food around it next time... I only chose this hotel because Kimpton usually rocks...oh well...

Reviews.Title: “Another comfortable stay at this 4star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: knightline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Polamar for my 3rd time in as many years. I was in a suite - not the top suite, but the only difference is the lack of a jaquizzi in my suite type. The be is very comfortable, the high speed internet works well - and the fitness center if fine. They could use some heavier weights and a bench-press machine - but it is not large enough for all that equipment. It does have several treadmills and other aerobic machines, and they do furnish headphones and water! Great hotel for the price for sure. One thing is if you have a car don't valet park - there is plenty of parking on surrounding streets and if you get lucky you can park right outside the hotel on Wilshire. Otherwise, a hefty $30+ fee for parking will be added to your stay. This hotel is just a couple blocks from Pierce Bros. Westwood cemetery, where stars including Dean Martin, Marilyn Monroe, Burt Lancaster, Jack Lemmon, Peter Falk, Carroll O'Conner, Walter Matheau, Merv Griffin, Natalie Wood, and many more are buried!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, accommodating staff, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: abronxman
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel in a great LA neighborhood. The rooms are well appointed and quiet. The staff was terrific, accommodating and friendly. Every employee without exception made me feel like I was at home. This particular Kimpton felt more like a high end apartment building than a hotel, which makes sense as it is surrounded by luxury apartment houses. I particularly liked the manager's afternoon wine hour and the small but hip swimming pool area. Be sure to enjoy a glass of wine by the outdoor fireplace. Members of Kimpton's frequent traveler program get a voucher for products from the minibar and free wireless Internet. Parking was a little pricey, but the valets were very attentive and prompt. Westwood is bit far from the usual tourist locations, to be sure, but the hotel is walking distance to terrific restaurants and a couple of "off the beaten path" locations. The Armand Hammer Art Collection is just a couple of blocks away. Also within very easy walking distance is Westwood Memorial Park, where Marilyn Monroe rests in a rose colored crypt.

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi, View, & Caramelized Banana Tarts”
Reviews.Author: wanderingmammal
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect weekend getaway-- even for someone who lives in LA! Our Vista Suite was absolutely beautiful with the biggest jacuzzi bath I could have dreamed of. The view was unreal, the staff was lovely, and when one of us wasn't feeling well in the middle of the night we were even able to ask for a humidifier to be delivered to the room. The location is definitely walking distance to Westwood Village, but it's a bit of a trek. Also, if you're planning on bringing a car, be aware that overnight parking is $30 (per night), but the attendants at the valet were very helpful in recommendations of where to find street parking in the neighborhood. Also, GO WITH THE RECOMMENDATIONS given at the restaurant! I was hesitant about the banana tarts but now I dream of them...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayson R
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great.. Check in was quick and easy, rooms was modern and clean.. The service was great except for the wake up call that came at 5am instead of 8am, but they quickly compensated for that by comping the valet parking for the night. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: NoodlesLondon
Reviews.Content: Lobby, bars, service up to the usual Kimpton standards but the bathrooms seem in need of a refresh. The toilet flush is loud enough to startle anyone in the bedroom, hot water takes quite a while and the showers are quite antiquated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality, Price and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Moochiebpaul
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation last minute and got a great deal on a great room! The staff meant all of my requests (a quite upper room with foam pillows) and gave me also a free upgrade. The bed and room was very comfortable . . . a topnotch boutique hotel! I work in this area a few times a year and will look forward to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “nice, but credit card info got stolen and used.”
Reviews.Author: blueskies145
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the hotel much more than my usual hotel in that area (Beverly Hills Plaza Hotel) and it was much closer to UCLA. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The wine hour in the lobby was great. I also was very happy with the coffee in the morning. I heard about the hot chocolate being so great, but did not try it. Early in the morning, I walked in the neighborhood and had a fine time. There is a Ralph's grocery store quite near. Valet parking, while costly at 33 bucks, was fine. THE ONLY NEGATIVE FROM THIS STAY IS PRETTY MAJOR: My credit card information was stolen and used to charge at/for Six Flags Magic Mountain. Fortunately, Wells Fargo is amazing at whatever they do to keep watch over accounts and they called me within hours of the fraudulent charges occurring. One other negative: we called to have ice cream brought up at midnight, on a Friday night, and were told it would be an hour and a half to two hours til it arrived. We didn't wait, but thought it was a bit strange.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: FranklySpeaking53
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel for my son's surgery. We have stayed there before. We checked into 4 rooms for my son's heart surgery. He also brought his dog. His dog got a gift pack at check in. And we got the best service, attentive staff and we truly felt like home away from home. We have stayed here several times for medical reasons. And I've stayed there for business reasons. It is very convenient to everything and although they don't have coffee makers in the room: ask and you shall receive...in no time. But just call the night before.

Reviews.Title: “SoCal Vacay”
Reviews.Author: queen b
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for a girls trip to LA. First things first-when I checked into my room the mirrors on both the entry way and bathroom were dirty, with fingerprints. Secondly the room was dusty and seemed like the attention to cleaning was left unnoticed by the HK staff. I let the front desk agent know this and she did in fact send someone up to clean what should have already been cleaned prior to my arrival. (they do still actually clean rooms in hotels right?) My room was located next door to the elevators AND the housekeeping closet so yes-a full night of the door closing and opening and people coming on and off the elevators. Also the decor of this room is nice, yet aged and worn. I also recieved half full amenities in my bathroom (clearly they didnt feel the need to replace what the prior guest used) Overall I was not satisfied with my stay and when I expressed my disdain for the problems they comp'd 10 dollars off my room service!! YAY (not jumping up and down) The location was great as I have friends in the area but I will def go back to my upscale hotels on my next trip to LA

Reviews.Title: “Great property and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: anamcara1004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for two nights and had a great experience. The location was very convenient in getting to/from LAX, with a taxi ride being around $50 (including tip). There is a private car service which you can use (I used it to get to LAX) and it was a wonderful experience and not that much more expensive than a taxi. The property itself is very modern with clean lines and a nice design aesthetic. I slept really, really well both nights (not something I experience when I travel) and had a very quiet experience even with a room facing Wilshire Blvd. I tried in-room dining for breakfast one morning and had one of the most delicious omelettes that I've ever had. It was perfect portion size but large enough to hold me over for the morning. I felt it was worth the expense as well. Also had a meal in the hotel restaurant, BLVD 16, which was delicious too. The service is really top notch. I wanted to sit in the sunshine for a bit and asked directions to the pool from one young man at the front desk; he walked me to it, didn't just tell me where to find it. Overall, I had a great experience and also have to say, wonderful follow-up post trip. The hotel sent a survey, which I completed and I received a personal email with incentive to visit again. I will actually be visiting again but that decision was made before the incentives!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Mantraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff are wonderful. The rooms are modern and well equipped. Everything is very stylish. There's not much else to say - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton experience!”
Reviews.Author: Roadstraveledfar
Reviews.Content: I am loyal to the Palomar in San Diego, and when I mentioned on my last stay there that I had to travel to LA, I was of course told I should stay at the Palomar in LA. I have to say from start to finish it was another perfect experience! I want to add that they had a happy hour wine tasting going on and I was so excited to see that they also had hot cider with a nip of cognac! I was coming down with the sniffles and the front desk girl alerted me to the "Medicine" the hot cider and cognac were perfect for my ailing body. Thanks again Kimpton for your great service yet once again! I really need to sign up for your rewards program as I am becoming a "regular"

Reviews.Title: “Upscale boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvgreathotels
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Palomar, as is typical when I have stayed at various other Kimpton hotels!!! The hotel is beautifully decorated - uber-contemporary ! All requests submitted to the hotel for my room were honoured [higher floor, quiet, etc]. The room itself was very comfortable, especially the bed!! There was no noise so between the yummy bed and the excellent sound proofing, I had a great sleep. The staff at the reception were very pleasant and helpful. This hotel is near [walking distance] various restaurants, coffee shops, UCLA and Westwood [great for walking]. I do agree with another reviewer that I would have liked a coffee maker in the room so I could have my first morning cups in the privacy of my room in my pj's!! I recommend the Palomar without hesitation and would definitely consider another stay here should I return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good location!”
Reviews.Author: MJKC_11
Reviews.Content: This lovely, smaller hotel is close to UCLA, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and Hollywood locations. Our room was comfortable with a beautiful bathroom, nice view and good bed. It was very quiet. The staff was excellent and friendly. The restaurant was a bit pricey, but eateries are within walking distance. Parking was expensive---only valet parking is possible---but it was fast and efficient. The hotel permits pets and seems to treat them well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ROA2OBX
Reviews.Content: I found the Palomar to be extremely comfortable and welcoming! We were part of a large family group staying there and the staff was gracious to assist us with arranging valet/taxi services for us. The only drawback I saw was that you have to leave your room for coffee - it is available at a complimentary coffee bar right off of the lobby...when I'm on vacation, I like to enjoy thatfirst cup of coffee in my pjs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Winchestermom
Reviews.Content: Funky decorating. Had breakfast and bar snacks in the hotel restaurant - outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Designer Hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: FranckS67
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Palomar Westwood. It's in a quiet, residential location. Our room was modern and well appointed (although I'm not sure about the leopard-patterned robes - a bit too funky for me). The room was spacious and the bed really comfortable. However the air-conditioning unit was rather noisy and we couldn't have it on while sleeping. (This wasn't an issue since we were there in winter, but might be in summer months. Unless it was specific to our room only). The hotel restaurant was delicious: the food modern, original and tasty. We also found there were plenty of small restaurants in the nearby student-friendly Westwood (a 10min walk from the hotel). And for a bit of movie nostalgia, the Westwood cemetery where Marilyn Monroe rests is only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet hotel in the suburbs”
Reviews.Author: Haramkhor
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied overall with my stay however I will say that I could've come away a lot happier had the staff been a bit more friendlier and helpful, and had the location been a bit better. I cannot blame the hotel for its location since we wanted to go to universal studios and I misjudged how far the hotel actually was from it. We asked the front desk staff for info on the best way to get to universal studios. They suggested we take a taxi or that we take their VIP hotel taxi service. An ordinary taxi wouldve cost us $50-60 one way and the VIP service in a private SUV was $80 one way. They did not recommend we take the public transport and didn't really help us in that matter at all so my wife did some research on the net and found rapid buses that takes you to universal studios for 3 dollars p person one way. It would've been good had the hotel staff been more knowledgable in that area. The rooms are modern and clean. The concierge wasn't available on the first two days of our stay (hence our reliance on front desk for info) but he gave us useful information for Beverly hills on our last day which is only a $10 taxi ride from the hotel. Make sure you ask for a room with a view as well. It was our 1st wedding anniversary and I had made a note of that in my reservation but front desk didn't take any initiative by giving us a room with a view. I guess if you don't ask you don't get..The hotel has complimentary coffee in the mornings in the lobby and they also had a wine hour with complimentary wine in the evening after 5pm but we weren't really at the hotel at that time to use that luxury. I would recommend this hotel if you are wanting to do Beverly hills but I would probably stay closer to Hollywood or universal city if you are after universal studios or Hollywood walk of fame etc. The staff could be a bit friendlier. They weren't rude at all but just seemed a bit dazed or too tired to offer a smile. The busy Xmas period was a bit taxing I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “fun, stylish, cool”
Reviews.Author: oscarjr
Reviews.Content: it's a Kimpton Hotel--if you've stayed at them before, you know what i'm talking about. cool. fun. stylish. comfy beds, and great service. the front desk welcomed me back each night as i fell outta the cab and stumbled to my room. it was winter when I visited, so i didn't use the pool. rooms are comfortable and stylish. good array of cable channels. and if you're a member of their loyatly program, you get $10 off the minibar! (great, right?) i'm not so concerned about the location, since you have to drive everywhere in LA anyway. i didn't rent a car, i used zipcar--there's a location just a few minutes by foot. easy! one night i took cabs instead of driving. hella expensive, because i hung out in WestHollywood/Sunset. but worth it, because who needs to drink and drive? free wine hour to get the night started! (sucky though if you're driving). i like it here. i've stayed 2x so far, and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with heart...”
Reviews.Author: bchloverCA
Reviews.Content: I am booking this hotel for my son's heart surgery at UCLA and already I feel more relaxed. The Palomar was not the management last time we had to do this so I won't bore you with those hotel details. In talking to the reservationist, Stephanie, she was able to coordinate my needs for my family that will be staying at different times. I travel often and I'm very particular for both my family and myself. Particularly under the circumstances. Judging from my initial experience with Stephanie and the reviews I'm reading, I know that it is one less thing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: parunach
Reviews.Content: This was a superb place. We had the best experience, right from the beginning. We ended there at 1pm and were worried about checking in early. I asked the valet outside what the check in time was. He gave a grin and said, "Any time is check in time".The room was small but well furnished. The house keeping was good. The location is close is to UCLA and has a lot of restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Style”
Reviews.Author: obispo3
Reviews.Content: The LA Palomar is chic and modern and the staff was all very helpful and pleasant. Pillow top mattresses and light down comforters made a cozy bed. I like the trend toward duvet covers on the comforters. I sleep better knowing the bedding is all fresh and clean. Overall the room was spotless and really attractive, but I'm pretty sure the snake skin pattern on the cabinet would send anyone with a fear of snakes back out the door. Well stocked honor bar. Nice coffee spread in the morning and complimentary wine in the evening. The only negatives I can point to are the cooling system and the bathroom fan. The cooling system is loud so if you are really bothered by that kind of thing you might have a hard time sleeping. Bathroom fan didn't not come on so the mirror fogged up when I showered.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place, good location for Westwood Village.”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Very nice, large room opposite a rather Moorish building, of which we had a good view. An upscale residential neighborhood is across the street also, pleasant to wander about in and enjoy their Bouganvillea etc. There is only coffee or tea for breakfast, but the big plus are the good and inexpensive restaurants in the vicinity. We would go back if we needed accommodation in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “fab fab fab”
Reviews.Author: passportravel
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit and for good reason. It is modern, funky, eclectic, friendly, clean, comfortable, beautiful, great location. Ruven or Ruben, the receptionist was so welcoming and upgraded my room without my asking. Indeed all staff were warm and welcoming. A must for one's visit to LA. Helpful to have a car but the Geffen theater, Tanino restaurant and Novel cafe are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Exceedingly Pet-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: sjkatlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar in Westwood for one night on x-mas with our two small dogs. This is a great hotel, whether or not you travel with pets. It's certainly the most pet-friendly hotel we've visited. We ran into at least a dozen other visitors with dogs of all sizes. The hotel staff sincerely respected our pets; everyone we encountered seemed to know how to deal with dogs and dog quirks (fear, yapping, barking, etc.) Palomar charges no extra fees to bring dogs and no cleaning deposits. We appreciate that they acknowledge the reality that most traveling pets are trained, respectful and less likely to damage a hotel room than the average human traveler. Aside from all this, we were impressed with the Palomar as a stand-alone hotel that we will most likely stay at again the next time we come through L.A. - with or without our dogs. Westwood is a nice place to stay - clean, safe (for L.A.), convenient and fun. The Palomar appears recently renovated - everything in the room was modern and comfortable, from the big bed, good bathroom and large T.V. Our room was relatively quiet and clean. We suspect we were put on a dog-designated floor since we heard other dogs, but we found nothing in our room suggesting that it was less clean or more used (by dogs) than any other room we've stayed in. During our stay we and our dogs enjoyed the complimentary evening wine pouring in the lobby with other guests and their dogs, and then enjoyed take-out with some friends and our dogs in the lobby by the fire.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: OzzieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar on two separate nights - and each was wonderful. A friend recommended the Hotel to us. Rooms were very well appointed, the service from the staff was fantastic, and the complimentary bottle of sparkling wine for our anniversary was much appreciated. Parking was quick & simple and the staff had the car ready in minutes. They were also helpful with finding parking around the Kodak Theatre in Hollywood. Barman was terrific in organising a coffee late at night - free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable choice near UCLA”
Reviews.Author: OutWanderin
Reviews.Content: Generally I love Kimpton Hotels. But this one was only adequate. Pretty much it was a few steps up from a highway motel. The room itself was nice and the meeting facilities functional. The staff was not particularly friendly except for the valets--and I did not have a car. Strangely the only good food was the wine. I stayed at the hotel for a small conference. Breakfast and lunch were the exact same meals every day. The catering setup was awkward especially in the small meeting rooms. Perhaps this would be a good choice for UCLA parents.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay, and room-service was amazing”
Reviews.Author: Julie F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in early November, and I was really, really happy to be there. The staff were most friendly and helpful. The room-service food was extremely good. (I especially liked the steak salad and potato soup!) I should also mention that the hotel's proximity to UCLA was really helpful. A huge "THANKS" to the hotel; I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cobaw
Reviews.Content: I have yet to be disappointed with the Kimpton group of hotels. Check in and check out was a breeze. The room whilst a little small was clean and had wonderful views. Great food in the restaurant - we had breakfast and dinner there a couple of times. Staff were very friendly, helpful and courteous. I will definitely stay there again when I next visit LA. Heading off to a Kimpton in San Francisco - hope it is as good as the Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: USGAB
Reviews.Content: We really like the Kimpton Hotels and this hotel is not an exception. Good situation: You’re in the middle of everything but not close to anything. There are some restaurants in less than 10 min. from the hotel. Ask at reception Good hotel, clean room / bathroom… everything you must expect from a Kimpton Hotels. Park the car: There is only valet parking and the price is expensive. In the surrounding there aren’t so many places (well it’s LA). Hopefully we stayed in weekend and we found place in the street everyday. The breakfast: We got an offer that the breakfast was included in the room. Not a big breakfast but was everything good: Orange juice, coffee, 2 toasts and one muffin. The bad thing about breakfast was service. 2 of the 3 days it take us a lot of time to eat breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Val C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Palomar (14th - 18th Nov 2011). We only ate continental breakfast in the restaurant included in our deal - we found it more than adequate for our needs. We particularly enjoyed the free Happy Hour (5pm - 6pm) in the lobby. The snacks in the bar were similar to tapas and were of good quality and value. The biggest plus for us was the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. Nothing appeared to be too much trouble. We would like to mention especially Reuben in the bar/restaurant who was always smiling and very helpful. Also Raquel in the restaurant who remembered our breakfast orders each morning. A lovely lady. We would recommend this hotel. Val & Peter Carroll, Newbury, Berkshire, UK

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay on Wilshire!!”
Reviews.Author: afronoletravel
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel!! All rooms have a hidden refrigerator, a COMFY chaise lounge that I would often fall asleep on, and a spacious bathroom. I stayed at this property for 14 days/13 nights and the staff was wonderful! The valets are polite and flexible (one had to come up late night to change the linens on someones bed & did a great job!), the front desk was more than willing to go above and beyond, there's a complimentary evening wine hour and sometimes live music (acoustic guitars). PRO: Rooms, views, close proximity to Westwood restaurants, movie theater 2 blocks away, close to Beverly Hills, customer service, pet-friendly (no additional charge), eco friendly, the decor, the lobby with fireplace, fitness center, complimentary morning coffee, tea and hot chocolate complete with white/dark chocolate shavings and a marshmallows and by far the CLEANEST hotel tub I've ever been in! CONS: Valet parking only at $33 a night with little to no neighborhood parking, the staff fails to notify staff when they receive mail (I had 3 packages and luckily knew when they were coming although one had been there a week without my knowledge), BLVD 16 (the hotel restaurant) isn't open past 9:30 pm for dinner, and if you sign up to become a Kimpton InTouch member you may not earn points until AFTER your stay :-( A special thanks to Ruven, the cute scarlet-haired male valet (his name escapes me) and Kristen (the valet who wore the spiffy hat everyday) Random: BB King was placed on my floor during his stay and I was greeted by a friendly Louie Anderson in the lobby. A friend also struck up a convo with one of the contestants from The Bachelor.

Reviews.Title: “Generally what I expect from Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: hsblendo
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy Kimpton hotels and this physical property did not disappoint - pretty/funky lobby, nice space in the rooms, and the attached restaurant was very good for breakfast. However, the staff was not particularly helpful or friendly. When we checked in there was mass chaos due to a cat adoption event, and while I love cats, my husband is very allergic. I expressed concerned at check-in and got an eye-roll and a sigh "it's all contained in the restaurant area." Luckily the attitude didn't ruin the stay. What almost did ruin the fun was the absurdly slow valet service. After a long wait at drop-off and another long wait when we retrieved the car, the valet parked the car in the rain away from the awning--so I got a little shower slogging over to the car. I know hotels outsource their valet services so I'll stick with the 4-star rating but the Palomar should really address that. It was NOT a nice welcome to the hotel. A note on the location, it was a good part of town for our trip to the west side, the Getty, and a play in Culver City (all driving of course). There is nothing in close proximity to the hotel but in good weather Westwood is walkable (but nobody walks... nevermind). If you're looking to cruise Sunset or see Grauman's Chinese, etc., then this won't be especially close. While it didn't knock my socks off, I would definitely stay there again - it's a good value for a good room.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome to be in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: donyayeman01
Reviews.Content: The hotel all in all was great. I liked the fact that I could walk to the UCLA area and back. I like the location of the hotel as well. Pretty much close to the Valley, Beverly Hills, Rodeo, The Grove and of course Westwood. The hotel was clean and the staff was extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TravisMingle
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Palomar and again it was truly a great experience. The staff actually remembered us from last year as we had some good conversations both with reception and restaurant staff. Jose is a first class help and we again were made to feel so welcome We had wine and cookies sent to our room to celebrate our anniversary. After a long flight from the UK this is the reception that you need. The rooms are modern and luxurious. The restaurant staff for breakfast Kyle, Shannon and Raquel or so welcoming and give excellent service with a smile. It was such a pleasure to see them again to see how they were getting on with their studies and life in general. The location is great and on Wiltshire Blvd. To get to Santa Monica - it takes about 25mins depending on traffic on 720 bus which can be caught a very short walk from the hotel. Definately worth doing. Again the same to get to Rodeo Drive, Beverley Hills etc. We used the buses to travel around and felt safe and comfortable however we did just travel around day and early evening ie up to 7pm after that we used taxis. The Palomar is our home from home and the staff seem much happier than a lot of hotel staff - there approach is very professional however very friendly so you feel comfortable and certainly will stay here if I am lucky enough to go to LA again. Great hotel, fabulous staff, great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Dogs in the lobby but a bargain for Westwood”
Reviews.Author: DMilo46
Reviews.Content: On trips to L.A. it's a continuing challenge to find moderately priced hotels that are conveniently located. The Palomar fits the bill nicely with discounts for corportions, AAA, and AARP. It's located a short walk from UCLA on Wilshire Blvd and the staff is very helpful. There is a weird policy regarding pets that leads to a wide variety of dogs in the lobby, some of whom inevitably fight with other pets. The animal motif is continued with leopard skin designs on robes and throws. I have no idea what the notion is here but overall it's immaterial. The fitness center is large and well equipped and the rooms are comfortable. The restaurant is mediocre and over-priced, a bad combination, but otherwise we found this an attractive alternative to hotels in which we've stayed before. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Loved it”
Reviews.Author: baliliving
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel close to Westwood village and all that it has to offer in terms of restaurants and proximity to Santa Monica, Beverley Hills and all the other attractions in LA. As the hotel is on Wilshire Blvd., a tip would be to ask for a room with a view away from the main road, just in case a little road noise may spoil your sleep. The Kimpton wine evenings are a great way to meet fellow travellers over a glass or two of nice wine. They are held every evening so make sure you get a front row seat (get in early!!). In addition to all this we found the staff to be really friendly, and couldn't do enough for you. We're heading back to LA (from Australia) shortly and the Palomar will be our choice yet again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chellebinlouisville
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels and this was no exception. Staff was great, room was great, location excellent, clean, hip. Hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Reviving The Lost Art of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: anastasia92109
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Palomar through their website, and got a terrific reduction using AAA code. The Kimpton Hotel group transformed the old Doubletree on Wilshire from chabby to Tres Chic. From the moment we pulled up in my friend's Prius, we were treated like royalty. The very friendly valet made our day by letting us know that hybrid cars receive half-price parking in the hotel garage! Steven at the front desk couldn't have been more professional or efficient— we were checked in and in our room within 3 minutes. Our room was beautiful and on one of the highest floors, but facing Wilshire, so I called down and asked if they had anything that wasn't on the main drag. He immediately offered to move us, and sent the bellhop up within 5 minutes. We were taken to a new room on the 14th floor which had a lovely view of the valley, and no street noise— perfect! I had asked about good lunch spots nearby, and Steven sent a map and copy of the menu for the place he had suggested with the bellhop. Such attention to detail—impressive! We attended the free wine tasting (from 5-6 every day at all Kimpton properties!) and met a lovely elder gent from the neighborhood. It was clear he wasn't staying at the hotel, but the staff graciously permitted him to attend the tasting. How refreshing—looking out for the local community! We were really touched by the gesture. Throughout our stay, the staff could not have been nicer. Because I am in Kimpton's "frequent flier" program, I got a free $10 coupon for the mini bar- nice touch! Also, the Kimpton hotels are pet-friendly. How cool is that? Our room had gorgeous contemporary decor, was of good size, and the bathroom was nicely done as well. We had a hard time getting a cab from the event we tended about 2 miles away from the hotel, so we called the front desk for help. They not only had a cab there within 5 minutes of our call, the front desk attendant even called back to make sure they had come. She said she was going to come get us herself if the cab hadn't shown up yet. Overall, this was an outstanding experience— one of my best hotel stays ever, and I have been badly spoiled as I worked for MeriStar Hotels & Resorts and got the best rooms, best service, etc. due to my position. The service I received at Hotel Palomar was as good as the suck-up service I received when I was in corporate! Congratulations Hotel Palomar, nicely done!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to UCLA, Print boarding passes at business center”
Reviews.Author: smartiq
Reviews.Content: Really comfortable rooms and beds, bathrobes, but NO SLIPPERS : ( 24-hr room service!!! Complementary coffee in the am. Restaurant. Good map of campus. Good value hotel. Relaxing quiet atmosphere throughout hotel. 24-hr business center access.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute bargain”
Reviews.Author: flora1980
Reviews.Content: We booked this at last minute after deciding driving in LA with a hangover wasn't the best idea & that we'd better stay an extra night. Westwood is quite a cute little area, a few little restaurants, shops & retro looking cinemas. The Palomar was great. Lavish furnishings, animal print robes and nice comfy beds. The staff were all really friendly, felt like the bell boy went out of his way to make us feel welcome and explain how everything in the room & hotel worked. The complimentary fruit water in reception was most welcome & they host a cheese & wine reception each evening. This is also a dog friendly hotel which they make quite a fuss about so perfect if you want to bring your pooch.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: bunny2LondonUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a mix of business and vacation, and would highly recommend. We had a spa suite with a HUGE bathroom, great soaking tub and separate shower. What really made the hotel was the staff - helpful, friendly and kind. The wine hour was nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kumion
Reviews.Content: Overall, good hotel. Staff was very friendly and the room was very nice. I would definitely stay again when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Happy repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: nonstop_8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 6 or 7 times. Sometimes for business, but mostly for pleasure. It is my hotel of choice in the Westwood area. A really cool boutique hotel that is different from the big name brands. I really like the breakfast in the restaurant. I always get the 3 egg omelet for $11, plus a plate of fruit for $5. Also, the small bar always has nice people hanging out there. The bartenders are really friendly and very helpful. The front desk is very responsive and will go out of their way to make sure your stay is pleasant. Also, the doormen are very friendly. You can easily walk over to Westwood village where there are a lot of dining choices. I really like the coffee bar and newspapers available in the lobby in the morning. Always a very friendly group of guests that stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobBrowning
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed in a Klimpton hotel, and like the other one the standard was high. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and the room was large and comfortable. The location was excellent for us, near to Westwood Village which is an easy walk, with lots of restaurants. It is also convenient for the Getty centres. The complementary continental breakfast was fine, and you get free wifi as long as you join their customer program (I can't see any downside to this). Parking is valet parking at $30 a day so you need to budget for that if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Louise096
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. As many have said, location is good - took us 20 mins from LAX (Sunday); close to coast, Getty, Beverly Hills and Brentwood (which we found nice to visit to eat in) etc. Also easy to find your way back to as on a major road!!! The adjacent restaurant offered good food, especially breakfast and service there was very friendly. Was lovely to come back after a long hot day sight seeing and relax in my animal print robe (difficult to choose between the leopard and zebra!) in the lovely pool area - check out the photos it is beautiful! Rooms and beds also v. comfortable and loved the quirky but stylish decor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Robbinwood
Reviews.Content: This property has a great location on Wilshire Blvd. It is close to Beverly Hills and LAX (the drive took less than 20 minutes on a Sunday morning). Loved the youthful upbeat decor......similar to other Palomar hotels. Our room had a wonderful large window that gave you a sweeping view of the City. As with other Palomar hotels there is wine reception in the afternoon and good hot coffee in the lobby early in the morning. Friendly and helpful staff. Easy in and out with your car although the $33 for ovrnight parking seems way too high. For those who want to see where the Movie Stars are "resting" (Marilyn Monroe, Jack Lemon, etc.) the very tiny and very hidden cemetery is .4 miles away, an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: USARicardo
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Very nice rooms. Not very walkable unless you need to be near UCLA. Parking should really be included with room and not $33 extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: amart
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean,clean,clean, easy in and out as you can go around a short block to a light on Wilshire,close to 405, BH's,UCLA, the Getty, and not far from downtown. The staff was the most friendly group ever. Kudos to them. The room was up to date with nice fixtures. Beautiful lobby and bar areas. The best water pressure ever Cons: comfortable but small rooms.
