I had the standard. Small Bath but with a wide sliding door that gave an impression of being larger i'm in a hyatt right now and the bath is not any larger nor as well appointed. The expected but still costly parking. And a nit but the bath products are nauseatingly smelly and I didn't like the cheesy snakeskin dresser.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic staff and some very thoughtful extra's which really added to our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Caseyrieback
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from reviews on trip advisor and we were not dissapointed. The rooms were good sized and clean. The staff were excellent and all the added perks really made our stay, wine hour is great, free use of some trendy bikes, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: jgcl73
Reviews.Content: Great stay but get ready for the $34 daily parking fee + tip to valet

Reviews.Title: “Beware, noisy”
Reviews.Author: ConcernedCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Most of the rooms do not have separate stall showers, but you can get an ADA room. Furniture was not comfortable. Small bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Incredible”
Reviews.Author: jadeheart
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Palomar are super friendly, professional and just downright wonderful! They made my stay so nice while I was there all week. I didn't realize it was a pet friendly hotel and wish I had brought my dog with me while I was on my business trip. The parking is expensive, but there's really no where else to park in Westwood. The fitness center was small, but usable. The rooms are really comfortable, very clean and it's within walking distance to a lot of good eateries too since it's close to UCLA. Easy access to the freeway as well.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Landgraf13
Reviews.Content: A great little spot, conveniently located in the Westwood area and walking distance to shops, restaurants and plenty to do. Nicely situated halfway between the beach and downtown LA/Hollywood. A great vibe and the upbeat feeling made for a nice stay. Having stayed in Los Angeles many times it was nice to try a new hotel with a different look and must say it'd be one I'd stay in if I came back on my own dime. It was an added touch that they allowed dogs and even had a nice sign and display outside welcoming them. I didn't bring my dog but good to know that they'd be welcome into a classy place like that as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a hip, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtakahas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night. The service was excellent starting from the nice hello at the curbside. The room was modern, and the bed very comfortable. Quite modern but not as spartan as a W Hotel. Wifi was free, and the flat screen TV was large and new. Coming from Asia, I can't believe how many HD channels there are in America. I had a complimentary glass of wine at Happy Hour along with a free coffee bar in the morning. The location on Wilshire is convenient, although I could hear the din of the traffic below in the morning. Overall, very good value and an excellent but short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in a great location”
Reviews.Author: elilip
Reviews.Content: Things we liked: The location was excellent, near UCLA in a safe environment. The valet guys pointed out a free parking space that enabled us to avoid one night of valet fees -- now that is great service! Quiet and comfortable room. The decor is interesting and stylish. We were able to sleep two adults and two children (ages 8 and 5) without a problem. When we asked for extra towels, they were delivered within a few minutes. A quibble: The toilets flush loudly and I could hear flushing from other rooms. Very minor issue but thought I should mention it. We did not take advantage of the wine hour, the restaurant or the pool -- maybe next time. We'd definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Vacation Yet!”
Reviews.Author: barbara d
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! The decor and location were great, but besides that, the customer service was impeccable. As I work in this industry, it is expecially easy to tell when someone is being incincere or really does not care. All of the staff, from the valet to the restaurant to the front desk were always 100% helpful and courteous, and went out of their way for me on numerous occasions. Thank you hotel Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful business stay”
Reviews.Author: dlmhi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond perfect for a stay for business in the area. Great rates to be had. The room was always cleaned during regular daytime hours, so I never saw housekeeping...who did a great job - the room looked like I just checked in each day. Easy to sleep at night, no noise at all on my floor. Even though they were sold out the night before, reception found me a room to early check in at 6am after an overnight flight...from a no-show guest. The staff are nothing but nice and very polite. You really feel at home, even during a short stay. And I love seeing all the guests' dogs! I only wish mine was there too! The extra mile amenities were just what I needed for work...free coffee to go in the lobby in the morning, only to be greeted by a wine and shooters reception on arrival back. A nice place to get together and chat with other friendly guests every night...it was always busy enough to be lively but still plenty of nice wine to go around. Enjoyed a late night drink in the bar. Pricy and ok, but it was downstairs so I can't complain too much. Free WIFI and $10 in minibar if you sign up for Kimpton program. This neighborhood is great for a comfortable, safe walk around, including in the evening. Quick, convenient, healthy few a walk away in Westwood Village. There is even a small, beautiful cemetery just a block or two away where many celebrities, including Marilyn Monroe, have been laid to rest. A kind gentleman we met during the wine reception even took us before it closed for the evening to show us around - even wonderful social guests! We received good tips and contacts from the concierge for the few free hours we had. Quick and relatively (LA speaking) cheap cab to Beverly Hills or West Hollywood. Quick $1 bus ride right at the hotel to Santa Monica. Transportation is otherwise a pain without a rental car but that's just LA for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiorgiaDm
Reviews.Content: Great room and the staff is very friendly. Close to rodeo dr and area is nice and safe

Reviews.Title: “Check your Bill when you check out!!!”
Reviews.Author: hikebikekayak
Reviews.Content: Don't just leave this hotel - be sure to check out and check your bill....I was quoted one rate upon check in and was billed for twice the amount. Very dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but BEWARE valet parking”
Reviews.Author: drhealth22102
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar for two nights in August. The room was well appointed and clean. The front desk staff was friendly, and the free am coffee bar was a nice touch. The only negative was the valet parking. I left my car with the valet Friday evening around 10pm. When I received my car the next morning, I saw a McDonalds ketchup pack on the console on my vehicle(below the radio) and 1/8 tank less gas. I never eat at McDonalds. Basically, the valet took my car out for a joy ride to pick up some McDs and whatever else. What they did was horrible. I entrusted the hotel and the valet with my vehicle, and they took it off the premesis for their own personal use. They had no permission to do this. They used my car and my liability. For all I know, they could have committed traffic violations or who knows what. I spoke with the valet manager Danielle Saturday morning over the phone. She assured me that the valet's are reponsible individuals and would not take a guest's vehicle off the premesis. She said that she would investigate the incident and call me back. It's been three days, and I have yet to receive a call from Danielle. This incident ruined my stay. In a sense, I felt violated. I think what they did was criminal. Maybe this happens all the time, but I expected better from this well reviewed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and a great dog vibe”
Reviews.Author: Skubi
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels, and this Palomar is no exception to the chain's track record. This hotel is very well located, right on Wilshire Blvd, but within walking distance to the great village of Westwood. Westwood has a wonderful college (UCLA) vibe, and the shops and restairants are great. The Palomar has a well appointed lobby, and the rooms have a contemporary chic vibe. Great pool, and the staff always has a smile. At checkin, I was greated with a nice glass of wine since I got there during their daily wine social period. My wife and I love dogs, and like all Kimpton properties, they are dog friendly. While our pooches were not with us, the lobby had quite a few 4-legged friends, which added to the festive and welcoming vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Weekend, Beautiful Views, Loved the Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: NYCProducer Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Palomar for a long four-day weekend in July 2011. Was attending a conference at the hotel. Had a very relaxing weekend. The property is on a beautiful location on Wilshire Blvd. It's a few blocks from Westwood Village, a little out of the way from Hollywood, downtown, etc. On the plus side: -- Great views -- Friendly staff -- Very LGBT friendly -- Evening wine reception -- Great restaurant -- Gorgeous bed and linens -- King size bed (I'm 6'4!) -- 42" LCD screen television On the down side: -- No refrigerator -- Slightly understaffed Helix is my favorite hotel brand. I totally love the aesthetic, the properties and the value. Just a little frustrated that several of their properties (Palomar, Helix in DC, others) do not have mini-refrigerators. For the price point, it seems like a no-brainer. I would have loved a mini fridge to keep sodas and juices cold. That point aside, it was a very relaxing experience. The conference staff was very helpful. The front desk was attentive, too.

Reviews.Title: “Our L.A. Hotel going forward!”
Reviews.Author: laurcas
Reviews.Content: Like a recent reviewer, we found Hotel Palomar after another hotel did not meet our expectations. It was a little stressful arriving in a city I don't know well, and having to deal with moving hotels, etc. I cannot say enough about the courtesy with which we were treated from the minute I called reservations, until we left, with our car packed beautifully by the bellmen! Within 10 minutes of arrival, 3 nice things happened : 1 ) It was the hour of complimentary wine in the lobby, and I was served a glass of chardonnay as I checked in....much appreciated! 2) As I'd told my sad story to the reservation person, the manager made sure to have a small amenity, and a handwritten note waiting for us, acknowledging our trouble and assuring us the hotel would take care of us. 3) Our bellman thanked my husband so sincerely for the tip we handed him, it was incredible. That has not happened in a while, I can tell you -- certainly not at the W, just up the street. Our stay continued with us finding the regular room quite small, but no suites available, so we were able to negotiate a reasonable rate for 2 regular rooms, which was ideal for our teenagers and my husband and me. I look forward to experiencing a spa suite or other in the future. We took advantage of hanging out at the pool that night, to watch "Rebel Without A Cause" and drink more nice wine. We had gone to the nearby Trader Joe's for snacks and that was all we needed, no expensive dinner. Met some nice guests. I was concerned about the "Dogs Welcome" policy which attracts many dog owners, which we are not. In fact, our kids are allergic to pet dander. However, the hotel is truly impeccable and the pet owners were very courteous so this was not a problem at all. Running map was great -- took a nice 5 mile run around UCLA. Coffee service in the morning is quite nice -- no Starbucks within a 5 min walking distance, from what I could tell. Our maid left us a handwritten thank you note for the tip we left for her....again, so nice! I am very, very impressed with Kimpton Hotels, having also experienced the Cyrpess INn in Cupertino on the same trip. Absolutely recommend, and will stay here and in other Kimpton properties in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madjack33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in June. Everything was great. The staff are helpful and genuinely nice. We booked a vista deluxe room, but were offered an upgrade to a Spa Suite for only a few dollars more per night. I was traveling with 2 kids, and the spa suite was great. We had a living room, bedroom, and a huge bathroom. Plenty of room for the kids to run around. It also had a great huge soak bath. They do have an outside pool, but it is small. Every night around 5 they have a wine hour. They give free wine, and occasionally other drinks. One night they had wine and sangria. Very nice touch. The neighborhood is also great for walking around. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: traveler4everFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Palomar after leaving another hotel in Los Angeles which did not meet our expectations. Our stay was wonderful. The hotel is located in a lovely area of Los Angeles, just next to Beverly Hills and accessible to I-405. There is a lovely area called Westwood Village down the street which had affordable dining for the five of us, and we even saw a movie premiere with stars taking place. UCLA campus is nearby also. The hotel is luxurious, and offered a wine hour each evening. The suggested valet parking is pricey at $33 a night, but we easily found street parking in the beautiful residential neighborhood behind the hotel. We were there on a weekend, but weekday parking may be a little more difficult. The service was excellent and the gym was adequate for our needs. My only observation was the hotel restaurant needs better lighting as it was very dark. Otherwise Hotel Palomar is an affordable luxury hotel in a beautiful area and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad_DC123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar for 4 nights last week and it was a wonderful experience. I am a very picky traveler and am sensitive to just about anything that can make a hotel awful (specifically, noise, pets and light). The Palomar allowed me to have a well-rested vacation and provided many perks! I was nervous about being next to a loud dog or a room that had residual pet hair from past visitors, so I requested a pet-free floor. I did so upon making the reservation and called to make sure it was received. I think this was crucial since, as noted by other reviewers, ther are indeed a lot of dogs in this hotel. I was put in a room near the elevator and the housekeeping closet, so assumed it would be noisy and I'd have to request a room change. I'm happy to report it wasn't loud at all! The housekeeping staff was super aware of not blocking the walkway, always greeted me with a smile and obviously made an effort to not make a lot of noise opening/closing the supply closet. The valet staff was exceptional. They were quick, friendly and had a great memory about what/where I said I was going. They always asked if I needed directions and knew how to make me feel welcome without being overbearing. The front desk staff was great as well, always quick to help and spent a lot of time helping me figure out the LA bus system. The location is nice -- right on the bus line to Santa Monica and the shopping area in Beverly Hills, plus walking distance to UCLA and Westwood Village, so I was able to leave my car at the hotel a few times. And, naturally, the free wine hour made everything that much better!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Weirdjam
Reviews.Content: This was our final stay of our honeymoon road trip. We stayed in one of the suites which was lovely and spacious, gorgeous bathroom and very comfy bed and furniture. When the helpful man on reception checked us in and discovered it was our honeymoon he sent up champagne and nibbles. Location wise we had to travel to most places but that's the way in L.A. Anyway. Close by is Marilyn munroe's final resting place (walking distance). Hotel is lovely and we would stay in the Kimpton hotels wherever we could!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic LA patch.”
Reviews.Author: Nick D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April and loved the Palomar. Our 3 kids (9, 7, 5) were well received and we were given an amazing suite for under $300. The hotel itself is in a great location, convenient to just about everything in Los Angeles. A short walk away is Westwood village and its nice shops and restaurants. Parking is by valet who are attentive and friendly and bring your car around super fast. The hotel building is a solid mid rise building full refurbished. The room was just stunning - a huge bathroom with hot tub, and a separate bedroom with doors that we were able to close away from our kids. A sofa bed and a rollaway were provided and still there was ample room. Furnishings were funky and everything was designed with thought. We loved the custom designed robes! Staff are friendly and approachable and unlike other boutique hotels they didn't get phased by kids. On the evening we were there, the hotel was hosting an open wine and oyster tasting. It seemed very buzzy. The pool is a bonus. Set at the back of the building outdoors it gets a bit of a breeze so is not ideal on cool days, though for this location at this price it's a real stand out feature. We would love to return to the Palomar. It's a quality hotel at a value for money price and has a real flair and staff with passion.

Reviews.Title: “I believe its the perfect option for a budget concious vacation”
Reviews.Author: Yzigarza
Reviews.Content: i loved the location, the service was marvelous, they have this "one day promo" in which they do a *Magic word* and you say it at the front desk and they give you special prices!!! i would definitely recommend this hotel and i would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently with family after reading all of the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, and getting a pretty decent price. I have to agree with all of those positive reviews- the Palomar met all of my expectations. From the minute we arrived, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We were a little earlier than check-in time, but our room was ready anyways. One of the valets brought our bags up with us and took a few minutes to explain the basic features of the room and the hotel itself. The hotel has a ton of special little features like coffee hour in the morning, wine tasting at night, and a movie in the pool (I'm not sure if the movies are every day, but there was one on the weekend that we were there). We asked the concierge about restaurants and activities in the area and she was more than willing to help. She provided us with tips and maps of the area, and even asked how our day was and if we found everything okay when we returned later that day. Any staff members we passed in the hallways or elevator also were friendly and always said hello. The room itself was very stylish and large. Beds were comfortable and we had a nice view looking out over LA. They do have the high-power flush toilets though and heavy doors, so you can hear those during the night, but it wasn't that bad and there's really not much anyone can do about that! Most importantly in any hotel room though, it was CLEAN. The hotel pool area seemed well decorated and maintained (as did the rest of the hotel), but a bit small. The fitness center was also on the smaller side, but it had enough equipment in it and was perfectly adequate for a few nights stay. We didn't try the restaurant, so I can't comment on that. The hotel is in a pretty central location to a lot of the attractions in and around Los Angeles and is easily accessible on Wilshire Blvd. Westwood Village is a short walk down the street and has a lot of cafes and restaurants. Overall, staying at the Palomar was a great experience and I would definitely stay there again if back in Los Angeles. This was my first time staying at a Kimpton property, but after this experience I'm sure it won't be my last. Definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Westwood Area Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MovieGuyParadise_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business at the Palomar. The hotel is nice clean, safe and well located for the Westwood UCLA area. My only real complaint was they put in a handicap room, which is not particularly comfortable for a tall guy, since every thing is lowered down. The front desk didn't tell me that I was getting a "special room" which should have been done at check in. Most of the staff was very nice, a number of us staying there for the same meeting used the complimentary car service, "tip of the hat" to these guys they did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our California Road Trip”
Reviews.Author: zzzebra7
Reviews.Content: Before booking our stay at the Hotel Palomar Los Angeles I read some reviews on this site. While I expected a nice place to stay on our family's road trip, I was a little worried that due to the snazzy location that the staff might be arrogant and unfriendly to a young family. I was wrong. We were welcomed by the friendliest and most helpful staff. The valet, the bellman, the front desk and other staff that I asked for directions and recommendations were all fantastic. As well as the great staff, we loved the design of our one bedroom suite that had a nice view, had lots of room and had a huge washroom with tub and shower. We used the pool, enjoyed a free glass of wine and found the neighborhood to be convenient and safe. All in all a five star stay. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: danlisa015
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel having read good reviews. However my stay was not as great as I thought it would be. First, we requested a room away from the elevator and service rooms and they did the exact opposite and put us in the room right next to the elevator and service rooms. Secondly, as we were not from US, we called down for a universal adapter. The first time we called they said they'd send one up straight away. 20 minutes later they still hadn't. We called again and then they said they had run out and that we could buy one down the street. Overall, the hotel was average. It was a beautiful and the valet workers were extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence personified”
Reviews.Author: 1happytraveler12
Reviews.Content: I researched diligently, and this property stood out (despite a few negative reviews). I hadn't stayed in L.A. for a few years. I am very picky. This property deserves its high marks. The key is the service. Every single employee, at every turn, whether it's at the front desk, the car park, the restaurant, the housekeepers, the person answering the phone, or the random employee passing in the lobby, greets guests with a 5* attitude. And the property is comfortable, inviting, and edgy. On the weekend it shows great oldie movies on a big screen near the pool, while serving wine. What fun, and a terrific way to meet other guests. I was working, so missed the 5-6 p.m. wine hour most nights, but met so many interesting guests when I could be there. The restaurant food truly is better than most hotel food (moules & frites is as good as any in Paris). The morning coffee bar offers excellent coffee to go. I had a few bumps (bathroom wasn't cleaned or replenished one day, but within 5 minutes of my call, it was fixed). And tonight, guests moved into room adjoining mine via a shared door, and their kid was screaming. I must be at work tomorrow very early. On my second call (kid screeching) the hotel sent a young man up to help move me ( I did not want to have to pick up all my stuff and move, but I need to sleep). I am in a very quiet, upgraded space. The rooms are spacious and clean with attractive furnishings. The bed is very comfortable with high-quality linens and luxurious feather pillows. Bath linens are thick and high quality. I bring my own cleansers, but they offer Etro in colorful tubes. Lighting is better than average. Lots of electrical outlets for guests' electronics, a real plus. Very good set-up for business travelers in the rooms. I cannot understand the negative reviews. I judge any business by how it handles glitches, because things happen. There are a lot of rooms to clean, and housekeepers may forget to check this or that. I care more about the resolution than the complaint. This property demonstrates an amazing commitment to guest satisfaction. I'd love to be a fly on the wall listening to the challenges the cute young staff is trained to handle. My only regret is that I didn't bring my yorkie. This hotel really does cater to pets. Next time . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: knightline
Reviews.Content: Super location - I rented a car but didn't pay the crazy price for valet parking - I parked on surrounding streets - no problem getting spaces. You do have to move your car early in the morning though as most spots are illegal after 8 or 9AM. I had the best suite in the house for about $300 per night - it was fabulous. I was there at a busy time, usually you can negotiate a better price but not during busy times. Still, this hotel is an excellent value for this area.

Reviews.Title: “Another chic Kimpton property.”
Reviews.Author: lilio74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in 2 rooms. The lobby is very nice. On our first night we went to the evening wine reception. They were displaying art and one of the artists exhibiting her work was at the wine reception-- a nice touch to the stay in west hollywood. The staff at the wine reception was extremely pleasant. The front desk ladies were also very polite and helpful with directions. I noticed they have doggy bowls in the lobby, so they are pet friendly. We took a walk to the pool area, not very big, although very inviting to lounge and take some sun. The rooms were well equipped, including very comfortable beds, a nice chaise to watch t.v. in or check out the view of the city, and great toiletries in the bathroom. I will agree with another reviewer regarding valet, they were a bit on the unattentive/snooty side. Regardless, we had a great stay at the Kimpton Palomar and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Boutique. Delightful Experience.”
Reviews.Author: vmsPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is chic, luxurious and well appointed in every manner. My room was a beautiful suite that had everything a guest could need and included a free bottle of water. Yes, FREE! The hotel has free wifi, a business center and a great gym. The location is very conveniently located and I shared the elevator with a few celebrities. Didn't make the hotel any better, but if you go to LA to see celebrities, your chances are high in the Palomar. The lobby has free cookies, wine tasting, coffee and fruit water. You can enjoy these in posh chairs or sofas near the fireplace. I enjoyed my stay immensely. The front desk staff have a slightly haughty attitude but were professional and efficient. I guess it is their "LA state of mind". You will not be disappointed at the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wendytruth
Reviews.Content: I love the Palomar Hotel in LA. The rooms are elegant and comfortable - the TV's state of the art and the amenities top flight. In addition - since my last stay there they have added a complimentary car service that will take you to destinations close by. The staff is wonderful - and again, in keeping with the Kimpton corporate philosophy - makes sure that you enjoy your stay there. The restaurant is very good and if you don't feel like venturing out of the hotel you will not be disappointed. The beds are wonderful - you can really get a good nights sleep. Same leopard robes as in all the other Kimpton hotels. If you are going to the airport they are happy to provide a car service for $5 more than the average taxi ride which is a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Alexander041
Reviews.Content: It's a very good hotel. We had nice stay with very good service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Johns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with a couple of buddies. Nice pool in the pictures but never used it. Good for chill time but not a place to mingle like a pool in Vegas. Really comfortable bed (even the sofa bed). Iced water container at the front entrance is a nice touch too. Pet friendly hotel and we seemed to get a pet-free room as requested.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Up To High Kimpton Standards”
Reviews.Author: TriCoastal
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, chose it based on pix of their pool, which turned out to be terrific. Good location to walk to everything in Westwood, so you can leave your car in garage--definite plus in LA. Not 5 stars because, unfortunately, none of the windows in this converted apartment building open. Fresh air (especially in a wonderful climate like LA) is a must for me personally. For those who don't care about that detail, however, I definitely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, make for great stay”
Reviews.Author: MJT195600
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful experience at a Kimpton hotel. The staff exude a can do attitude. They are very friendly, engaging and give great recommendations. The wine hour is a wonderful way to get to know the staff, plan your next move in a relaxed environment. Rooms are clean and spacious. Good location, only 5 -10 minutes to excellent restaurants, Rodeo Drive. The hotel local courtesy car is a great benefit. Free wifi if you are a Kimpton member, so join up!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: lisa_teany
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to L.A. this past weekend for a family bar/bat mitzvah in Century City, and chose the Palomar based on its location and great reviews. We were not disappointed. The service was impeccable: When making the online reservation we had mentioned it was our fifth anniversary (part of the reason we decided to splurge on a nice hotel during this trip) and were welcomed with a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate-covered strawberries in our room when we arrived. Also, around midnight the night before our event, my husband noticed a rip in his suit pants. He called the front desk to see if they had an in-house tailor, or knew of a place that could repair the pants by late the next afternoon. Instead, someone downstairs took the pants and mended them and gave them back that night! Definitely went above and beyond our expectations. Bed was extremely comfortable. The water in the shower didn't get very hot the first afternoon, but it was much better later. We weren't around to take advantage of the free wine, but the complimentary Mighty Leaf tea in the morning was very nice. Also, we only had to use the valet two of our four nights because we found street parking right across from the hotel (although, if you don't find one of those spots, the only other option is getting your car at 7 a.m.). Overall, I was very happy we chose the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “OK but will stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: watso43
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent in a very nice area that is a pleasant walk to Westwood Village and UCLA. Staff was very helpful and responsive. For example, a burned-out light bulb was replaced 10 minutes after we called, and extra towels were provided--we had three in room and there were towels for only two--quickly, too. Hotel decor is cool-looking but the chaise was too hard to sit on, there were not enough electrical outlets, the bathroom door offered no soundproofing, the tiny refrigerator was too small to get our few groceries into, and there was no coffeemaker in the room. Beds were comfortable, though, and the shower was good. We asked for a quiet room and got it--facing a parking lot, which was just fine. I think the hotel may be more suitable for hip business travelers than for vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “So many little problems”
Reviews.Author: ashlandfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good, front desk staff excellent, but there's a problem here. Our stay coincided with UCLA graduation weekend, the property was booked solid, and lots of little things went wrong: - For starters, the room key didn't work when we got to our room, so we had to wait for staff to come up and rescue us, the get new keys from the front desk. - Service was poor in the bar - it felt like it was understaffed. - The shower head in our room was broken. We had to call and get it fixed. - The hair dryer was broken - turned itself off after a few seconds. - Towels were taken away but not replenished after the first night of our two-night stay. Another call to the front desk. - An appointment we had made for spa services was done incorrectly and had to be rearranged. - There was no coffee maker in the room, so we requested one. Housekeeping took away our dirty cups after the first night but did not replace them, so no coffee the last morning of our stay. - Turn-down service was not performed the second night of our stay. - There was no pen in the room to jot down all these notes. None of these problems were significant in and of themselves and we certainly could have lived with one, two or even three of them. Front desk staff was gracious in taking care of everything and even gave us a small discount off our final bill in light of the problems with they stay. But still, it seemed to me like this hotel was understaffed for the weekend, housekeeping was not properly trained (or inattentive), and maybe there is a management issue here. We wanted to like the Palomar but ultimately have to say we probably wouldn't stay here again. One more note. Part of the reason we stayed here was comments from previous reviews about the ease of parking on side streets. The LA Parking Dept. has placed ridiculous restrictions on parking all over LA and there are a lot of streets where you can't leave your car at any time without a residential permit. We found a couple of streets on the south side of Wilshire where you could park on Saturday night through Monday morning but you would have to move your car Monday at 10 AM. So if you were thinking of street parking, forget it, it is not worth the hassle (except for on Sunday), and add another $30/night to the cost of your stay at the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: sarmufmaf
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Kimpton hotel chain,they know how to make you feel welcome every time you check in.We checked in just when they finished their complimentary wine service which is offered daily to hotel guests between 5:00 - 6:00pm and the front desk staff member offered to bring us a glass of wine to our room (which he delivered personally).The room was very speciuos and comfortable and the location is great, because it is very close to Westwood village and Beverly hills.I will come back to this property for sure when I need accommodation in west L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it up till the end”
Reviews.Author: triplovernj
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar was very nice and right outside of Beverly Hills It was not too far from anything and was within walking distance to the UCLA campus. Everything was great until the last night when a flea bit me while I was standing at the bathroom sink!! Yes Kimpton hotels are pet friendly but that is a bit too friendly

Reviews.Title: “Destination Graduation Infatuation”
Reviews.Author: wannabefrench
Reviews.Content: I am infatuated with Kimpton Hotels now and want to try another. This hotel was a little pricey, but we stayed here for the close proximity to UCLA for a graduation. From the moment we walked in we felt important and were welcomed by the friendly and informative staff. Each night there is a wine reception and in the morning coffee is served in the lobby. The restaurant is very convenient, moderately priced and the staff is wonderful. To top it off, the food is excellent. We were within walking distance to Westwood's little shops and restaurants, and a short cab ride to Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with a great restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: chaddd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location, not too far from Beverly Hills. The rooms are great, clean and spacious. The best part of the hotel is the restaurant located in the hotel - the food was fantastic! Great base for Los Angeles with really friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: whatIKnow
Reviews.Content: Typical Kimpton hotel and hospitality. Too many complimentary amenities to take advantage of - but dont miss the small bites @ BLVD 16 during happy hour. We shopped, toured UCLA and took in a movie and then had a perfect light meal at BLVD 16. Rooms and baths are on the small side but adequate and comfy. Pool is a draw at night especially with the outside fireplace. Convenient to walk just about anywhere in Westwood, we even tried the transit system on Wilshire .or the beach bus as its known. Hotel has a car as well. Windows well insulated from noise on Wilshire. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: jbctraveler
Reviews.Content: First time we have ever stayed at a Palomar Hotel, but will definitely not be our last. The hotel was tastefully done, and the service was fantastic. Rooms are on the small side but more than adequate, nicely decorated, clean & modern.

Reviews.Title: “A Great New Destination in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: locomotive38
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Palomar represented everything a hotel should be. There is no fault to find here; from an extraordinarily cheerful, attractive staff to the restaurant so good (try the Bouillabiase!) that fighting traffic to dinner is unnecessary, to splendid views, one can not propose a more pleasant Los Angeles address. The personnel are infused with good cheer and when they ask if one has had a pleasnt day, there is a strong sense they really want to know. The mechanics of check in, concierge service and check out are handled quickly and without a trace of burden. And who objects to a complementary coffee bar in the morning and an offered glass of wine most evenings in the lobby? And of course, when it is time to buy a child a yellow frisbee, a quick walk to neighboring Westwood gets it done for 99 cents.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: thepieshop66
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through their own website on a rate which advertised a complimentary champagne reception. Upon arrival valet parking is the only option, the valet staff are all very polite and courteous though so this was no problem. Their courteous manner continued througout the stay. The champagne reception turned out to be a voucher for a glass of sparkling wine to be collected whenever. The rooms are small compared to other hotels of the same price, although this is marketed as a 5* hotel i would rate it no more than your average 3*. The room was however clean and tidy. The swimming pool isn't great and not an area where you can go to relax, surrounded by walls and trees. I made the mistake of ordering room service on two occasions. I can best describe the quality as poor for the price. The final straw was when calling to enquire about a late room checkout the next day, it was clear the staff member was less than interested in entertaining my request and whilst i was still speaking they hung up the phone. This i find to be the height of bad manners and was certainly enough to dissuade me from using this hotel again. The friend i was travelling with checked out the next day, when asked how the stay had been he advised the staff it had been poor. No apology, no questions, just a simple goodbye after that. Whilst the area may suit some travellers and the name / reputation may suit others there are certainly far better hotels close-by which rate higher than here!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous - but a little pretentious”
Reviews.Author: rss36
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - but I found it lacking in the usual wonderful Kimpton customer service. I usually get lots of bells and whistles, and I'm missing those here - and I have stayed here both as an InTouch and Inner Circle Member. That being said, beautiful hotel, nice rooms, good restaurant/bar. I loved the one time I got upgraded to a suite, the regular rooms are on the small size but fine. Views are nothing exciting, so don't worry about that option on the menu. It has a nice fitness center and the pool looks nice, although I haven't tried it. I did love the free fitness classes on demand on their TVs. If you want to be in Westwood, it's a great location, still seems random to me that this is the only Kimpton in the LA area, but it's convenient to my work travel. I'll keep staying here - but I just want it to be as great as some of the other hotels in this chain.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, with some nice extras”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: Kimpton's only LA hotel is situated in upscale Westwood, a few blocks from the UCLA campus and a short distance off the 405 freeway (about 30 min from LAX if no traffic). The property is in good shape, very clean and somewhat more modern and larger than other Kimpton hotels I've stayed in. Check-in was efficient and I was in my room on the 16th floor only a few minutes after pulling up out front. Valet is the only parking option here ($30/day) but the valet staff are on the ball and very helpful. Rooms are nice sized; I had a great view looking northwest over Wilshire blvd with only minimal traffic noise. The bathroom is larger than average, spacious really, and well lit. My only complaint is that the shower had a handheld spray head that wouldn't stay in place on its vertical bar and was placed too low for anyone over, say, 5'5" in height. Amenities included a flat screen digital tv, minibar, ipod docking clock radio, and a large safe. The closet includes a full size umbrella for guest use, and the infamous leopard-skin pattern robes. There are no coffee makers in the room, but complimentary coffee is available in the lobby each morning (though you do have to get dressed to go down and get some...maybe wearing one of those robes). Wireless internet access was fast and reliable. For loyalty program members, internet is free, and you also get a $10 coupon per stay to "raid the minibar" -- a nice touch and appreciated, though of course $10 won't get you much! An evening wine reception is also offered for all guests. I had breakfast at the in-house restaurant , which was very good but expensive, even for the setting. Service was prompt at first but refills on coffee lagged. I didn't visit the bar/lounge but it looked like a fun place to hang out. There is a small pool out back; it's very private but in shade much of the day. Probably perfect for those hot days but too cool for the moderate temps on my trip. Finally, they do have a useful service I've not seen before, which is to have your airline boarding pass printed out and delivered to your room with breakfast in the morning if you order it the night before, or you can pick it up at the front desk when you check out. While most smaller hotels will do this if you ask the concierge, it was nice to see it offered directly through in-room materials.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: EFW333
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar impressed me at very turn. Design, service, location and especially the staff were all prefect. When I'm not staying at the LA Athletic Club this will be my second home in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It is nothing to write home about, but it's everything you would expect in a hotel. I would say that it is slightly better than average. I found that the doorman and valet people were very helpful and kind. Opposite experience with the staff at the check in desk. As a Kimpton member, I expected a little more than someone just handing me a key and telling me my room number (literally). The lobby is very nice and chic. You will find ice cold water with slices of fruit as you enter the lobby. You will also find water for your fury little friend, as Kimpton Hotels are always pet friendly. Just $50 extra for your pet. Location is not great unless you are visiting Beverly Hills. The hotel is located between the 405 freeway and the Beverly Hills Hilton on busy Wilshire Blvd. Stay away from that street after 3PM, it's a parking lot. Rooms are average size but the decor is very nice and modern. The rooms and bathroom are clean and fairly new. Check your closet, every room comes complete with a pair of fancy leopard skin robes and matching top for the ladies. All in all, I enjoyed my stay. Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service ! bit expensive !”
Reviews.Author: Isabellepartys
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with nice rooms and great service. The beds are comfortable but pillows were a hard. The staff are friendly and were always helpful. A great stay but a bit pricey for the service!!! Recommended for families visiting LA !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nearly a boutique”
Reviews.Author: Graysgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. It is a large hotel, but works very hard to feel cosy and personal. Good sized room with nice art work, free wifi if you sign up for the Kimpton programme (no fees for that so a no brainer), nice bathroom. Lots of nice little extras like evening free wine in the lounge/reception area, a lovely set of goodies to choose from in the mini bar/room snacks. The restaurant is also very good and prides itself, quite rightly, on fresh seasonal organic food well presented - everything I had was delicious - I made sure I had lunch there before I left for the airport and was not disappointed. And it does not feel like a faceless hotel restaurant. Also while I was there some breakfast elements were included in the room only fee - but ordering from the menu was also a treat. Very helpful staff at all times too. No negatives really - just felt that it was trying a little bit too hard sometimes to be a boutique hotel. Examples of this included the extraordinary faux tiger and leopard dressing gowns (although I missed these at another Kimpton property!!) plus skimpy night gear hanging in the closet and available to purchase - not suitable for a chunky lady like me really. Also lots of goodies for pets in the room stuff so beware if you are allergic to dogs (not a problem for me and a positive selling point for Kimpton I noticed) That said it was an enjoyable and practical stay, and made me feel positively about Kimpton as a brand trying to be a bit different while also delivering a good working hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my needs”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: Checked in here for a one-night stay on a short business trip. Bell staff were welcoming when I drove up, but there was only one person manning reception with three people waiting to check in, which was a drag. This seems to be a feature of several of the Kimpton hotels I have stayed at. At least the guy apologized for the wait when I did finally get to the front of the line. One of the things I like about the Kimpton brand is that they have cocktails every evening in the hotel; another is that as a member of their InTouch program, you get a $10 mini-bar voucher and free internet access. The room I was allocated was on the top (19th) floor and had a nice view across LA. Though not especially large, for single occupancy it was absolutely fine and was nicely furnished. The bathroom likewise while not huge was sufficient for my purposes and both clean & well organized. I didn't use any of the hotels facilities so I can't comment on those. Check-out was early morning - there was a skeleton staff operating and once I located someone, everything was completed efficiently. Overall a satisfactory stay and a decent choice for anyone looking for a hotel in this part of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend”
Reviews.Author: REBELHEART10
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of our Honeymoon for 2 nights, we told them we were on honeymoon so they upgraded us to a higher floor & sent a bottle of champagne & some nibbles to our room, very impressed. Gorgeous rooms, friendly staff, bar & restaurant bit expensive but thats to be expected in Westwood LA. Very safe & clean area & nice to see the pets coming & going. headed off on a cruise frrom Long beach after staying here & on our return decided instead of heading off on a road trip we'd head back to the Palomar for 1 more night. The guy on the desk remembered who we were & upgraded us to a suite on the top floor!! Absolutly fantastic. Having spent 3 weeks in USA on honeymoon I can honestly say the Palomar was the best & friendliest hotel we stayed in and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Shadow
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel Palomar was definitely great and exceeded our expectations. The whole hotel staff was just unbelievable nice, which made our stay very pleasant. The rooms although small were very clean, inviting and well decorated. Nice large flat screen TV was a big plus with our kids. The bathroom was excellent. I also have to say the housekeeping staff did a great job everyday, I have nothing but praise for them!. The hotel is located close to Westwood village around UCLA, which is a great location since it's close to shops, restaurants, etc. In short, we stay at the Palomar with my wife and two small kids and have no complaints at all, it was great! I would definitely go back! Thank you Palomar

Reviews.Title: “Poor location and over priced”
Reviews.Author: VFrequentTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the strength of the Palomar in Chicago (which was brilliant). But we were disappointed with the location, facilities and value for money. Unless you have a car (plus parking costs) it's a decent walk to nearby Westwood. The pool is pokey and crises, gym basic, restaurant not conducive to breakfast and is a fair bit extra. And if you have an evening flight there are no shower facilities at the pool or gym-amazing. And guess what none at LAX as well. We asked if we could sneak into our old room which was not made yet but they were not obliging even for 5 monutes! Again this in contrast with Chicago where the location is brilliant and value for money equally so. I w

Reviews.Title: “Chic, clean, convenient---loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FarOutRanchGirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I arrived and were greeted by very nice front desk employees who remembered my name during our entire stay. Each employee we encountered was very nice. Our rooms were small, but well appointed--quite chic actually. The bathroom sink is a little difficult to use and results in water getting everywhere; however, the bathrooms are very nice and clean. No in-room coffee--which would be my wish for the next visit. The windows do not open, but each room has temperature control which was perfect. I could hear toilets flushing all night, but that may be life in the city. The lobby is very comfortable and lovely---with coffee/tea in the morning and wine hour at night. Parking is expensive ($30/night), just be prepared for that almost everywhere in L.A. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Westwood Mall where there are stores, restaurants, bars and museums. Century City Mall is a bit further, but still quite close. We really enjoyed being in this particular neighborhood and were able to navigate our L.A. and Pasadena destinations easily from this hotel. We loved that the hotel is dog friendly and met some super cute dogs. The few children we encountered were very well behaved and quiet. We loved our last stay at Hotel Palomar in Washington D.C.---this was just as fantastic. Hotel Palomar L.A. exceeded our expectations and really helped make our entire stay enjoyable. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Aquaphine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nicely decorated and the staff was great. The 5pm-6pm free wine in the lobby every day was particularly nice. I had a room facing Wilshire Blvd which could be quite noisy with the traffic. There are several restaurants, a movie theatre and stores within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service but busy street”
Reviews.Author: Jkatajhina
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel five stars but the location is a bit out of the way over by Westwood/UCLA and it's on a busy stretch of Wilshire. However, the service at this hotel was unbelievable. Every person I came into contact with, from the people at the front door to the desk to the rooms was polite and courteous. They obviously had great training. The rooms were immaculate and if you're on a high floor, extremely quiet despite the street noise. You can walk to coffee shops in Westwood but it's about a ten minute walk. The rooms weren't huge but certainly comfortable enough and nicely decorated. We also got free wi-fi as long as we signed up for some customer program.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to get treated poorly”
Reviews.Author: BusTrav106
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of hotels in LA on business and this was the first time I ever felt treated like a second class citizen - I was ignored at check in, room service was awful - service, food quality and was never once greeted by any of the staff during my entire stay. Overall a terrible and uncomfortable experience

Reviews.Title: “A little bit different - in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to UCLA, shops and restaurants. Funky decor and great service! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: teachergirl01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the night with my husband for our 5th anniversary. We arrived just in time for wine hour, and were greeted at the door by a curteous and hospitable staff. We received certificates for two free glasses of sparkling wine at the restaurant, which unfortunately we didn't get a chance to use. The staff was informative in giving us directions to our restaurant that evening, and we were easily able to catch a cab in front of the hotel. The bed was comfortable, good towels and toiletries, and the bell hop extremely polite and helpful. We have stayed in a Kimpton hotel before (in San Francisco) so we are Kimpton In-Touch members. We received $10 in credit to the mini bar in the room, so we took a few snacks for the road when we checked out. All in all a great trip, and we look forward to staying in a Kimpton hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “not as good as hoped”
Reviews.Author: jbeckr
Reviews.Content: plusses: nice enough location. Friendly staff. Very welcoming to dogs. Good restauarant. minuses: wi-fi in room did not work. TV in room did not work at first. Ipod player in room did not work. They asked for feedback via e-mail which I responded to - they never followed up with me. I had heard good things about Kimpton and expected better, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love a Kimpton..”
Reviews.Author: TSamano22
Reviews.Content: Let me just say, if I had more than 2 thumbs, I'd put them up! 4 Thumbs up for Hotel Palomar in Westwood :) I stayed there for 4 nights and do not have one complaint. It's amazing to me how the employees at Hotel Palomar will do anything and everything to make your stay the best. We stayed here for a birthday and our stay was just that.. THE BEST EVER. Anything we needed, this staff provided. Paul, the concierge, was amazing in helping me set up an amazing flower delivery pre-checking in. He even gave us complimentary chocolates and a bottle of wine. I stopped by his desk during our stay to thank him because he definitely didn't have to do that for us :) Rafael gave us a ride to the restaurant Craft in their SUV, and they weren't too busy after dinner so they even picked us up. That was great because we were able to enjoy drinks and not drive. Every time you walk past an employee you are greeted with a smile and a friendly greeting. One day, as we were walking back to our room, one of the men cleaning a room said hello and asked us if we wanted a glass of wine; so he delivered two glasses of white wine to us :) I could probably go on and on about the great things but I won't. Ok, ok.. one more thing, when I checked in they asked me if I wanted to be a member of their InTouch program.. I accepted and received free internet services during our stay along with a $10 voucher for the food bar. What other hotel does that!? Certainly not the Hilton or Marriott (which I am members of). It boggles my mind how Hotel Palomar in Westwood is ranked #7 in Los Angeles on Trip Advisor, the Hotel Palomar in Philadelphia is #1 and this one should be too. Not one thing went wrong, they made it their duty to make everything go right. Thank you Hotel Palomar, see you the next time I'm in LA!!

Reviews.Title: “Extra Special without Paying Extra”
Reviews.Author: Winger2010
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be by the 405 because we had an early morning flight and didn't want to stay near LAX -- how monotonous would that be for two nights! Westwood was the logical location and TripAdvisor reviewers ranked the Palomar quite high. Price was also a consideration. We made our reservation and kept our fingers crossed. The Palomar had all the amenities we expected: pleasant room, comfortable lobby, friendly, helpful staff, and good location – just steps away from UCLA, the Hammer Museum, and Westwood Boulevard with its variety of international restaurants. But the Palomar's Unique Selling Point is this: you can enjoy the little extras without having to pay extra! When we checked in, we decided to join the Kimpton Club because members get free Wi-Fi. We were also given a voucher for two glasses of champagne plus a mini-bar credit. With those perks, we were ahead. But the nicest surprise was the hotel's cocktail hour featuring a free wine bar. Between 5:00 and 6:00, guests gathered in the lobby for conversation and red or white wine. It was hard to imagine that just beyond the front door, rush hour traffic whipped along Wilshire Boulevard. We're not cheap, but we like to get what we pay for. We belong to HiltonHonors and other hotel frequent user clubs, but for the most part, all they give is one free bottle of water. At least Kimpton made us feel like we were appreciated for having chosen them as opposed to the hundreds of other hotels in the area. In this economy when hotels struggle to keep their occupancy rates high, the Palomar Hotel goes the extra mile. When guests often feel like they’re being nickeled- and-dimed to death, the Palomar gives quality and value. For this reason, we’ll return.

Reviews.Title: “$30 per night parking fee and $30 daily tax makes this a poor deal”
Reviews.Author: mdsrvs
Reviews.Content: We didn't realize until we arrived at the hotel that there would be $60 in extra fees per day added to our $200 per night room. I consider that an outrage. And one botel of water is $6, M&M's are $3. The rooms are tiny but attractive. Other aspects of the hotel were good - location, service, cleanliness, and appearance - no complaints there, but the added fees overshadowed everything. We would not have stayed there had I known the parking fees, which were not advertised online when we reserved our room. Maybe $30 is standard for LA - I don't know - but other arrangenents would have been made had we known.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: kwilliams40
Reviews.Content: Although using Hotwire is a crap shoot, boy am I glad that it was this hotel. This was my first time in LA and the experience could not have been better. We had a car, but we were able to find street parking, which is free and without restriction on Wilshire between Selby and Manning. Parking on Manning you'll have to move every two hours, but can park after 6pm until 10am the next day. I know they say the charge for parking is comparable to surrounding areas, but $30 + tax and don't forget tip per day is a bit much. That being said, the valets there were very friendly and greeted us each time we approached the hotel. I heard the hotel had been recently renovated and it showed. The lobby was nice. We loved the strawberry water and the free coffee and tea each morning. The rooms were exceptionally clean. Not only could I see that our room was clean, it smelled clean when you opened the door each day. I loved the toiletries in the bathroom. We had lunch in the restaurant and we were not disappointed. Prices were reasonable for lunch and the sandwiches and potato salad was devine. The complimentary use of umbrellas provided in our room was a nice touch and needed, considering it rained our first night there. We walked to Whole Foods nearby and bought fruit and snacks. We ordered room service on our last night for dinner. I don't think the same chef was there. My club sandwich was greasy and my sisters salad hardly had any chicken but we ate most of it anyway because we had an early flight. I went to the business center to print our boarding pass for the next day and discovered that it would cost us approximately $7 to use the computer and print our passes. I called the front desk however, and they were able to print them for us. Since they already provide free in room wi-fi, which I love, there should be a way to print the boarding pass, since wireless printing technology is out there. All in all, our trip was awesome and this hotel played a big part in making our stay enjoyable. The location is central to anything you came to LA to do, so if you don't want to see the sights then get away to have a restful sleep, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, especially if you're going to an event nearby.”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalCruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend with our daughter & her family, while our daughter was standing up at a friend's wedding. The staff was very helpful with arranging adjoining rooms, a toy for our granddaughter, a crib, and late check-out to accommodate a nap. I have no idea if this is a convenient location for anything but a wedding nearby because we didn't really go anywhere else. There was a children's park within a mile and the area is lovely to walk around (though no one in LA walks), and there was a great restaurant not too far away that accommodated the adults and our grandchild. There was a heated pool which was a great way to spend some time with our granddaughter. The restaurant staff was very kind and allowed her to have run of the room. The food was also good and fairly reasonable, a double bonus. The hotel offered wine every evening to guests.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but disappointed to get no reduction after staying for 17 nights”
Reviews.Author: melVienna
Reviews.Content: good location, bus station is near the hotel, but would stay in another hotel for sightseeing or family trips, comfortable beds, breakfast was ok, room on the wilshire blvd. was loud, had to stay one more night and asked for a reduction because I was 17 nights there, at the reception they told me they have to ask the manager, but they did not, had to pay the full price of around 220$;

Reviews.Title: “Westwood address with great value”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel right in Westwood in walking distance of Westwood Village. At $150 (exc tax) p.n., this was great value. The rooms were spacious with modern appointments and free wifi. There is a nice gym I used a couple of times. I thought I would have to pay $30 p.d. for parking but decided to look for parking and was surprised there was little problem to park free overnight on the street (around the corner from the hotel) especially if you plan to use the car during the day time. I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel that exceeded the great reviews on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: noosamode
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar as we had read some great reviews on Trip Advisor and I have to say that the hotel was even more than we expected. The service was fantastic as was the the room. We had a king suite which had a separate bedroom and queen fold out for our two teenage daughters. For an LA hotel it was quite sizeable (particularly the huge bathroom which is a bonus when there are three females!). The girls did have to take the mattress off the bed and put it on the floor however it would have been fine with only one person in the bed. Overall it was a fabulous experience. We chose a Kimpton hotel in San Francisco also and that too was a good experience. Would highly recommend Kimpton and particularly the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lindapilkington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our 3 week honeymoon in America. Our second week was spent in LA at this wonderful hotel. It is slightly more expensive than other hotels, but the hotel itself, the location ( 10 min walk from westwood ) and the staff make it worth every penny! Before travelling, I had regularly been in contact with Rosa Chavez who had been incredibly accomodating and helpful, and she had set the bar to a very high standard to which I was not disappointed! The valet staff are very friendly and helpful, nothing is ever a problem, and they will always point you in the right direction. Any questions we had, the reception staff were fantastic, when we needed something printed out, they had it done in less than 5 minutes. Needless to say we did not want to leave! This was our first time in LA, and we will definitely be back, and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Arielarafe
Reviews.Content: I had a package that I need to received for business and they immediately gave it to me the minute that I checked into the hotel and checking in was extremely fast. Reception took time to tell us where we need to go for coffee and food even though it was a hike since the location of the hotel was in a suburban area of LA. I kept forgetting that LA is very spread out and being I am from NYC, I had a different perception when they told me Starbuck is "close"... Staffs were very professional and when my colleague accidentally left her wallet in our parked car, they were able to retrieve it within seconds when my colleague called and put it in a safe place for her to get it later. The only reason that I gave it a four star is the decor since it's trying really to a whimsical boutique hotel but in a weird way from the leopard pillow to the weird looking blankets...those I could easily do without. I felt like they were trying a little too hard...and the bathroom is a little run down compared to the rest of the room...other than that, it was a really an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Love Kimpton; close to a 5”
Reviews.Author: Bhbobd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the weekend after attending a conference in Vegas. This was the perfect post Vegas weekend. The Palomar and it's relaxed vibe was exactly what we needed. Blvd 16 was nice for lite meal on first night. Location was walking distance to Westwood village and UCLA, and walked over to a basketball game at Pauley Pavilion. Pool area was great with nice fireplace and course the wine hour is favorite happening at Kimpton properties. Only thing keeping from a 5, was that the valet parking is $33 a night with tax and did not seem as though there is a self park option or it was not offered. We are Kimpton In Touch members and always recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmariemadison
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Hotel Palomar with a friend for a girls weekend away in LA. There isn't much as far as restaurants right near the hotel- but a few options about a 10 minute walk away in the Westwood Village area. There is a Whole Foods in that area which we took advantage of one night to get a light dinner and also some munchies to have in the room which we were able to store in the fridge. There is also an in room safe which was a good place to keep valuables during the day. As many have noted this is a nice central location to get to everywhere else in LA you may want to visit with a short drive assuming LA traffic doesn't get in the way. It is worth signing up for the Kimpton priority club before you get there- as we were offered free wireless internet as well as a $10 mini bar credit upon check in. Another note- We had a car but didn't need to use the valet at all which saved the $30 per night. There was street parking available every evening at the first major street past the hotel. It was 2 hour parking that started at 8am so we just needed to be on the road by 10 am each morning. There are many other hotels that we saw which were a bit more in the thick of the LA scene but we weren't really visiting for that- and this hotel worked well for our purposes. Great value compared to other properties I looked into and the service/rooms were great. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel at its finest”
Reviews.Author: sambachica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for the MLK weekend while attending a family event. We were impressed by the amazing service that we received. The valets always had our car at the ready. The front desk staff was very friendly. Room service was delicious and prompt. The rooms were beautifully decorated with comfortable beds. Bathrooms were pristine. We had a view of Century City all the day to the ocean. We even took a long walk through a residential neighborhood on Sunday morning. Very good location. Near the 405 and just blocks from Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, great value"”
Reviews.Author: NivaldoPizzinato
Reviews.Content: Near UCLA campus, minutes away from Santa Monica Blvd and 3rd Street Promenade. If you love sports and shows, it is very easy to get to the Staples Center (it is a straight line on Wilshire Blvd, not close but it is easy to get there). The hotel is also near the Getty Museum, which is great. It is cheap to get there on taxi. The rooms are very nice, modern, well decorated. It creates that kind of environment you want with your spouse on a weekend alone. Staff is very kind. They offer wine on afternoons, very friendly. Not exactly a bargain but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Lknight17
Reviews.Content: Pack your bags and book your stay at the Hotel Palomar. My teen daughter and I had a fabulous 2 night stay at the Hotel Palomar in Los Angeles. Kimpton staff are the best - accomodating and gracious. We loved the location, with just a short walk to Westwood Village and the UCLA campus. The decor was fresh, staff friendly and willing to help, and the valets on top of things. We especially loved that we got to have a bowl of popcorn delivered to our room even though it was not on the menu. Apparently they had an event and had just enough left for us - just what we needed to satisfy or need for something savory, while we curled up on the bed to watch the Golden Globe Awards. Thanks Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jrharrison
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar for a business meeting and wanted something a little different. GREAT decor, staff great and very helpful. The room was stylish and very clean, with a huge flat screen T.V. the beds are super comfortable. Did not have time to attend the Wine hour which everybody raves about - maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Zebra dressing gowns”
Reviews.Author: Y2CLL
Reviews.Content: Great Westwood location. You have to drive anywhere you go in LA and this hotel is easy to navigate from to Beverley Hills etc. Rooms are boutique in style with zebra dressing gowns and fun decoration. Newly decorated and well kept. Free Internet and $10 mini bar credit if you sign up to Kimpton rewards. If I stayed here again I would try to get a room on a higher floor as there is some traffic noise - but let's not forget this is a busy city and noise is not uncommon. Breakfast is simple but service needs a little attention. The valets and concierge were excellent. Why don't we have valet parking in England? what could be nicer than after sitting in LA traffic than hoping out of the car right outside the hotel door and going straight up to your room to crash out!

Reviews.Title: “We had an Excellent time!”
Reviews.Author: HrnFROG
Reviews.Content: I was with the tour of TCU (Go Horned Frogs!!) and want to write what an exceptional time we had! Even getting in late that first night the service was prompt and we checked in so quickly! I also was wanting to write having seen the review that was posted by another guest. We were also served by Nicole. I am shocked that anyone would write that she was angry. She was attentive, polite and even wore our teams t-shirt (which she told us she had sewn the night before) She cheered with us and was delightful. Whom ever that other guest is, he must have been the angry one or upset- perhaps a Badger!! Sorry you lost the game. Either way, we had a lovely time and will be coming back if we ever need to visit the area again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare for shocking neglect by the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: glennatalberta
Reviews.Content: Here is the text (abridged) of the complaint we sent to Kimpton and Palomar. Beware – you can make a reservation, but you may be left without a room or help: I recently had an experience at The Palomar in Westwood, which may interest you. By way of background, I am married and have 2 children…. I travel often. Our family is financially comfortable. My wife and I are both professional people. We do not look for problems or inconveniences in our lives. We are patient, understanding and well mannered. My family has stayed at The Palomar in Westwood a number of times. We stayed there on December 18 and 19. We had a reservation to stay there on December 31…. We had booked our room well in advance. On December 27 Caitlin Ross of Kimpton emailed my wife to confirm our reservation, which we did promptly - the same day. Ms. Ross responded the same day indicating that she looked forward to welcoming us back soon. We were looking forward to it as well. The Hotel had my wife's email and phone contact information. We arrived early on December 31 - around 1:30 pm. We intended to drop off our luggage and spend some time in LA. When we arrived on December 31, we were told by Danielle DeHostos, apparently the Manager on duty, that there was no room for us at The Palomar at all that day. There was a reservation, but the hotel was overbooked. We were told that, instead, a reservation had been made for us at the Sportsmen's Lodge in Studio City. We were told that the room had been "comp'd". The letter / voucher that we were given for presentation to the Sportsmen's Lodge indicated that The Palomar was prepared to pay $159 for our stay at the Sprtsmen's. We went to the Sportsmen's Lodge in Studio City (a 45 minute drive with traffic), and were not prepared to stay at that hotel or in that part of LA - not even for free. It is not a comparable hotel by any stretch. The Sportsmen is …. [not to our standards, with] no valet, no doorman, no secure parking, and our room was on a smoking floor that smelled like 20 years of smoking. My son has respiratory issues, so the heavy smoke smell alone made the Sportsmen unsatisfactory. There was no elevator in the building that we were apparently to stay in. We had lot of luggage that we would not have been prepared to leave in the car. The broken street sign and the falling down front entrance at the Sportsmen were indicators that the Palomar didn't think much of us or our standards. I can spare you the balance of the details, but the Sportsmen does not meet our travel requirements. Let me know if any of Kimpton's executives would ever stay at the Sportsmen's Lodge with their family - I doubt it. I can't even understand why that was presented as an option for us, or why were not asked in advance whether that would work for us. We phoned Danielle at The Palomar a couple of times over a few hours to get help making alternative arrangements. My wife left a message for her. Danielle was on the phone. Danielle did not return the call. My wife later left a voice message for Danielle. The voice message indicated that we would not be staying at the Sportsmen, expressed our disappointment, and requested a return call. Danielle never returned our calls - still to this day. This level of neglect in all of the circumstances is shocking. After finding a Starbucks where we could look up other hotels that might have a room on New Year's Eve, we eventually found a Marriott in Long Beach (an hour drive with traffic). These events wasted over 4 hours of our time between driving and searching. Our plans for a day in LA were substantially changed by these events. We still haven't received a return call from Danielle. We don't need one now. To be clear, we were always prepared to pay to stay at a reasonably nice hotel - that should have been obvious from the fact that we were prepared to pay to stay at The Palomar. Given that we were in our car with nowhere to stay on New Year's Eve by no fault of our own, we were only looking for help in finding a satisfactory hotel to stay in - we were looking to get that help from the people who would know the hotels in the area and who had put us in the sorry position that we found ourselves in. If we had had any advance notice of the problem, as opposed to a confirmation of our reservation, we would not have needed that help at all. We are quite capable of booking a hotel room. I can't fathom how you could make a reservation, and confirm it, but not honour it. I can't imagine that the problem was only discovered on our arrival, in part because there was a letter personally addressed to my wife ready on our arrival. I can't understand how we could not be alerted in advance to the problem so that we could participate in a solution at our leisure by looking for other accommodations, rather than finding out on New Year's Eve on our arrival. We had responded to your December 27 email promptly, and our reservation had been re-confirmed. We had been staying in Palm Springs, and could have easily stayed there another night and avoided so much worry and inconvenience. Instead, you opted to wait until we arrived (surely earlier than most guests) on New Year's Eve, and then left us with a ridiculous "take it or leave it" option, which included ignoring our calls. In the circumstances, being abandoned on New Year's Eve in LA when travelling with children was completely unsatisfactory, uncaring, callous, and far below anything that we could reasonably expect.
