We paid for our stay in Long Beach - it was not "comp'd", as Danielle would not even return our calls. Ironically, it cost us $139 per room - less than the Sportsmen's. We booked two rooms to ensure our comfort. Frankly, we were not looking for a "comp" anywhere. I can pay for my hotel stays without any difficulty. We were looking for help in making things right after your apparent error in making and confirming our reservation, but then finding yourselves unable to honour your commitments and unwilling to provide us with sufficient advance notice of your error. Instead, we were ignored and left to our own devices in the grossly inconvenient circumstances of finding ourselves travelling with children on New Year's Eve with nowhere to stay and trying to fix the problem while operating out of our car. There are very few things that annoy me. These events annoy me from beginning to end. It is not the failure to honour the reservation (which is bad enough) so much as the absolute neglect that ensued. You put my family to inconvenience in the worst way that you could in the circumstances, and then treated us like trash thereafter. Shame on you. If I had any notion that this was the level of customer service that you would offer when dealing with an error that was entirely yours, I would have never, ever taken the risk of doing any business with you - especially not when traveling with my children. Being ignored is never an acceptable option for me. The fact that the incident is over now does not change the fact that we were ignored in circumstances that called for your attention - it remains unacceptable. To be clear, I don't need your attention now as it will do nothing for me other than take up more of my time. Please do not send me a sincere, heartfelt apology or a token of your after the fact remorse. I have no need for platitudes or charity. I do not need to know about any remedial actions that you have taken. An acknowledgement that you have read this note would be a nice touch. The purpose of sending you this note is solely to be fair to you by letting you know what happened. I do not want anything from you. My intention is to communicate with others who might be interested in how you treat your guests, as I'm more inclined towards making the world a better place. I enjoy that luxury. I wanted you to know in advance why that was going to happen and the source of it. I would not hide behind anonymity in doing so. I won't stay at your hotels in the future. I can't take the risk of the uncertainty and neglect involved.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: karsmex
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 2 kids (3 year old and 1 year old) and my nanny. We started the journey from South Korea and our final destination was Mexico City. So we decided, it would be best for everyone to stay some days at LA because of the long flight and we needed a good rest. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood, close to the airport, good restaurants. The concept of the hotel is weird but nice. The staff is incredibly nice and very helpful, they suggested places to visit, eat and shop. (Especially the valet parking staff) The room a little bit small, but confortable, especially the beds. The only problem we had (other than the jet lag) was that the walls are paper thin. When we wanted to sleep we could hear our neighbor snoring, and when he was watching TV we could hear everything he was watching, so it was not plesant. And I am sure he could hear my 1 year old daughter crying at night, so I think it wasn't pleasant for him as well. This might be silly. but my 3 year old boy didn't want to use the bathroom because when we flushed the toilet it sounded really hard, so he got realy scared, it sounded creepy for a little boy. The other thing we did not liked, was the swimming pool, it was really small and we couldn't get any sun. Other than that, and eventhough it is not a familly hotel, we did enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “All-around Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: jjone005
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience as an adult in Los Angeles, CA. I arrived with several plans: 1. To visit Southwestern Law School 2. Visit family & friends in surrounding areas 3. Important Business meeting 4. Explore the city of Los Angeles The main reasons why I chose this hotel, besides the impressions of other reviewers on tripadvisor, was the free wifi, wine hour, and location. Little did I know, but Hotel Palomar would provide all that and much more! They literally bend over backwards from the time of your arrival until your departure and I never felt like an outsider. They made me feel welcome, the rooms and my view of the city was amazing, and I enjoyed the food from Blvd 16 as well! Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and will also recommend it to colleagues that travel to Los Angeles for business too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: cdspencer
Reviews.Content: I must start this review stating, "I LOVE Kimpton properties"! Reserving 10 + rooms from the very accommodating Rosa, my group was not disappointed in the service, location, or hotel upon check-in with the exception of a small incident with a member of Kimpton's valet corps. Brought it to the MOD's (manager on duty) attention and it was resolved IMMEDIATELY. With that being said, I was in Los Angeles for a short turn around trip and didn't get to the hotel until after 8:30 pm. The manager, noting my tiredness (dead on my feet tired!) offered to send a complimentary glass of wine to my room to relieve some of the day's stress. As I had looked forward to the wine hour and then missed it due to work, I, gratefully accepted! I can't tell you how much I appreciated his observation and thoughtfulness..... this is the type of service that keeps travelers returning to the Kimpton hotels time after time! Upon rising the next morning, the documents I had been waiting for had been delivered to my email in the early morning hours while I slept. As the doc's had been promised to me by the night before so I could make 500 copies by 9:00 am the next morning, the front desk offered to make the copies for me (small charge to my room) so I wouldn't have to waste time looking for a Kinko's, etc. Once again, how do you spell G-R-A-T-E-F-U-L! It's this type of service that Kimpton is known for, but this hotel went beyond the normal expectations you would associate with a Kimpton property. My hat is off to the staff! Traveler's who want a world class experience in a small boutique property that exudes, friendliness, charm, professionalism, superior dining and great staff should not pass up the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Palomar - Westwood. I guarantee you won't be disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Nice all around--location, place, ambiance, value”
Reviews.Author: DeDeDo
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. One of children graduated from UCLA about 10 yrs ago and this place would have been very nice back then. Very good location, attractive, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: didoooz
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were great, for quality /price u really get for your money, rooms clean and special amenities that can b delivered to ur room.

Reviews.Title: “All around great property”
Reviews.Author: RichieCMontreal
Reviews.Content: I am finishing up a 5 day stay as I write this review. Simply put this is a great hotel if your travels take you to LA. The hotel is located on Wilshire Blvd. in Westwood which is a location that is quite central to most of LA. The 405 Freeway is just a few blocks down the street. The first thing you notice upon your arrival is the wonderful service. The valet was helpful and very friendly, in fact 2 valets got together to empty the car within a couple of minutes. Check in was immediate and smooth. The hotel itself is well decorated and spotlessly clean. The lobby is small but has a very homey and welcoming feeling. The rooms are very nice with stylish furnishings. They are a good size. It struck me that the rooms look brand new, there was not so much as 1 nick even on the furniture which is quite odd for a hotel that has been open for a little while. It is obvious that this property is extremely well cared for. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on with great linens. I travel over 400,000 miles a year and spend roughly 200 room nights a year in hotels and this bed rates as one of the best. The bathroom is a nice size and looks brand new. They have great towels that are soft and thick, hard to find even in some of the best hotels nowadays. The shower has great pressure which is a welcome change for a hotel shower. The amenities are terrific (Aveda). Another great touch is that there is a list of available toiletry items in the bathroom just in case you forget something. As it turned out I forgot my deodorant and called down to the desk. A new deodorant was brought to my room within 5 minutes at a cost of $3 which is a normal cost. I hate when hotels take advantage and rip you off. The housekeeping is second to none as well. My room was cleaned by 10 o'clock every morning which is simply outstanding. I have been to so many hotels in which you walk into your room at 2PM and it has yet to be done which is terrible. The housekeepers were very attentive as well realizing that I liked the bed without the decorative pillows on it and doing that every day. It is that attention to detail that makes this a great property. There are also small touches that mean a great deal. There is a welcome back greeting every time you return to the hotel from a member of the staff. They make you feel very at home. There is very cold water with fruit in it set up all day in the lobby, nice touch. If that wasn't enough they serve hot chocolate towards the end of the day, given that it was so cold in LA for the 5 days I was here that was a welcome treat. Last but not least they have a free wine reception from 4 - 6 every day in the lobby. I did not use the pool but went to see it and although it is small looks quite nice and the water was very warm. I am Kimpton in touch member and received free wireless internet for my whole stay, it is probably the fastest and best hotel internet speed I have ever had in a hotel. They also game me a voucher for $10 for the mini bar. Another great value touch. The Valet parking is $30 per day but this is normal for any big city. It is just the way it is at city hotels. Given the great value they give you with everything else it is a small price to pay. It is important to keep the free internet and $10 voucher for mini bar in mind when calculating the actual cost of valet parking. The final piece of the puzzle that makes this a great property is the cost vs value. Their rates are very reasonable while providing you with a great deal of value. It is obvious that this hotel is extremely well managed. All the little touches and details are looked after with great care and attention. Both Albert and Caroline along with their staff do a great job of making this property truly great. I would highly recommend it to any one coming to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with really nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: relco
Reviews.Content: I stayed three times at this hotel during the past 6 weeks during a particularly difficult time. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. They really went out of their way. The room was very comfortable and quiet. Good complimentary coffee served in the lobby in the morning and also complimentary wine from 5-6. The restaurant was excellent as was the bar. I swam most mornings and had the pool to myself.

Reviews.Title: “They treat you like a friend!”
Reviews.Author: dcborn61
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Kimpton hotel, and I couldn't recommend them more enthusiastically. There is a warmth and friendliness that permeates the entire experience. The front desk staff welcomes you like a long lost friend. From the maids to the valets, everyone makes you feel like they are happy you are there and eager for you to return. For the quality of the hotel rooms, lobby, and location, it is an incredible value and so much nicer than staying at a larger "name" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Celeste105
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Palomar it was great. The temperature was 39 and we were greeted by free ice-cream and lemonade and our suitcases were taken to our rooms. A wonderful holiday and a wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: slce123
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Great Location. Rooms nice spacious but decor abit kinky. Tiger & Leopard strip bathrobes(and ladies and men's underwear!) in the closet. Snake skin on furniture. Naked pictures and nude statute lamps! Don't bring young kids. Restaurant surprisingly inexpensive for big city hotel food. But parking outrageous at $30+per day. Very good location on Wilshire Blvd. Long walk to UCLA but walkable. Exercise room minimal hotel. Outdoorpool small with hot tub. But mirrors surround the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great- hotel!! Once again Kimpton doesn't let me down”
Reviews.Author: kevinm77
Reviews.Content: Clean, Modern, Great customer service, are just a few highlights of this hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, a 5* if only they could get the service to be more attentive”
Reviews.Author: travler595959
Reviews.Content: I love this property and it's location. The rooms loke all Kimpton Hotels that I stayed in are comfortable, well equipped and have nice interior design, the food is excellent. The front desk staff is very friendly as well as the bell boys. Sadly there's a fly in the ointment - room service, my partner called the front desk asking for a shampoo to be sent, she waited 30 minutes, then called again. After another whole hour passed - still no shampoo ..... this experience is a repeat of a simolar one we had waiting for clean towels during a previous stay at this property. This should not happen in this property and the manager needs to have a look at this so the property can be what it should be - a GREAT boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Night Sleep”
Reviews.Author: smep013
Reviews.Content: One night stay as part of a business trip and felt welcome and relaxed. Staff was welcomming from time of arrival to morning of check-out. I felt very comfortable here and would look to stay here again, for business and for pleasure. I did not have the opportunity to use any hotel amenities, but we did pass through the evening wine reception and it looked like a nice offering. Room was large and well appointed... and bed was comfortable. Loved the decor. Could not locate a closet in my room. I know it sounds funny, but the one door was the comjoining door and the other was locked (? - maybe the AC unit?) We did have a rental car and it was always ready for us when we were ready to go! Loved the Aveda bath products!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AeJUk
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, situated within easy driving distance of Santa Monica, Hollywood and Universal. Lovely rooms, friendly staff and though the pool is small it was sunny and it had very comfortable beds (though only 7/8 of them). Wine hour was great - red or white served in the lobby between 5-6pm. We ate at the Napa Valley Grille just one block up and it was very good. Can't fault it really.

Reviews.Title: “stay stay stay”
Reviews.Author: doebag41
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and friendly. Hotel is well situated a short distance from Beverly hills etc. Rooms were spacious and spotless. Go out front door, turn left, about two blocks up on left hand side you will come across Westwood Memorial Cemetery. Intered there are a few 'unknown people' eg Marlyn Monroe, Dean Martin,Burt Lancaster, Roy 'o', jack lemon, james coburn, Farah Facett, George C Scott etc the list goes on. Well worth a visit. the palimino restuarant is also nearby. In a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay but be quiet in the pool!”
Reviews.Author: strfdtravllr
Reviews.Content: It has been several months since my extended family of 10 stayed at the Kimpton. We had three rooms and they were able to accommodate us side by side. We really liked the location, the wine hour, and the stylish rooms. Check in was efficient and the woman at the front desk was very nice. We checked out the cocktails at the bar and they were inventive and delicious. Although the hotel is stylish, it is in no way snobby- I was expecting a bit of a cold shoulder, as we were a group with 4 children, but the welcome was warm. The kids (they are 16, 11, 10, and 8) loved the print bathrobes and the fruit infused water in the lobby. My only issue, and it did kind of put a damper on the night, was an issue that happened when the kids were in the pool. It was very cold (only about 15 C) but it is colder in Canada where we were coming from, so the kids went for a swim at around 5 pm They were having a great time playing "shark"- with lots of squealing, splashing and laughing that goes along with fun in a pool. (I should add that we were the only people in the beautiful pool area, as it was cold). The adults were sitting and talking around the outdoor fire and the kids were in the pool playing. It was 6 pm. Suddenly, a neighbour (the hotels pool area butts up against a residential neighbourhood, but due to a high wall and clever landscaping, you don't really notice) started screaming over the wall for our kids to shut up or she would call the police. Yep, at 6 pm on a friday night, the sound of children having fun..call the police. She yelled at us a few times. A few minutes later, a Kimpton employee comes out and tells up that they had a complaint, could we keep it down. We pointed out the time, and the employee agreed but still asked us to be quiet, which kind of put us off. We left the area soon after, the fun having been sucked out of that experience. I think if you live next door to a very large hotel, and about 100 feet off Wilshire in LA, you are used to a little noise...no? I guess it was the sound of children's laughter that was the problem...I can't imagine the neighbour was sitting outside, as it was chilly. Not the hotels fault, but a drag nonetheless. Needless to say, the kids didn't want to swim again in the remaining days we were there. A good hotel, clean, stylish, and in a great location. Just try to hold back on any joyful noise.

Reviews.Title: “Underperformed - Probably due to these inaccurate Rave Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: lawyerkelly
Reviews.Content: I need to preface my review - a majority of my bad experience was due to the greeting we received at the front desk. First impressions do count. After conducting major research, I had very high expectations of this hotel. I was under the impression that I would be given first-class service. Boy, was I wrong. I am a faithful Yelper - I review everything. I myself own a service-based business, so I always go where other travelers rave about the service. My personal pet peeve is inflexibility in service. When we checked in at noon, the girl at the front desk was pleasant. But she wasn't overly enthusiastic, nor was she particularly nice. I requested a complimentary upgrade based on availability. Before she even checked, she said, "We can put you on the south side where it's quieter, but that's about it." I told her we lived in the local area, and just visiting Westwood for a short stay. No response. I told her I am a Bruin and just coming back to visit! No response. I told her that I had high expectations of this hotel, based on the reviews I read on TripAdvisor, and that I am a faithful reviewer. NO RESPONSE. (Um, isn't "charisma" part of the front desk job descrip?) Anyway, I finally asked if there were "suites" available. She said, "Yes, but there is a upgrade fee of $99, but we can give it to you for $40". I said ok. 5 minutes later, the upgrade fee became $ 49. (how did it go up 20% in 5 minutes?) Since I was tired, I didn't argue. I read about the $1 upgrade for all these amenities. I asked her about it. She snidely told me that that was for customers that paid online their best available rate. Then she added, "You definitely didn't pay what the room is worth". Ok. I admit, I booked on Priceline. But 1) So what? and 2) How does she know how much I paid? For all she knows, I overbid and am paying more! Mentioning this gave me a bad taste in my mouth. Ready to jet to my room, I asked her for my child's gift. The Palomar website touted that all kids get free "kid gifts". She said that they "ran out" of these gift packages and then gave us a basket full of dinosaurs and bracelets. My husband took a dinosaur, and I reached for a bracelet, and she gave me a look like, "No, you can't take both". Finally, I asked for a crib and a high chair. (The website said that you can deliver a high chair to the room for in-room dining). She said no, we don't do that. I said, "It says you can." She said, "No.". Then this other lady said, "Only in our restaurant". HOW HARD IS IT TO GET A HIGH CHAIR TO A ROOM? Especially since you say you do that on your website??!? They DID later deliver the high chair, but it was like pulling teeth. The hotel is pet-friendly, which is very nice. However, a pet-friendly hotel has consequences. There is an "animal" smell in the halls and carpets, and there is hair in the carpets. Our room - a spa suite - was pretty spacious. The set-up was nice, but personally, I thought there was too much clunky furniture. Also, I am not particularly fond of snakeskin (the cabinets have them). The decor is definitely very modern, and I realized I prefer traditional. I am not fond of red doors and such. The bed was comfy and it was pretty clean. The location was very close to UCLA - walkable, and overall, the hotel is very nice. We paid approximately $250 with taxes for the spa suite, and I thought the value was worth it, especially in this area. $33 for parking sucks. Internet is not free. The rest of the staff that we encountered seemed very helpful and genuinely nice. I guess we just had bad luck at check-in. I don't know. I think overall, it is a nice hotel. I was overly excited to stay here after the rave reviews on service. I think my expectations were probably a bit skewed because of the reviews. Since we are local, I don't think we would stay here again. We just wanted a quick getaway and didn't really get blown away by service.

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar Hits All The Right Notes!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrank
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We stayed one night post-cruise in order to visit the Getty Museum which is conveniently located a short distance from the hotel. Generally we prefer large chain hotels, that offer a standard product with few surprises but we thought we would try our first Kimpton Hotel due to it's location, glowing reviews on Tripadvisor and having been impressed at the ambiance of the lobby of the Palomar in Philadelphia. The staff, both at the door and front desk are some of the most friendly and efficient we've experienced, not what you generally find at a "boutique" type hotel. Before I could pay the taxi driver, our bags were already out of the cab and in the lobby. We had requested an early check-in and the request was cheerfully honored. The bellman accompanied us to our room and was full of information about the hotel, the room and the surrounding area of Westwood. The room was stylish and sparkling clean, with the largest flat screen T.V. we've experienced yet in a hotel. The large window let in plenty of light and sun with a beautiful view of Westwood and the Mormon Temple, which is lit up at night and provides a beautiful backdrop to the room. The beds are super comfortable and the hotel is quiet. The public areas are also pristine and nicely appointed. We were given access to the courtsey car and the wine hour is one of the most generous features we have yet experienced at a hotel. BLVD 16, the hotel restaurant provided an amazing dinner (which we've reviewed in the restaurant section of Tripadvisor). Alas we had to leave the hotel at 7AM next morning to catch an early flight, the bellman was at our door within 5 minutes of our call, and even arranged a car service for us to LAX. Our only regret was that we had to leave so soon. What can we say, the Palomar far exceeded our expectations and we look forward to staying at Kimpton Hotels in the future. Anyone not happy with this hotel should stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Fast Valet & NIce Rooms”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay to drop my daughter off at UCLA - was there for 4 nights. On arrival, we were tired from long drive and decided to relax at the pool; to our surprise there were 2 business meetings going on there. Not sure why they allowed this, as it made us as "guests" feel a little uncomfortable lounging in our suits and swimming. Lounges at pool are great and albeit there is limited sun, we were able to relocate to sun. Pool was a little cool but refreshing. Service was absulutely astounding; everyone was really ready to please - so refreshing. Didn't really like having to valet park the car at $33 per day (with tax), but the service was very fast. Enjoyed the location, as it gave me an incentive to walk around the area between the hotel and UCLA; loved the walks! Was a little hard to remember the location at night when driving back - all the high rises on Wilshire look the same at night - luckily I remembered the cross-street (Selby) with the light! Room was comfie, but it got a little warm at night - finally changed the AC fan to "hI' and this helped a lot. Used the mini-bar as my personal refrigerator (put the stuff in the closet) and liked having a room safe and easy access to ice. Would stay here again. Free internet would have been nice (instead of $10 per day). But the front desk did my searches for me, and printed me out directions as needed. Check-out day was pirate day which looked like a fun idea!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: scarletpolyglot
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, receptive and quick to respond to requests. When we ordered room service, the food was excellent. As for the rooms, we were extremely comfortable - no complaints. The hotel bar is very classy and the bartender, in addition to being cheerful and welcoming, makes excellent cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Some great things - others not so much”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: First the good: I stayed here for 3 nights with my teenage daughter, while visiting local colleges. The Front desk staff were wonderful upon check in and very helpful with driving directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. Overall, I found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is also in a great location if you need to visit UCLA or have business in the Westwood Village area. A word of caution - we found the Westwood Village area a bit seedy, MANY homeless people wandering the streets an harassing patrons of the local restaurants and shops. The village itself seems to be in need of a business boost - many of the storefronts are empty. Where the hotel fell down - simple things that one takes for granted: The order form for breakfast (the door hang tag) was left in our room on the first night only - didn't receive one for the remaining two nights. The hotel offers a complimentary wine tasting most evenings - there were empty wine glasses left in the hallway for two nights - yuk! We NEVER received turn down service or fresh toiletries. The bath linens are really cheap and thin - really almost bare - some upgrading in towels is necessary. It's a good, serviceable hotel and good value. Having said that, if you can afford more, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable ini all ways”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: Moved here from Intercontinental (which I hated) - should have booked this in the first place, as I had stayed in Palomar in SF which I loved, and this one was perfect. We arrived prior to check in time, so left our bags. When we got back we discovered that we had been upgraded to Presidential Suite - WOW. Everything was absolutely perfect. The staff , without exception, couldn't have been more helpful and the accommodation was great. Even if we hadn't been upgraded, this hotel is wonderful - quirky and unique. We stayed in lots of hotels on this trip, but this was the highlight.

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar is my "go to" hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Belleau
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA a few times a year because of its proximity to UCLA. I've stayed at other properties just to become more familiar with the hotel offerings in Westwood, but I always come back to the Palomar as my #1 choice. The rooms are stylish, so comfortable, and just big enough. I really like the decor in the restaurant, it feels intimate without having that dark, heavy feel. The evening wine offering is great, as well as the morning coffee. Sometimes it takes a while to get your car when they are really busy, but they try hard! The staff aims to please.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and rooms; great value”
Reviews.Author: SouthernHospitality2
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Palomar in early September. It was our first time to LA, and we found the location to be very good for sightseeing, even though LA is huge and there's no way to be close to everything. It's located in Westwood near UCLA, just a few short minutes from Beverly Hills, Bel Air and West Hollywood by car. Lots of very trendy restaurants, bars and shopping within easy driving distance, as well as some of the most exclusive neighborhoods. It's near the 405, so although it was a 30 minute drive or so to Malibu and those beaches, it was very easy to get to and not really that far for LA. Only about 20 minutes from LAX (without traffic). Only downside is that there aren't cafes or bars immediately adjacent to the hotel, but the area around UCLA is packed with these and is only a few blocks away. As for the hotel itself, I really have no complaints. We got a good deal to begin with, and upon arrival they offered to upgrade us to a suite for just $38/night, which we accepted. The suite was great - quiet, roomy, trendy and modern (like the rest of the hotel), but tastefully decorated (not obnoxious as sometimes occurs when hotels try too hard). The bed was fine, even if not the best I've ever slept in, and the living and bath areas were very spacious and well furnished (the bath had both a walk-in shower and huge jetted tub as well as double sinks). Very large flatscreen televisions located in both the bedroom and living room area. The staff was also great - very friendly, helpful and professional, even the valets. They immediately fixed the only (minor) problem we had - apparently the housekeeper forgot to leave washcloths in our room, but these were quickly brought up. Although we did not partake, the bar and restaurant looked nice, and the hotel had a complimentary wine happy hour each night we were there. Nice touch. In summary, I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay in this general vicinity, especially if you can get a competitive rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfort, a little bumpy for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: teainthesierras
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel and the staff is excellent. It's within a nice 3 or 4 block walk to the Westwood business district. If you stay on the upper floors you'll not hear any traffic on Wilshire and you'll have a great view. I really liked it. The wine hour is cool. And if I ever go on vacation in L.A. I'd definitely consider coming back. Although, the Internet didn't work in my room when I arrived but the staff got it working. If I were a vacationer that would not be such a big deal. But on one small point which is actually important for some business travelers, the Palomar's pricing model is not such a good fit for companies like mine that budget travel in advance. I'd rather pay $200 a night and have everything included (parking, Internet, business services, morning coffee, etc.) and no worries, then pay $150 a night with $50 in unanticipated costs. It's nice to return home and not have an accounting task figuring out my allowable hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GOOD KIMPTON PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: We wanted a good hotel where we knew the bedding would be great after flying in from France. We did not want to splurge. This why we booked this Kimpton property, as we have never been disappointed before. We drove right from LAX, were greeted by courteous and prompt valet & bellmen. Check-in on 7/31 was very swift and we got the 2 room categories we had reserved for 2 nights. We were very happy with the style, the atmosphere. This is the usual Kimpton fare, really. Rooms are adecent size, not huge, but far from cramped. Print bathrobes, compact bathroom with quality (but scarce) amenities. Very comfortable beds. Excellent service throughout : front desk, valet, restaurant, they all genuinely smile and make you feel welcome, without being invasive. The restaurant has no window, and is decorated in a very dark pattern of brown. Feels gloomy to me at breakfast. Good menu, but not overly inventive, and servings are on the smaller size, unlike the prices. Check-out was again swift. Slight mix-up on the check : I was driving a rented hybrid, and being charged for a 'normal' car. I pointed this out and this was corrected. At time of reservation, the web site advertised free valet for hybrids. The correction made was 50% of the normal rate. As I again pointed this out, the guy at desk said it was a new rule for summer. RIght ... How should I know about this ? I did not discuss this, $30 make no difference really, but I do not care for this way of doing things. Mind you : today, I could not locate any lower valet rate for hybrids anywhere on their website. Seems to be gone. Although they offer free in-room internet, I had not brought my laptop, and used the business center for 5 minutes instead. As itwas not appointed with a single pen/pencil, I printed one page. Must be the most expensive printing in my traveller's life ! But I knew before I get there, so no surprise. Anyway : great property, beautifully managed and I would return, given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place for older children”
Reviews.Author: lmtak
Reviews.Content: We chose the Palomar after much research and based on reviews from friends that had stayed previously. Join the In Touch loyalty program before you reserve. it allows for many perks when you arrive/reserve. We got free internet and continental breakfast during our stay. that was the promotion at the time. Also a 10 dollar mini bar rebate (not much, but a nice touch). Hotel is dog very freindly, with water bowls and welcome signs for the dogs. Rooms are quite roomy, we were three woman in the room and had lots of space.Bathrrom was good size and stalked with items. Not many electrical plugs for electronics...The hotel also has a long list of "if you forgot" stuff free of charge. Location is about 1 mile from santa Monica Blvd, which is a main thourough fare to most sites and streets. Westwood village is a walk away with UCLA there. brentwood is a two minute drive and Beverly hills even less. Took abaout 10 minutes to drive to great shopping and trendy areas. Meter parking on the streets where we drove and lots of good lots. Only thing that bugged me was the 33 dollar parking fee. Valets suggest that there is street parking, but not many spaces and not really convenient. Most hotels that we looked at had similar parking fees. Pool is not great either, being situated inthe middle of 2 buildings, so not much sun. No ceoffee machine in the room, but coffee bar in the morning in the "receptionarea" and wine and sangria hour in the same from 5 to 6.( both free). Staff all around , were sensational!!! All problems solved in minutes and with a smile..Contnental breakfast was deliscious and fresh and out dietary restrictions were wll taken care of.....all in all a great hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with wonderful staff - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CharleyCharley
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend the last night of our vacation in SoCal here and what a great decision that was! From the moment we arrived we were treated so well by every member of staff that we came across. The valet/porter who helped with the luggage was so charming. The concierge was friendly and helpful... and as for the hotel and rooms itself - well they were beautiful!! Tasteful, quiet, sooo comfortable and loved the wine hour too!! Everything about the Palomar was amazing especially the wonderful staff! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hotel Palomar for a full week and I was very happy. I have found that a lot of the hotels in the LA area seem to be older but remodeled, this one was not. I got great sleep and you couldn't hear people in the room next to you. If you have stayed in LA you know this is a common problem. The staff went above and beyond at every turn. I don't have any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put, a hotel that has gone to the dogs in more ways than one”
Reviews.Author: seri0ustraveller
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up to the mandatory valet parking in front of the hotel there was a complete bottleneck that lasted 15 minutes as people unloaded their dogs and accoutrements of their dogs from their cars with the help of the hotel personnel. The hotel room service was completely lacking in that we called about four times in one hour and no one answered. When the guest service desk interceded for us to contact the kitchen we had to wait a half hour before we got a call back. We then wished we hadn't ordered anything because the after 9:30 pm menu was limited to extremely creamy and high calorie goop masked in cheesy sauces that were quite tasteless and just plain slop. The beds were some of the most uncomfortable and hard mattresses that did not lend themselves to a pleasant sleep but nightmares. My back was killing me when I finally got up in the morning. The location was completely residential and no restaurant in sight to walk to on a pleasant evening. We would have like a bistro to sit at or night club to get a drink at but nothing was close enough. Deserving of only two barks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in LA. Nice rooms..

Reviews.Title: “THE best experience!”
Reviews.Author: KWIZHartford
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from a harrowing trip up the coast from San Diego (I was alone with my 2 kids)...Josue checked us in, smiling, professional. Actually took the time to notice my 7 year old was cold, and shivering - -asked if he was o.k. Five minutes after we got to our room there was a knock: Josue himself - -with a mug of warm milk for my son, fresh cookies, a glass of wine for me and an apple tart! What an amazing person, and what wonderful service. We never felt like "just another hotel guest". Entire stay was like this -- great desk staff, a courtesy van brought that us to the Getty Center, and even to pick up dinner at a take out Thai place! One of the best of all the wonderful Kimptons at we've stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: stoi1
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best services we have experienced in any of the hotels my family and I stayed before. Receptionist accommodated our early arrival. Paul the concierge was great with restaurant recommendation and booking a tour. The room was nice and the beds very comfortable. Located very conveniently between Santa Monica and Hollywood. In all very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Asked for a king bed and got 2 small double bed”
Reviews.Author: kolany
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to LA for a wedding. When I made the reservation online I chose a king bed. Of course when we checked in, I didn't bother to confirm they were giving us the correct room. When we got to the room, surprise. We should have asked to be changed, that was our fault, but we were too tired to bother. We didn't sleep well in the doubled bed because for 2 people, it is not roomy. Then when another guest for the wedding came, she wanted a room with 2 doubled beds but they told her she could only have a king bed. Doesn't make sense. The hotel overall was nice, hotel stuff very cordial. The pool was mostly covered by the big wall shadow so not too appealing to get in the pool. The location is ok, not too close to restaurants and shops, so you do need a car, but again, in LA you do need a car to go everywhere. What I was more disappointed about my experience with a Kimpton Hotel is that I contacted them after my trip to tell them about their mistake. The first time I didn't even get a response, but after my second attempt, all they did was to reply to my email with an apology and hope that i will come back and have a better experience. If they really want me to come back, should they offer something as an incentive when there are so many other great hotels?

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: ItalophileNJ
Reviews.Content: We had two "Vista" rooms in this lovely hotel. The room was a decent size, if not overly large, with space for clothes and a well fitted out bathroom. The hotel has a pool; I didn't see it but my (adult) daughter said it was nice, although seating area is small. Service was pleasant, with particularly helpful concierges and fairly quick retrieval of cars. My one complain would be the restaurant; it would have been nice if it had been possible to get more casual meals there, and if lunch (as opposed to an all day breakfast-like brunch) were served weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault, this is a flawless hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AKATCambridge
Reviews.Content: Such a fantastic experience. The hotel is in a lovely area of LA , the service is amazing and the hotel itself is the perfect balance between a chic/modern interior with an element of true comfort. The staff at the desk were very helpful ptoviding us with insider info with regards to great places to eat and playparks in the locality. My 5 year old son was welcomed with a rootle in a toy basket (so that was him impressed). The parking is valet and therefore not cheap at $33 per night but that is the same in any hotel with valet parking. But other than that, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, stylish, great service, AND free wine hour!”
Reviews.Author: Grace99
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is hip, stylish & service minded. Our room was spotless. The pool was dreamy. Free lemonade & iced tea is a lovely perk. The wine & sangria hour is reason alone to choose this hotel. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, convenient location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: KellyK0510
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for our LA vacation over the 4th of July. Our first contact with the staff at check-in was wonderful. We were offered an upgrade, told where the nearest fireworks display would be and given a room on a high floor that would allow us a great view for the fireworks later that night. Our room was immaculate; extremely clean and plenty of towels. The next day, housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room and even arranging our toiletries nicely around the sink. Upon calling for our car, it was always waiting when we arrived in the lobby. The valet even pulled out your seatbelt for you. Little things like this make great service, in my opinion! The location is convenient to the 405 freeway and in beautiful Westwood. I have lived in LA before, so we were able to easily get around. If you are looking for the Hollywood vacation scene, it may not be the best location for you, however keep in mind this hotel is in a much less congested area of Los Angeles and you'll spend a lot less time in traffic here. Not to mention this is a gorgeous hotel! The beds were very comfortable and, as with every Kimpton hotel, we were provided nice cushy robes, too. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: JMACKSD
Reviews.Content: The service was the most stellar part of this hotel. Every single person on the staff we encountered were always smiling and making sure we were taken care of. The location is right on the edge of Westwood. If I was traveling alone, it would be walkable to the heart of Westwood, but with young children, that just wouldn't happen. The rooms were very modern. Clean bathrooms with plush towels and nice fixtures. Not your standard drab hotel room. The only thing was the room felt a little on the small side, maybe it was our specific room, it was on a corner and just felt tight. Nice extras, not sure if these were seasonal, but complimentary coffee/tea in the morning, iced tea/lemonade in the afternoon, and a wine hour in the evening. Nice touch, although we didn't have a chance to make ti back for any of the wine hours, so I can't say much about it. The $33 valet parking is a little steep. We tried to look for street parking, but didn't have any luck. I would have preferred self parking, as we were in and out quite often, and when I add the tipping to that $33 per day price, it ends up being over $40 per day in reality. The one disappointment I had with the hotel was the pool. It wasn't heated, and although it was a nice mid-70's day in Los Angles in June, how the shade moves the pool was completely in the shade in the afternoon and it was just plain freezing. No hot tub. However, the chaises loungers were comfortable to relax in, and there was a fireplace. I'm not sure how old this hotel is, but I get the feeling that this was a bit of an afterthought, and they are probably doing the best they could with the space. It's just hard with such a tall building blocking the sun. So as long as you aren't looking for a nice pool vacation, this is a great little hotel. Close to action in Westwood, Santa Monica, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and Fairfax.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: SpeedSki
Reviews.Content: I lived in Westwood 4 years while attending UCLA and was anxious to find just the right place to stay when coming back for a wedding. The Palomar was just right. It is relatively new and well kept. Although quite plain on the outside, much attention has been paid to the interior. Very modern looking, and comfortable rooms. Easy walking distance to all that Westwood Village has to offer. We were looking for a place to eat because the hotel restaurant was not open yet. One of the staff immediately produced a walking map with mutiple dining options on it. The staff was very friendly and helpful without any attitude. We came to attend a wedding at the Mormon Temple in West LA and I had requested in advance a room with a view of the temple. Also had requested to be on a upper floor for less traffic noise. The woman who checked us in gave us several options to make sure that we got an upper room with the view we wanted. We had no complaints on the room or the service. The only small downside was that the parking options are to park on the street (Wilshire Blvd) or to do valet parking at $33/day. Self parking in the hotel's 4 level parking garage would be a nice option. Overall, a very good value for the location and how new and clean and nice the rooms were. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jaw dropping customer service, terrific hotel...couldn't ask for more....”
Reviews.Author: Inluvwithjapan
Reviews.Content: This sums up our visit to the Palomar Hotel (Westwood). As we checked out and the valet brought our car to the circular drive. One valet, loaded our luggage and the other valet opened the door for my wife. Nothing out of the ordinary. As we sat in our car and about ready to pull away, the valet saw an old drink in our cupholder, and two coffee cups about ready to search for an empty cupholder...the valet asked us if we'd like him to toss the old drink for us...AND then, he pulled the shoulder/seat belt harness so that my wife could secure herself in the car. Now, how many places do the little things like that for customers? Just typical customer service things that took place during our entire stay. Hotel is terrific, staff is perfect and the hotel rooms are exceptional. I can't say enough good things about the attention to detail here. One of the best kept secrets in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: x_clien_x
Reviews.Content: me and my friend went to this hotel! and it was like heaven! verry nice people! verry clean! delicious food! and verry big and clean room! it was a dream for us! we really wanna go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality boutique hotel that would recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: pinchivida
Reviews.Content: Went for Memorial weekend with my girlfriend. We got what we wanted, The room were perfect with good quality and perfect beds. We layed by the pool all day and it was perfect, you feel like its your own private pool, with not much people around. Ordered food by the pool and I could say is one of the best pancakes I have tasted. I wish there was someone that would stop by from time to time to see if we needed anything instead us having to call them everytime we wanted a beer but besides that service was excellent. Location is perfect blocks from Rodeo Dr and 3 miles away from Getty Museum which I recommend to anyone that has not being there.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mlturken
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a wonderful surprise. The Palomar is located in a wonderful area just adjacent to Beverly Hills with easy access to many of the areas finest restaurants, shopping, and to the beautiful campus of UCLA. On our arrival, we were met by an enthusiastic and extremely courteous staff that offered us incredible service with smiles and efficiency that we have not seen in years. The hotel is very modern, spotless, and elegant. The lobby, elevators, restaurants, bars, and even hallways are decorated in a splash of vibrant colors and textures that make the entire hotel both sophisticated and stylish. Our room was standard size but decorated in modern decor with new and elegant appearing lamps and furniture and sporting a beautiful bathroom with with high end toiletries. The mattresses were incredibly supportive (as if they were new), the rugs thick and clean, the television was large (a 40 inch lcd), and the room even had a wonderful ipod adapted clock radio. Internet service was fast and complimentary. For the service and amenities offered by the Palomar Hotel, one could not do any better even if they chose to stay at a hotel at twice the cost. My husband and I have stayed in many fine hotels over the years; the Palomar ranks among the best we have experienced . M.L. Turken Boulder, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Broken toilet, never properly resolved”
Reviews.Author: KARZRKEWL
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel is very impressive and is clean and stylish throughout. One glaring omission was the condition of our toilet. When Eric the bellhop took us to our room he noted the toilet was making a strange noise and suggested we call the hotel engineer to have a look at it. I told him we would when we left for dinner since before that we would use the bathroom to get ready. This was the first opportunity for your hotel staff to rectify the situation. Eric could have moved us to a new room immediately since we hadn't unpacked yet. He did not make the offer. We subsequently discovered that the toilet was not working at all. When we returned to the room (after the engineer supposedly fixed the toilet) that night with two friends the toilet worked sporadically, but at least after several attempts the toilet always flushed. The next morning the toilet broke again this time permanently and AFTER I had already used it. My girlfriend and I had to use the shower with the toilet smelling and the toilets in the lobby downstairs before going out for the day. The front desk said they would send up the engineer again to fix it this time. I inquired about packing up our stuff and moving to another room but the person at the front desk insisted we try fixing it again. This was the second opportunity for someone at the hotel to adequately deal with the problem. When my girlfriend and I came back to the room again that afternoon I tested the toilet one time before using it so I would not be subjected to the humiliation of using the toilet only to have it not work for a second time. It only flushed once and then stopped working. This was the THIRD time that our toilet had broken after being looked at by the engineer TWICE. I spoke to the manager on duty and requested a room change which at that point was granted. It was the THIRD time before my request to change room was granted. We had already been in the room 24 hrs and had to re-pack our things that by this time were in various places around the room. I was the one who booked this hotel and vouched for its status as a "luxury boutique hotel" and quite frankly I was very embarrassed. A working toilet is hardly a luxury. I just signed up to be an In touch member with every intention of staying at Kimpton Hotels in the future but this horrible experience and the chronic lack of anyone with the ability to deal with it immediately would be enough to ensure I never stay at another. Do not stay at this hotel if using a working toilet is something you expect for 175 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Barry0007
Reviews.Content: Travelled recently with some colleages on business and I picked the hotel based on Trip Advisor recommendations. Hotel was certainly nice enough although I expected the room to be somewhat larger. We arrived late and the only dining option was the late night menu. That menu leaves a lot to be desired but it sounds like the hotel is aware of it and will be addressing that issue shortly. Staff was pleasant and professional, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was bright and adequate. In room amenities like the coffee and robes are a nice touch. Breakfast in the hotel at BLVD 16 was a highlight; nice room, nice staff and delicious food. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: beakr
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay, I was able to check in early and I had a king suite which was on the corner so I had no problems with noisy neighbors. The Room including the bathroom was huge! The staff was excellent and very efficient. Will stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent with Kimpton concept”
Reviews.Author: leica510
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I favor boutique hotels, and in particular Kimptons, for high level of personal service and comfortable accommodations (lots of easy accessible outlets - business hotels, take note). The Palomar for the most part hits all the right notes, starting with attentive front desk - check in was a breeze, and the room quiet and clean. Only surprise was the morning yoga class - felt a bit like a bait & switch as the instructor was dropping subtle hints that her real job is private training celebrities. Go for a walk in Westwood instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Youngatheart1958
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Palomar with our daughters while visiting our son at UCLA. We have stayed there several times since August, 2008 when we attended the UCLA orientation. Many members of the valet/bell and restaurant staff have remained the same. They appear to enjoy their work, and are a very pleasant group of people. We did have to wait several hours to check in due to limited availability of the adjoining rooms we had requested, and were given complimentary continental breakfast coupons for our stay by the personable desk clerk. The location is excellent and convenient to anywhere in LA. There are many nice touches in the lobby. We had the opportunity to see the President's Motorcade pass in front of the hotel one morning which was completely unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service, crappy bathrooms--stay away”
Reviews.Author: qlowercased
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, I read reviews on hotels.com and tripadvisor.com and thought I was going to a nice, boutique luxury hotel with great service. Although Hotel Palomar came in second to Hotel Angelino, it was slightly closer to where I needed to be. I picked it for the convenient location and the rave reviews. Boy was I wrong! From the moment that I set foot in the hotel, I didn't feel comfortable or welcomed. No one made direct eye contact with me. Was there something on my face? Did I have something hanging out of my nose? Actually, I should have known something was wrong when I called ahead to make sure that there's a room for me when I got in at midnight, and they were already less than courteous on the phone. I'm sorry to inconvenience you, but isn't it standard practice to be nice to your guests? When I arrived, they were joking around with some other guests standing at the front desk, and they barely said a word to me except to give me my room key. The room we got was small and cramped. The bar on which to hang clothes in the closet only went up to my waist (I'm only 5'2", so you can imagine how low this bar was), so my the pants of my suit was drooping on the floor when I hung my clothes up. The bathroom was unexpectedly bad -- very poorly designed. There is no door to the shower. It's basically an open shower area with a curtain. When I showered that night, water splattered every where all the way to the toilet area, and even onto the carpet outside the bathroom! WHAT THE HECK? The entire area was still wet in the morning when I woke up. Yuck! When I asked for late check out, they sighed and put me on hold for more than 5 minutes. I've never had such trouble at a hotel before! They finally gave me 1 hour extra after the standard check out time of 12pm. Wow, thanks guys for going out of your way to make your guests feel accommodated. My experience was NOT AT ALL what I had expected at a luxury boutique hotel with high ratings. I mean, I've gotten better treatment at the big chains like Westin or Marriott. I'll never never never ever come here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: annbury
Reviews.Content: Palomar is in West LA and is very convenient to many of the local sights. We were able to take our pet dog, and the staff treated him very well. Very modern, very comfortable, and extremely reasonably priced. Also easy and convenient valet parking. We will stay there again when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good”
Reviews.Author: osteopath69
Reviews.Content: My major concern is quality of sleep. I had a very quiet room facing away from the street. I had no problem sleeping. Of course, if I had had an unusually noisy neighbor I might have had a different experience. I can't recommend this place enough. I would absolutely return if I needed to come to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: sussed_nl
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've been to a few hotels in LA and this one is by far my fave. Nice modern, clean rooms with great beds. The location was perfect for me as I was able to get to the Silverlake area and Santa Monica fairly easy. The doormen were very friendly and the service good. I will definitely return to this hotel when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Another very good Kimpton experience”
Reviews.Author: jjjbbb
Reviews.Content: Kimpton has fast become my first choice of hotel - consistently good quality for a fair price. The Palomar ended up being a great choice for us - as far as LA goes, it's a fairly central location. You still need a car (but you would no matter where you stay in LA) and it's a bit pricey to park ($30/night) - waived if you have a hybrid, but the rental company had none left. We found it took no more than 20 minutes to get anywhere in LA that we wanted to go - that's pretty good for LA. Staying in Santa Monica (our original first choice) would have been a mistake - it's nice there, but puts you far from everything. Room was a fine size (average to a bit smaller than average), but very comfortable as it was laid out well. The bed was super comfortable and we were surprised about how quiet the room was. Dining in the hotel adds up quickly - we like the convenience of having breakfast in the hotel, had 1 dinner and had room service one night when not feeling well. To be fair, the food was on par with other restaurants we went to in the same price bracket (which is to say it was very good, but no bargain ... but in fairness again, not overpriced compared to similar restaurants we went to - we actually found LA fairly pricey overall even compared to NYC). The concierge was very helpful but he seemed to disappear halfway through our stay - not sure if he was off or out sick or what. Also, we had a giggle about the Hotel's description in it's in room materials - about chocolates being bedside and evening turn down service - we never experienced either and we weren't missing these things until we read about them. We did enjoy the complementary NY Times and Wall St Journal every day. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning and straightening the room and the bathroom - but a mediocre job of replacing the little complementary items (body lotion, shower cap, q-tips - very generous with the shampoo and soaps though). Of course, I always noticed this well after it was too late to call anyone about it and then would forget again the next morning until too late once again. I'm sure if I had asked, they would have provided as they did with the body lotion the one time I remembered and mentioned it to housekeeping in the hallway. The business center's printer was out of paper and the front desk staff happily offered to print what we needed at no charge - I'd say this is generally descriptive of the staff there - very nice and eager to please. One thing that I'll add - I'm happy to be green and re-use my towels for a few days BUT to do this I need hooks! When there's no where to hang a towel other than in the shower where it gets wet, it ends up on the floor needing replacement. Maybe take down the art in the bathroom and put in a few hooks/a towel rack? I'm a big fan of the Kimpton chain and the Palomar met my expectations in every way. I'd stay here again and would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Overrated”
Reviews.Author: footnotesetc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located and the staff, generally helpful and friendly. However, the "continental breakfast" on 4 out of 6 mornings is dry toast, butter, jam, coffee, juice and a very small fruit salad of mostly watermelon. The bed is comfortable, but the feather bed is not hypoallergenic; I woke up in the morning with swollen eyes. On the third day, I concluded it must be the feather bed and slept on top of the comforter and my eyes were better. (The hotel should have made sure the feathers in the feather bed were cleaned properly and is hypoallergenic). I've slept in other hotels with feather beds, including in my home and have never had a problem, because the feather beds are HYPOLLERGENIC! Last, but not least the room is generally clean, but the shower could use a scrubbing–there is brown mold.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel at a cheap prices!!”
Reviews.Author: bobcat1966
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel with a real luxury feel to it. Cool lobby and very sleek looking rooms. My room had the leopard skin look to it. Bathroom was spotless ( a must) big tub/shower and very comfy bed. I used the business center quite a bit, my computer was giving me problems. Nice little biz center with free printer and paper. My only food experience was with room service at breakfast. Steel cut oatmeal with fruit platter, coffee and juice. It was good it was fast and it was expensive. But we all know how this works right! Go to Mel's on Sunset for cheaper (not cheap). I did the Hotwire bid for this hotel and submitted Beverly Hills/Westwood. Got the Palomar for $159. A great deal plus I was close to my meeting in Century City. Oh almost forgot, GREAT fitness center! New, clean very serious equipment. Nice size room with a view. Towels and cold water on hand, it's the little things sometimes. Very friendly, nice and of course attractive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanm3320
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 14-year-old daughter stayed at Hotel Palomar for five nights for Spring Break. I, at first, thought we should stay in a hotel near the Santa Monica pier but decided that the Palomar’s location near I-405 would cut down on the amount of time we spent navigating LA’s traffic. That turned out to be a good decision. Plus the Palomar offers lower rates than the beach hotels, larger rooms and other generous perks including coffee and tea service from 6-9 a.m., free parking for hybrids and free wifi. (To get free wi-fi you have to join a Kimpton club online but membership is free.) It’s a pleasure to stay at a hotel where you don’t feel nickeled and dimed. We had a wonderful stay at the Palomar. Every staff member we interacted with--from the doormen to the concierge--was friendly and helpful. We never had to wait more than a few seconds for the elevator or a few minutes for our car to be retrieved from its parking place. We stayed in a suite on the 12th floor with a king-sized bed in the bedroom and a pullout sofa in the living room. From our suite, we had a wonderful view of LA clear to the beach. The large, beautifully appointed bathroom was equipped with two sinks, a wonderful large shower, and a brand new, large soaking tub with jets. To save time, we ate one dinner and several breakfasts in the hotel's restaurant, which was great although a bit pricey. There are less expensive alternatives nearby. The hotel has a small fitness facility equipped with good treadmills, ellipticals and a recumbent bike and handweights and mats. It is clean and bright. We also swam laps in the rooftop pool, which is small but clean and adequate. You do have to contend with traffic sounds, but I had no trouble falling asleep in the sun on a comfortable chaise lounge after touring LA all morning. Using the Palomar as our base, we walked the mile through Westwood to UCLA and drove to the Getty and to other sites in the area. Next time I head down to LA, I’ll look no further in my hotel search than the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at a Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brauna
Reviews.Content: I feel like I have been touring Kimpton Hotels recently -- Portland, DC, LA, Atlanta. What I am really growing to like is the consistency of the properties. You know the room is going to be perfectly comfortable, the bathroom fine (not opulent, but completely serviceable), that there will be a completely servicable fitness center (not big, but with enough to get in a good workout), and that the hotel will be well located and easily accessible, and that the rate will be entirely reasonable. And, there will never be a problem in getting your computer to work. So, what more does one need when traveling for business. For pleasure I would certainly stay at a Kimpton if I wanted an urban experiece. The LA property is fairly new, and the service was just terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Good but noise issues”
Reviews.Author: MsNancy10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Palomar in the past and never noticed until this trip how loud the toilet is when flushed. I could hear my neighbors toilet, the room above and even across the hall. It woke me up both nights I stayed at the hotel. Considering my trip was for business and I really needed to be well rested for long days at the office, I was somewhat disappointed. There were a couple of small things too that I noticed in the bathroom, a towel with some stains, hair in the tub- but I am willing to overlook that at an otherwise nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing service I've experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Ravingfan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the Palomar while doing medical tests for her at the UCLA Medical Center. I was astounded with the customer service from the minute we were greeted at our car. Each employee we encountered had an extremely positive and 'make it happen'- attitude. They anticipated and met all our needs before I thought of them. The manager and even head chef of their restaurant personally greeted us and followed up to be certain our every need was met. Our room was flawless. Our view of the city and ocean was breathtaking. I had a question about our flat screen and they immediately were ready to send a "technician" - which we didn't need. From my business and HR background I took note of how fast, efficient and attentive they were. These are traits I've come to expect and desire in places I stay but they were more than a cut above. Various staff at different times remembered my daughter's name, initiated conversation and treated her like royalty. This was a tremendous morale boost during her treatments. She beamed during the entire stay. My daughter said as we pulled out, "They made me feel like a rock star Dad!" I've never seen anything like it. Only thing any where near close might be our recent Disney cruise. I didn't expect this from a hotel that catered so well to customers on business. A few weeks after our stay I contacted the manager to thank him (He gave me his business card at check-in) and inquire on future reservations and unique requests for those I was referring. (He still remembered our names and asked about my daughter.)They met every promise precisely, quickly and elegantly. I've enjoyed the SF Palomar but I am a RAVING fan of Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for visiting UCLA”
Reviews.Author: travelboundsandiego
Reviews.Content: My son and I were on a college road trip and spent 1 night here as we were touring UCLA the next morning. We were exhausted after a long drive and this hotel was perfect. The staff was incredibly friendly and the valet even offered information about UCLA and USC. Upon check-in, we were given 2 continental breakfast vouchers in lieu of the complimentary wine/beer coupons since my son is underage. This was much appreciated and worked well as we needed to be at the campus early the next morning. We chose this hotel for the location and from the other reviews it seemed that it would be walking distance to restaurants and nightlife near UCLA. The staff recommended that if we went out at night to drive or take a cab. As it turned out we were too tired and had a fabulous dinner in the hotel restaurant (a little pricey). The fitness center was well equipped. The rooms were contemporary and the beds were comfy. I do agree with one of the other reviewers that the sliding bathroom door always seemed to be ajar.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel to stay...EVER! Kimpton Hotels are amazing”
Reviews.Author: BaronessEast
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Hotels are my favorite. They are so lush and cozy. Every time I am in LA I HAVE to stay at this location. The rooms are like pillows, the TV is huge, the bathrooms are nice, the staff will bend over backwards for you, and even the hallway smells amazing! I mean come on. This hotel is perfect for business, romance, solo, anything. This is my second trip to Cambodia. My first trip I splurged and stayed at a pricey resort. Since I was going for a month this time I was on a budget. So for $20 a night I picked this place based on the reviews and am glad I did! LOCATION: The hotel is located right across from UCLA campus which means you have great access to Whole Foods, Rite Aid, tons of restaurants, and bars at night. Not to mention the cemetery where Marilyn Monroe and many other famous people is located right around the corner! RECOMMENDATION: I would (and do) recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be comfortable and well taken care of. I love this hotel. PROS: - Lush Rooms - Delicious food in the restaurant - Enormous flat screen with tons of channels - Quiet - Friendly and helpful staff - Romantic dark feel to the hotel itself CONS: - You have to valet your car

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CampHiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning and the end of a 10 night trip through California. At the end of the trip when we were rather tired, It was literally like coming home again. The staff is lovely. My mother and father who are in their 80's traveled with us and the staff was very accomodating in putting us near each other. The only reason that I did not give this hotel 5 stars is that the location, if you do not have a car and/or do not know your way around LA, is in a quiet spot that is removed from where most tourists would want to stay. But like all Kimpton hotels, once you stay in one, you know what you will get; Lovely rooms, fantastic service, and a very nice happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “again a great stay in one of the kimpton hotels”
Reviews.Author: EstherD
Reviews.Content: Since I found this "chain" of hotels, I was never disappointed. I have stayed in Washington Georgetown, in Alexandria and in LA for the second time. This time with our teenage daughter, who loved it as much as we do. The place is modern, rooms are roomy (we took the suite), and lobby is nice. The staff is very friendly and always ready with recommendations. We were recommended to have dinner at the napa valley grill. At the end of the dinner we received a plate with wonderful deserts because our hotel made the reservation for us. That was a nice touch! The room was beautifully furnished, had very comfortable beds, even the pull-out bed for our daughter was comfortable. Service from all the employees was friendly and natural. We will definitely stay here again the next time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: NoelleAm
Reviews.Content: Location is great, service is outstanding. The coffee/tea in the AM was excellent. Cucumber water was delightful and they had strawberry water for Valentine's day. You still need a car to get around but it is centrally located. The rooms/hotel is clean, tastefully decorated and modern but not snobby. Restaurant downstairs had a delicious squash/goat cheese flatbread but if you are a picky eater, the menu would be limited, that was my friend's only complaint. Overall excellent hotel, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business trip. Much to like, so I will start there. For quite a bit under $200: (1) nice and comfortable lobby; (2) warm greeting and fast check-in; (3) slightly larger than average room, well appointed and upscale-looking; (4) very good work area; (5) huge and nice TV; (6) iPod playing device; (7) nice bathroom, including above average towels and soaps, etc.; (8) well-stocked minibar (with $10 coupon for being in the loyalty program -- great perk); (9) very fine gym -- not amazing, but definitely above average and appealing; (10) great location; (11) very comfortable bed and bedding (and whoever is tucking in those sheets must aspire to the bounce-a-quarter-on-it school of bed-making. Breakfast had the usual hotel premium, but not shockingly so, and the food/service were very fine. I missed the wine hour, but the front desk gave me a coupon for a drink at the bar -- another generous step, I'm not crazy about the brown-heavy color scheme in the halls, but that is immaterial. Points off for (1) arriving to a room in which the toilet needed flushing (nothing horrible, debris from cleaning, I think), and (2) turning from the elevator bank to the hall to my room, and there's a rolling trashbin parked in the hallway. I'd recommend a south side room for more quiet -- I faced Wilshire (from 18th floor) and was fine with the street noise, but a lighter sleeper might not be. All told, I'd give it about an 8 on a scale of 10 (with 10 reserved for Four Seasons at top of its game, and, by way of comparison, a 7 for your typical Hyatt Regency).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: DawnLSeattle
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, modern decor, but comfortable. The hotel is not tired at all. Excellent service. Easy check-in. Free wine hour - with good wine. We hada winter warm up special so we had two drink coupons for the bar per day. Excellent after being out all day sightseeing. Excellent workout facility - 4-5 different machine types all of which had tvs on them. Plus, big bonus was having all sorts of free hand weights. Don't normally see those in a hotel gym. Coffee bar in the lobby every morning. While there was a rather spendy valet charge of $30 per day plus tax it was really nice to have it. They were very efficient bringing the car around everyday. Big tip: if you drive a hybrid vehicle they waive the valet fees. I could have saved over $100 for our stay. The front desk clerk knocked off one day from our charge as she thought we had a hybrid (but I opened my big mouth and said we didn't). They also have the New York Times paper available every day on each floor. Not delivered to your door but very close. The location was also convenient. It is less than a mile from I-405 in Westwood which made it convenient to a lot. UCLA is right there and was a nice place to go jog one day. We had a room on the Wilshire side of the hotel - there was some noise but not distracting or noticeable. If you want more quiet pay for the LA view on the other side of the hotel. Only downside in my opinion is the breakfast menu - I felt it was somewhat limited especially on the healthy options The healthy options were rather boring. All in all this is one of my favorite hotels ever and made visiting LA super enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great service.”
Reviews.Author: kobebryantLDN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Palomar in January 2010. We checked in around 8.30pm after flying in from the UK, and were given a room on the 16th floor. As we'd booked a "vista view", having a room at the front overlook Wilshire Blvd wasn't quite what we had in mind, but after querying this with the front desk, they allocated us a room on the 19th floor with a rear view, overlooking West LA/Westwood. As many have said on here, the room was very nice - well decorated in a nice modern, contemporary style which is refreshing for a hotel chain in the US (most of which tend to be a bit boring!). Nicely cleaned and well maintaned, although slightly dusty (I've noted the comment about the slightly dated A/C, which may have been a factor). That said, when the room was cleaned on the first day, all sorted. Good quality bed linens, and nice bed. Bathroom nice size - could be bigger, but couldn't they always, eh?!? Comms provisions were very good also - free wireless internet (if you sign up as an In-Touch member, which was free!), and a 42" TV with HD broadcasts, so you can watch TV in crystal clear quality. The only downside to this was that the HD signal kept cutting out on numerous days, which I queried at the time with housekeeping, and was told it was the inclement weather causing it. Funny how it worked fine in the bar area though!
