(A footnote to this - I raised this issue with the staff on my return to the UK, and had a very nice response from the Hotel Manager offering his apologies and a free upgrade next time, which seems very fair). All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and assisted where possible - happily lent us umbrellas to use during our stay, as we had 5 days of torrential rainstorms! We didn't eat in the restaurant here, so cannot comment on the quality of the food, but had a drink in the bar, where the staff were attentive and professional. The location of the hotel is great - if you're not hiring a car, it's a 5-minute walk from Westwood village, with an abundance of decent restaurants, diners, bars and a couple of great cinemas. All close to UCLA, so a nice crowd and a great vibe wandering around in the evening. Not too "manic" as you would expect in LA, but still very pleasant. Getting around was also easy - close to the 405 if you drive, and not far from I-10 also. If you're on foot, the 720 Metro Rapid bus stop is only 5 mins walk also, which takes you all the way along Wilshire Blvd (Eastbound) for $1.25 - a bargain, and very quick. In the 4 days we didn't have a car (we had one for the final 2 days), getting about was much easier than we expected, so save some money, give the legs a workout and get the bus! All in all a really nice find in LA - would highly recommend it to all, and well deserving of the praise which most seem to give it.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Service. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: Liontamer
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in convenient Westwood location on Wilshire. Giant soaking tub in the "spa rooms" was great. The most important reason I'll be back, though, is the staff. 1. The front desk was really and sincerely warm and welcoming. They even remembered my name the next evening when I stopped by ask a question (and that's BEFORE I ran into car trouble). 2. My car's battery died in the Palomar garage the third night I was there (hybrids park for free), and the manager took over, handling the problem (which, with a hybrid, is not as simple as a basic jump) and even paying my cab fare out to the restaurant where I was heading. Really above-and-beyond service, provided with professionalism and a positive attitude. I travel a lot, stay in chains with great staff (Starwood, Hyatt and Hilton), and this is the the most truly hospitable and professional staffs I've ever encountered. The Palomar is my new go-to hotel when I work in LA. Also, if you join the frequent-stayer club (free) then wireless internet access is not only free, but almost seamless. A small thing, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in so Many Ways, But....”
Reviews.Author: David49b
Reviews.Content: The Palomar Hotel has so much going for it. Stylish lobby, outstanding Westside location, close to the 405 for easy "on and off" to areas north and south, and Santa Monica, as well as Beverly Hills and West Hollywood hot spots. The rooms are typically Kimpton: super stylish, decent size and with comfortable beds, cotton bedsheets and nice towels. That said, there was some plumbing noise from the bathroom above us, which we could hear occasionally in our room. Nothing major, just something that happens with an older building that's been remodeled into a hotel, that's all. Everyone on the staff is attractive, friendly and helpful. However, upon checking in, the front desk gave our bellman the wrong room number. So, we traipsed from room-to-room, floor-to-floor, with several phone calls to the front desk in between, before we got to the correct room! Then, the bellman had to return to the lobby to get us another doorkey, as the electronic coding on the one we had had, for security purposes, been erased. Small annoyance, but obviously the hotel staff needs a bit more training... Another staff problem ocurred with room service, which took forever. After a total of three calls, we finally got our order, but only 3/4 of it was correct! So, we had to wait again, while the staff member went downstairs to retrieve the rest of our order. The elevators are not the fastest of hotel elevators and the cabs are done-up in "mod" nightclub fashion, dark, back-lit a deep red (day and night!) so that once the elevator door closes, one can hardly see anything inside the cab. A bit too trendy for my tastes. Boulevard 16 is the restaurant on the Lobby level of the hotel. The food is outstanding! We had dinner on two occasions and five breakfasts. We did not have one complaint! Not only was the food absolutely delicious (freshly squeezed real orange juice, for example, in the morning,) in the evening, the dinner items were amazingly inventive and combined interesting and exotic ingredients (for example: yuzu, truffle oil, vanilla bean and goat cheese, in a fresh persimmon, hazelnut salad!) For the quality of the food and service (and the service in the restaurant was highly professional and polished at breakfast and dinner) the prices were reasonable for LA. Overall, I would highly recommend the Palomar Hotel. If they could get their room service and bellmen acts together, I'd give them, five stars across the board.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ted4364
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here based upon the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. The room was beautifully furnished, had very comfortable beds, and above all was very quiet in response to our request. Service from all the employees was friendly and natural - no attitudes. We will definitely stay there the next time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: matthew_01
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been more impressed with my stay here...too many times there's a plastic feel to the hospitality one receives at hotels when traveling on business. The "my pleasure to connect you" and other tired phrases feel--and usually are--fake. Here, though, everybody I met there seemed to be good at their job and having fun doing it. We made use of their courtesy car several times and our driver was gracious and knowledgeable. The restaurant food was reliable and creative , the bartender was spot-on, and the front desk staff gamely fought through some weird glitch in their room-key system without getting rattled or rude. I think the people made the difference here. However, the rooms do deserve a mention. Are they huge? Nope. But they're stylish and immaculately clean. My bed was comfortable and the bathroom was quite nice. This was a hotel we chose on a recommendation and I'm extending that recommendation as one of my own here. Kudos to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “I've seen the future of the Kimpton brand...”
Reviews.Author: herculepoirot
Reviews.Content: Kimpton used to buy interesting, older buildings and rehab them. However, with their rapid growth the past few years they've clearly lost that vision and, in Los Angeles, rehabbed a 70's-era Communist-looking building in a decent location with rooms smaller than most in New York City. That's "the story" this hotel tells...which isn't much. In my opinion, just a bad business decision. I'm sure they also want to create a "hot scene" around the dreary pool squeezed between 2 buildings. Again, not inviting. As many have noted, the AC system is old and dusty. The room is nicely decorated but can't make up for the small size especially if you get a double room. But It's Los Angeles! One of the most expansive cities in our country. We ended up leaving two nights early and headed to the London. I hope they halt their agressive expansion and return to their roots. Otherwise, same old, same old.

Reviews.Title: “I Really Liked This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marriett
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at a Kimpton hotel in DC before and wasn't that impressed, with the hotel or the customer service. I found a great rate at the Palomar and decided to give the chain a second chance and I'm glad I did. The customer service at this hotel was amazing. I sent an email with a room request before I checked in. I received a courteous reply within the hour. The valet parkers, the people at reception, everyone went out of their way to be friendly. My room was a vista deluxe. It was very large and clean with a great view, large flat screen TV, free wifi...everything you need. Bathroom was modern and a good size as well. It's a newer hotel so everything is still shiny and new. Always my favorite time to stay at places. Oh, they even have a free wine hour. Between 5-6, you could go to the hotel bar and have free glasses of wine. The restaurant...was alright. There are so many restaurants in LA though...I never eat at the hotel restaurants. I didn't have a chance to see the rest of the hotel (pool area, ect). So, I can't comment on that. And parking is expensive ($30) but I saw if you have a hybrid it's free. Also, there's a public garage down the street on Glendon. I didn't use it but I'm sure it's cheaper. As for the question would you recommend this hotel to a friend, I already have. Several in fact!

Reviews.Title: “Five star service at great price!”
Reviews.Author: SophiedogsMom
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend in LA and booked the Hotel Palomar because of the glowing reviews we had read on TripAdvisor (our traveling bible!) We booked a suite as it was only an additional $50.00 per night and it was well worth it! The room was beautifully appointed and the bathroom was huge! The bedding was extremely comfortable and the room had two (yes TWO) 42" high def TV's. We also had dinner at BLVD 16. The food was quite good, but the menu was somewhat limited. I saw in previous reviews that to avoid the valet parking prices (no self-parking) that some people were finding spots on the street. FYI....the hotel has a policy that they will waive the $30/night fee if you are driving a hybrid! Fortunately we had a Prius and it saved us $60.00!

Reviews.Title: “Pet Lovers Dream-First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IloveIke
Reviews.Content: One of the top hotels in LA if you ask me - great rooms, great staff, great location, and pet friendly to boot. Have stayed here three times so far and each time hotel staff from the parking attendants to the housekeeping staff could not be nicer or more friendly. If you are traveling with a dog to the LA area stay here! They offer doggie beds and bowls and there is no surcharge at all for staying with your pet. Rooms are hip and clean and well designed - with great beds/sheets and Aveda products. I am a hard person to please and this property succeeds on all levels.....when you return from being out for the day they great you with a "welcome back" - the day we were in LA it was chilly and they had complimentary hot coco in the the lobby - free coffee in the morning as well....nice pool. Can't say enough about the place....its well run from top to bottom

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: danid09
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my fiancé over the Thanksgiving holiday; we were able to get a great rate using Priceline.com. This hotel is in a great location, very trendy and very clean. You are within walking distance from Westwood Village and UCLA; there is even a small movie theater down the street. The service at this hotel is exceptional. We arrived and we promptly greeted by Valet, we didn't even have time to take our bags out of the car before they did it for us. At check-in they made us aware of all the specials they have for guests at the hotel. During 5pm - 6pm they offer free wine hour to all guests in the hotel restaurant. They also offer free coffee and tea to guests from 6a-9am. If you sign up with the Kimpton group you receive free WIFI in your room. Customer Service was wonderful, if you had any questions or concerns the hotel staff was right there to assist you. The rooms were very clean, the bathroom is nice and roomy but the door doesn't lock, it is just a sliding door. Just be aware parking $30.00 per night but unlimited ins and outs.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: RichardChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: The many other reviews on this site highly recommend this hotel. However, I am a physician and I know what the skin rash of a bed bug bite looks like. Don't accept a room on the 11th floor. That's where I stayed and received these bed bug bites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Chao_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Thanksgiving weekend. The room was great and the people there were very friendly and helpful. was able to provide hot water kettle for the room. Also a plus, parking is free if you drive a hybrid car - otherwise it's $30 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: yesnomaybe213
Reviews.Content: We spent a fabulous week at the Palomar in Westwood with our 20-something daughter, who was equally pleased with her accommodations in the room next to ours. The rooms are beautiful and well appointed, albeit in the typical eccentric Kimpton safari decor. The housekeeping staff is the BEST. From check-in to check-out we were treated like royalty by the valet staff, the front desk, the concierge, and everyone else. We were there for a family vacation and our only suggestion would be that the hotel, which primarily caters to business travelers, reconfigure some of the rooms so as to make them connecting. The location of this hotel is as good as it gets in LA: 12 minutes to the ocean (Santa Monica), 10 minutes to Beverly Hills, 2 minutes to the 405 Freeway (which you need to access the Getty Center, Catalina Ferry from Marina Del Rey, and of course LAX). Also, at the Palomar you're within walking distance of UCLA and all the great night life in Westwood. What's not nto like about that? For the money, you can't find a finer or nicer place to stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, attractive and very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: idefixaegean
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Tripadvisor and the reviews were right-on-target. The hotel is excellent: friendly and very helpful staff, great location and yes the sheets are wonderful. Breakfast staff and food were good, the evening bar quite friendly. As to parking on the back streets for those who don't want to pay $30 per night for valet... be very careful of the street signs but, yes, we found that nearby parking was possible at no cost. The location could not be better for Los Angeles..... a breeze to the 405. Attractive, friendly Westwood is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Fun, Cool”
Reviews.Author: wolfeee99
Reviews.Content: Great location to Westwood, walking distance to shops, Trader Joe, restaurants. Really liked the rooms, funky décor, comfortable bed, animal print robes kind of different and unexpected but fun. Nice pool area, nightly wine specials friendly staff. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: WDW_Fam
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar exceeded our expectations from check-in to check-out. We did not have any problems with our late night check-in. The front desk staff member seemed truly happy to welcome us. Our room was quite comfortable. The bed had plenty of pillows for television watching and relaxing, and the closet space provided was more than enough for a multi day stay. The bathroom was extremely spacious. I believe our room was handicapped accessible, so that may account for the larger bathroom. If that is correct, our difficulties with the shower may not be present in all guest rooms. The shower head was situated on the long wall of the step-in shower instead of the narrow wall. This placement caused us to essentially flood the bathroom floor each morning. By the third day we knew where to position the shower head and extra towels in order to decrease the deluge. That said, it did not provide for a comfortable shower. Your room may not have this shower set up, so it may be worth it to ask at check-in. The Valet staff were always nice and retrieved our vehicle quickly. One morning we'd waited less than 5 minutes and the staff member apologized for the delay :) The Wilshire Boulevard location helped make our stay very enjoyable. UCLA is within walking distance of the Palomar. The number of quick service and sit down restaurants around campus were certainly varied for most tastes: multiple Starbucks, In-N-Out Burger, Stan's Donuts, sushi, falafel, and pizza to name a few. Access to the 405 is just down the street, and Beverly Hills and Santa Monica aren't far down the road either. We appreciated many of the free amenities provided at The Palomar. The morning coffee bar helped get us going in the morning. Free Wi-Fi in our room was a welcomed surprise. We'll visit The Palomar again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, except for the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: lasocal
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights while visiting UCLA and loved it. It's close enough to campus that one can walk, but they also have a shuttle van that will take you to campus if you ask the bell captain. The rooms are not particularly spacious, but are very well-appointed and classy. The staff was attentive and very friendly. I have absolutely no complaints about the hotel, and would have given five stars, were it not for the restaurant. I had eaten at Boulevard 16 soon after it opened and remember being unimpressed, but my room service meal was downright nasty. The caesar salad dressing was greasy yet flavorless, with very little cheese. The side of risotto had a pool of grease around the edge, and had a consistency more like rice pudding than risotto. I was really wishing that I would have just walked the couple of blocks to westwood - even the cheapo student eateries would have been better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sonata23
Reviews.Content: After considering many hotels in the L.A. area, we finally chose Hotel Palomar due to its location, room price and positive tripadvisor reviews. Happily, we were not at all disappointed with any aspect of the hotel. The rooms (deluxe king) were a good size, clean, and nicely decorated, the staff was very helpful and quick to respond to our questions. Paul, the Concierge, was particularly helpful and knowedgeable, and spent a lot of time with us highlighting maps, suggesting restaurants and booking reservations. We had the use of a rental car, so the location of the hotel was not an issue -- it seemed to be perfectly situated on Wilshire between downtown Hollywood and Santa Monica, which is what we were looking for. Valet parking was $30 per night with in/out privileges (pricey, but not unusual for a big city hotel). Nice touches included the complimentary tea/coffee bar in the lobby each morning, welcome cocktails, and a daily happy hour with free glasses of wine. WiFi was also free for us because I became a "Kimpton member" (like joining any hotel rewards program and easily done online), but be aware that the use of the business centre is not. We found that out while trying to print off our airline boarding passes the night before our departure. When we called the desk to inquire about charges, they told us to come to the lobby where they printed them off for us for free. All in all, Hotel Palomar proved to be a great place to stay and we would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: maxisweden
Reviews.Content: The three of us stayed in seperate rooms for five nights in July 2009. All rooms were nicely decorated and very clean - and we are very, very picky when it comes to cleanliness so this was very pleasing to us. Location and area is nice too. The lobby and restaurant areas are nice. Excellent staff, very helpful and polite. This is the place we will return to if in LA again, and also the place we will recommend to others. Compared to the other hotel where we also stayed this was pure heaven. The complimentary coffee in the mornings were nice. Even though we were busy with sightseeing and never used, the fact that you could have a complimentary glass of wine was a nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, still great!”
Reviews.Author: sanetrader
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hotel Palomar, Westwood and once again it was great! We stayed in a King Spa Suite this time and so worth it! The views from the room as well as the room itself was wonderful. Everything was clean and very tastefully decorated. The front desk staff was very accommodating with all requests. Ate breakfast only at the restaurant and it was good and not overpriced. The only thing is having to pay 30/night for parking.... the only thing that I'm not in love with. If this was lowered, even by 5/night I think I would be more comfortable with paying it. There is not a lot to do within walking distance but a lot if you have a car. We got to the Getty Center within 10 minutes for example. For the location of this hotel and the excellent staff you can be assured that my husband and I will be returning. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recco”
Reviews.Author: dan57rank
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in Oct with my wife. Staff could not have been nicer. Car valet was nice, fast and polite. Checked in and the guy said "looks like you could use a free drink" and handed us a coupon and off to the bar we went where the bar tender was eager to please with recco's for a snack. Room was very nice, comfy, very clean, excellent TV and bed with a great view looking south. Hotel was quiet, fast elevators, paper in the morning, and on and on. Would highly recco this place...great location as well. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Palomar is very clean, modern and friendly !!”
Reviews.Author: seabit
Reviews.Content: The location across Wilshire Blvd from Westwood Village and UCLA is excellent ! A couple block walk to shopping and dining! Close to Hollywood/Beverly Hills, but not as busy. Rooms were very comfortable ! Environment is fantastic !! Very friendly hotel staff, from doorperson/valet, to Restaurants waitstaff ! Pool area is very relaxing, complete with fireplace !

Reviews.Title: “Does customer service exist anymore?”
Reviews.Author: Eagleeye27
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Kimpton chain so when I decided to visit Los Angeles I stayed at th Palomar in Westwood. BIG MISTAKE! First of all when we arrived they charged our credit card way more than we were supposed to be charged and they waited the next day to refund the card without the slightest sympathy, then we had a situation with our room and instead of trying to help us all they had to say was "there's nothing we can do," so I decided to speak to a manager (I think his name was Hami) and of course all he had to say was "there's nothing we can do" so I spoke to another manager (Victor) and his response was...yup you guessed it "there's nothing I can do." All in all the next time I decide to stay in L.A I will not step foot at the Palomar Westwood. If every hotel in L.A. is booked I will sleep outside on the floor before I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: This place is very welcoming, but it is a bit out of the way. If you don't mind walking a half a mile to Westwood Village, where there's lots f neat eateries and walking streets, it's pretty cool. With the 20 and 720 buses, you can get by w/o a car, going along Wilshire. As for the rooms, they're very modern and well maintained. The happy hour and free wine tasting from 5-6 PM are a nice touch, as is the NYT on your floor daily, even Sunday. The pool was nice, but there wasn't much sun on the pool or chaise lounges the morning I swam. The lobby is inviting and the service is warm and helpful. If you're used to 5 stars (I'm not) this place might not cut it. But for the average Joe, it's great. And I booked it on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Convenient to UCLA”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNY621
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Palomar. We came here last year when we were college hunting for our son. We loved it's "safe" feeling and residential neighborhood flair, nestled amongst beautiful condos. Since my son did get accepted to UCLA there was not discussion as to where we'd stay before we dropped him off! It is very close and gave us a good feeling (as we stayed an extra day to vacation) that if he needed us - we were right there! The beds are so comfortable. The bathroom and room is spotless. The air is a bit noisey but you get used to it, not a big deal. We will be coming out to LA many more times in the future...so this has become our new home! The staff from valet to front desk are very friendly! We love it here! Another great feature..if you become a Kimpton member..internet is free! I'm a Marriott Awards member, and pay DAILY for the internet! NOT HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Essie16
Reviews.Content: I have had generally excellent experiences with Kimpton hotels, and the Hotel Palomar LA is no exception. Check in was friendly and efficient. My room was a bit tight in terms of size, but it included a comfortable king-size bed, chaise lounge with small side table, and full-size desk as well as an enormous flat screen HDTV. The bathroom was well-laid out too, although the sliding door was a bit wonky and didn't quite stay shut. There is free wifi in the room for Kimpton InTouch members. There's free coffee and tea in the lobby every morning, plus the hotel offers a decent (but pricey) breakfast menu in the restaurant. The free wine hour here is great - generous pours and the bar menu offers delicious small plates (truffle fries, flatbread pizzas, etc.) for only $3-5. One particular doorwoman (didn't catch her name) was very helpful in terms of information on how to get around. I didn't have a car but she was able to tell me the approximate cab fares to various points and options for getting to the airport. This section of LA is relatively easily walkable - UCLA, plus plenty of shops and restaurants are less than 10 minutes' walk away (including a Denny's if you want a cheap breakfast). I was only staying for a couple of days, so cabs and walking worked fine for me. But to really explore LA it's best to have a car. Parking is $30 / night, which is standard for city hotels. Street parking seemed quite restricted and I'm not sure if there are cheaper parking lots in the neighborhood, so budget extra for that cost.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanki
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay here. The building looks like it was an older highrise that has been completely renovated inside to the latest trends. The room was clean with its creative 'animal print' decor, and the bathroom was great (love the tub faucet!) The sliding door didn't quite work in our bathroom though and kept slamming/knocking back and forth. We were on the main blvd side of the hotel, but we were high enough that we did not really hear road noise, and we did not hear neighbors either. I stayed in a few hotels during this trip, and standout features of this one include the Frette linens, which just feel extraordinary, even compared to the other luxury sheets I encountered at similar hotels. Also the huge flat screen TV which actually got some true HD channels. Awesome. My only quibbles would be that the building, being older, has somewhat low ceilings and space seems somewhat limited. The pool area is also tight but is well appointed, and it's nice to have a quiet, clearly adult-type pool to rest and lounge at. The free wine reception is great (they give you a generous pour!) and the lounge/restaurant seem state of the art. They had a 16% discount coupon for the restaurant to help with the otherwise high prices. We used the parking valet as parking in the area is somewhat difficult. We lucked out because we had a hybrid rental, and they give a 25% valet discount for hybrids. As others have mentioned, you have to drive everywhere in LA, and this place is close to UCLA and Beverly Hills and also relatively close to Santa Monica and Sunset Strip. It is about a half mile walk to Westwood Village mall. Overall a solid, thoroughly modern boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sek86
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The room was spacious and comfortable and had a very nice contemporary decor. Bathroom was spotless (my measuring stick) and again spacious and contemporary. We didn't ask for much service, but the service that we got when we did was what one would expect from an upscale hotel. Can't comment on location as we were in town to visit family, not sight-see, but I do know it is relatively close to UCLA and Beverly Hills. We also stayed at the Washington DC Palomar in April and had a similar experience. If all Kimpton hotels are like these two, it is my new go-to "chain" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased - would recommend this hotel w/o hesitation”
Reviews.Author: LucyRic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and 3 kids. We stayed in a deluxe room which had 1 bedroom with a queen bed for us, and the kids stayed on a pullout couch and a rollaway bed in the other living room area. We were very pleased with everything from the hotel staff to the new and modern furnishings to the reasonable cost of the room. It was in a good location near Beverly Hills and Hollywood. We did some sightseeing in Hollywood, and Beverly Hills. There was a free coffee bar each morning in the lobby. Everything was classy and modern. We enjoyed our stay here very much. The inside restaurant was a little pricey, so we took the kids to a Denny's a couple of blocks away. The only negative was that they charged $30 per day to park our rental car there. They had valet service, and we agreed for the convenience, but it did add an extra cost that we did not expect. A minor negative, there was no game room, which the kids always enjoy. But, no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - could even walk to bars / restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: Well situation for LA's very spread out attractions, but likewise not really close to any of them - beach, Getty, downtown, LACMA, Hollywood, Studios are all a drive. Comfortable and well sized rooms, with a good gym - fairly large for a hotel, with lots of exercise machines. Pool outside gets the sun in the mornings and has room to 'lounge'. While we were there they had free coffee in morning and wine tasting in early evening - they have a nice bar and restaurant in the hotel as well. LA is a city where you need a car (and indeed they have valet parking) but there are actually shops and restaurants within walking distance - Westwood Village. It's a drive everywhere but that's just LA and this hotel has good road links.   Recommended as a good quality well placed hotel, with a pool. A solid four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: em_be53
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 (teenage children) stayed at the Hotel Palomar from the 8th to 14th July 2009 and had a blast. Loved Westwood, loved the free wine and ice block hours each day. Loved the free coffee in the morning and continental breakfasts. Room was smallish but we were comfortable even with 4 big suitcases. Excellent service everywhere from reception through to housekeeping. Should especially mention the restaurant and bar staff who played Wi games with my 10 year old for an hour without complaint. We hired a car and parked 2 streets back which is a short walk from the hotel - just watch out, you have to move your car by 9 am! We received our first parking infringement within 48 hours of arrival. Westwood is a lovely area, plenty of restaurants and shops nearby, and a short walk from UCLA!! Had a great time at both Universal Studios and Disney Land! Also well located for the beaches and Getty Museum. We will definitely stay at Hotel Palomar AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff must take happy pills”
Reviews.Author: vagabondCvilleva
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this Kimpton hotel [I also love the east coast Monaco, and new Lorien in the DC area] and once again I was not disappointed. I have rarely seen a hotel with staff so happy and fun! I know this sounds strange in a review but it is the truth! The valet are all smiles and jocularity and the front desk check in..esp Brandon..I may have this name wrong if so sorry..the tall very handsome African American with a smile for miles, obviously very proud of the hotel, always has something entertaining to say that makes me feel very welcome... sort of like like being at a good friend's weekend condo instead of a hotel. Check in has always been a breeze and there is just something about this place that does not feel like a hotel. I have stayed in both a suite as well as a regular guest room. The beds are extra comfy with their piles of pillows,duvets, high thread count linens, and lux bed throws. There are animal print robes [free to wear during your stay] hanging in the closet as well as socks and pjs for those who want to start their shopping early! [you can purchase everything]. Each time I have requested a room on a higher floor overlooking the more peacefull neighborhood of Westwood rather than the busier side which looks out onto Wilshire. I have always been accommodated. The views are wonderful! Now, if you have the extra cash to stay in one of their suites , it is well worth the splurge. Two nice sized rooms, flat screen tvs in both, a wet bar,stocked mini fridge, with a gigantic bathroom replete with huge soaking tub,double vanities, and a spacious walk in shower for two. It is as nice a bathroom as I have had in a hotel. As for the regular guest rooms, they are a bit on the smallish side, but that doesnt dampen the experience of their uber elegant/hip feeling of style. I also like their pool area, which, like the hotel, has a cozy feel to it with a large privacy wall,lush greenery, and a wonderful wrap around sofa that stretches out along the shaded wall. There are also abundant chaises available for those who wish to soak up the California sun. There is nothing pretentious about this place, which I really like! The location is nice. You are away from the typical touristy hustle bustle of Hollywood Blvd.and the fussy 'hoi paloi' of the Rodeo BH area. [yet you are not far if you wish to venture that way] There is the great Westwood area about three to four easy walking blocks from the hotel. It is a wonderful mix of upscale eateries,sidewalk bistros and cafes, trendy clothing stores, as well as an Urban Outfitter,a Whole Foods,movie theatres and of course the beautiful UCLA campus. I understand it is an area that has recently been refurbished. Indeed, you will still see some of the signs of the older neighborhood, a scruffy street person or two, but it has a vibrancy to it reminiscent of smaller university towns all over the country. About 2 short blocks from the hotel..hang a left as you leave the lobby, there is a great coffee shop with killer breakfasts and good lunch fare, also a good place to purchase soft drinks and snacks at far more reasonable prices than the mini bar or hotel restaurant. If there was one thing negative about this hotel, it is the restaurant,which is also where the room service food comes from. Not so great and exhorbitantly..I mean off the wall expensive!!! I dont mind paying if the quality is there but sadly they do need to revamp both their menu and prices. They were about the same as the Beverly Wislhire Four Seasons..need I say more? The hotel is such a great experience and so well run it is ashame to have to give it a low mark for the food. I will have to say that the last time we stayed there, I called for reservations thru Kimpton In Touch of which I am a member [it is free and worth joining bc you earn points with each stay that allows you to build up enough for free stays and exclusive offers], and I was given an absolutely fantastic rate [better than any other hotel chain I called like Marriott and Hilton both of which I am an honor awards point member]. Along with the reduced summer rate, we were given four free beers a night,[we stayed three nights this trip, a week last time] which we could also order from room service at no additional charge. Pretty nice even though I am a wino! They also have an afternoon wine reception in the lobby as well as coffee and tea in the mornings.[I actually saw a lady in her leopard bathrobe getting her coffee..she too must feel comfy here at this hotel!]. As we checked out, our car was brought to us right away with the usual happy nods and greetings. One of the valets noticed that my daughter's car had a white scrape on the side, which she promptly told the concerned valet, she had done herself in her apartment garage. He actually took the time to bring out a special polishing cream that immediately made the scratch disappaear..wiping at it and polishing it to a shiny new sheen! Now that is service..and as always, at the Palomar, with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many Kimptons, but this was our first time at the Palomar. Our first impression was quite negative due to the front desk staff. They seemed stressed and overwhelmed, and were borderline rude to guests. One of the receptionists, Autumn, was particularly huffy and spoke to us loudly, in very condescending tones. When we checked out, the situation was similar -- not a smile, not a "how was your stay?", nothing. They need better training in guest relations. Luckily our room was very nice. It was on the small side, but nicely appointed. We especially liked the chaise by the window. The bathroom clearly hadn't gotten much attention from housekeeping; there was a curly hair next to the sink and we were only given one bar of soap, presumably to share between the sink and the shower/tub. The drains in both the tub and sink were clogged, so we had to call maintenance to fix the issue (which they did quickly, although with no apologies from management). Some previous reviews had mentioned that the air conditioning is loud, which is true. But that actually worked in our favor. It created "white noise", masking any kind of noise from the other guests. While it's common at hotels to hear doors opening/closing, TVs, people talking in the halls, etc. -- we heard absolutely nothing and slept really well at the Palomar. Oh, and the bed was extremely comfortable, too. We got a great night's sleep. Unlike other Kimptons, they do their wine hour in the hotel bar. There's a very reasonably priced appetizer happy hour menu (in the $3-$5 range) to go along with the free wine, which is generously poured. The pool is small but has a nice decor and good music playing (not too loud). However, in the time we were there, no staff came by to pick up the towels/glasses that had been left by previous guests. So in sum, the hotel has great bones. If they can improve their staff training, they would be in great shape.

Reviews.Title: “nice funky hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: wimbledonjoshis
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, cool, nicely furnished, and in a great location. Restaraunts and shops in Westwood Village is a short stroll, beaches a 15 min drive, Getty Centre 10 mins drive and Hollywood /Beverly Hills/Universal Studios 30 mins away. Also, close to highways which makes hotel easy to get to and away from. Our room with 2 double beds easily accomodated 2 adults and 2 teenagers, plus 4 large suitcases. Beds were superbly comfortable, leading to solid sleep (a boon after a hard days sight seeing!). However, a/c can be a bit noisy, so turn it to low. Bathrooms small, but really nice - sliding door to it not an issue with good communication! Check out the streets around the hotel and no cost parking can be found to avoid the high valet parking charges. Free morning coffees and wine tasting a welcome touch. Overall, a lovely base to explore LA and surroundings. Highly recommended, particularly if a good rate can be found on the web.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LUPNER
Reviews.Content: Reading this review was interesting...Surprised anyone had issues with anything here...all in all, we had a really positive experience. We travel a lot for work and play and consider ourselves pretty fair critics. We enjoyed the fact that we could park and walk and lose the car... We asked for a room on a high floor, had a nice view and enjoyed our stay. Staff was helpful. Most of all~ thought our Westwood location was very enjoyable with coffee, cafes, grocery etc close by... took a route off the beaten path to walk through the lovely well-tended homes to get our morning coffee etc. (The staff- recommended-Novel Cafe for b'fast was exceptional) That being said, coffee was also offered in the AM in the lobby and wine in the bar was a nice touch on our return from sightseeing. Note: Be sure and order an appetizer from their menu. Incredible value and delicious! This hotel is definitely a return visit in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in California”
Reviews.Author: silviahg
Reviews.Content: Nice stay in Los Angeles. Beverly Hills is a very good place to stay in this enormous city. You need a car, of course but from here you have access to all places, specially Santa Monica and the beaches!!. This hotel was nice. The building is not very luxury but rooms are very big and comfy. Bathroom very nice. We were upgraded to a suite (thank you very much!!) as it was our honeymoon and the room was superb (though the jacuzzi didn't work). The room was quiet despite of our noisy neighbors who seemed to be in a permanent party all nights. Nevertheless I enjoyed the free coffee early in the morning. The only negative things is the price of the valet parking but you have no option in the whol area. Concierge was very helpful and nice. Desk staff was not so nice and everything you asked seemed to be too much for them (I can't understand this, but anyway, maybe is the usual thing). I recommed this hotel and my stay was as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Remember when drunk people would come home and wake up the entire floor when you were in college?”
Reviews.Author: Traveller123Chicago
Reviews.Content: Overall, not a bad place to stay. The rooms are clean, the valet staff very friendly. The desk staff takes themselves a little too seriously but does try to be helpful. Unfortunately, I'm writing this having been awakened the second night in a row by drunk (and randy as they say in Britain) people coming home at 3 a.m. and then standing in the hallway to grope and argue with each other. I've called desk services twice and, although the young man there has tried to move these people along, they are still playing out their dramas in the hallway. Hold on . . . My next door neighbor has just reminded these fine young folks that they're in a hallway at 3 a.m. and the rest of us have more to do in the morning than survive a hangover. He appears to have gotten them to move into their rooms where now their dramas are muffled exchanges of stupidity rather than the blaring honks of melodrama we all had to listen to moments ago. So, the big question -- should my review hold the hotel responsible for these rude people waking everyone up for the second morning in a row? I don't know. But it's something to consider when you're trying to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-feel, great stay, not too luxe though”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for one night and had a great time. The staff was friendly and accomodating! The rooms were nicely decorated but on the small side. The pool area was relaxing but not spacious - only a few lounge chairs. The food in the restaurant was fantastic. They had a free happy hour in the lobby which was fun! I would say this hotel is pretty, quaint, well appointed but not a full 4 star. I would stay again for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Too busy being "Fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: bunniecollier
Reviews.Content: The bed and the room was nice. The bathroom was a place to look at, not to use. If you're traveling by yourself it's fine but not with someone else. The bathroom has a door that slides (like a barn door) but doesn't have a lock on it and won't stay closed, no matter how hard or soft you close it, it slides open. I would rather not have the door open when I'm in the bathroom. Also, the hot and cold faucet comes out so fast when it's at medium you really don't need a shower after all. Palomar is a nice hotel but they were so busy running around saying aren't we "fabulous" they didn't get the basics down. I think the designer's should've been required to stay there, with someone else. Good location to food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvez
Reviews.Content: Location: 5 Stars... we were taking a tour of UCLA and the location was great. Cleanliness: 5 Stars... I found the entire property to be very clean and of high quality Service: 4 Stars... we really never asked for anything Value: 3 Stars... fairly expensive Room: 4 or maybe 3 Stars... the bathtub drain was clogged and the air conditioner was too loud to keep on at night (I couldn't sleep with the noise... bring ear plugs) My main complaints were with the noise level of the air conditioner and the water temp. of the pool (too cold). Also, they don't have a jaccuzzi. Other than that we enjoy our stay and dinner at the on-site restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Value, style,and location.”
Reviews.Author: Jact100
Reviews.Content: We booked the Palomar on Expedia and stayed a total of 6 nights: 3 at the beginning of our holiday, and 3 at the end. We were very pleased with our choice, and found the hotel to be of better value than the Westin in San Francisco (see other review), which we got for a similar rate. The location was superb, with everything on our doorstep including UCLA, Beverly Hills, Westwood village, cafes, shops, cinemas, buses, and Westwood Village Memorial Park. The area was charming and lively, while safe enough for morning jogs and late-night strolls. The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful, and guest services always responded to requests in record time.The front desk printed out directions, maps , and transport information for wherever we wanted to go. Rooms were slightly on the small side, but Wi-Fi is free, and there were large flat-screen plasma TVs in every room and Aveda products in the bathrooms. The size of the gym was also a slight disappointment for enthusiasts: clean and modern but quite small and under-equipped for 4 star hotel standards. On the plus side, it was open 24 hours. There was a small, stylish plunge pool which many not be to everyone's liking. Other guests were a healthy mix of business travellers, families, and couples : both american and international.We did not try the food, but there was free coffee provided in the lobby every morning. Overall, we would definitely stay here again, and would recommend the Palomar to anyone travelling to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pentangle
Reviews.Content: Great upscale boutique style hotel at excellent rates. Funky and quirky style. Excellent and very helpful staff. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sunshine1845
Reviews.Content: This hotel was FABULOUS! The staff was soooo accommodating and helpful. The price per night is definitely high but it is located in a very popular area. Happy hour with wine and snacks during the weekday. *GYM- The gym was great. Weight room also had personalized TV for each machine but there were also free weights available. Gym provided something for everyone. * Business Center- computers provided in the business centers were MACS (which I love). Only disadvantage was there was a fee for internet use, printing, etc... * Pool- Pool area was very upscale and trendy. A little small, but ambiance was nice. * BLVD 16 Restaurant- was pricey but the meals were organic friendly and excellent. The chef there apparently uses herb from their own rooftop herb garden and products are provided by local farmers, etc... *Location- Great location. Walking distance to a lot of hotel and shops. This hotel is definitely worth the money if you have to spend

Reviews.Title: “3 star posing as a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: MrClean69
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate at the Palomar which made me switch from my regular hotel in LA. Let me start writing by listing some of the pros and then cons. Pros: clean room, comfortable bed, good parking valets, free internet for intouch members, nice towels, coffee in lobby in the early AM (on the con side, maybe they could serve it later on weekends). Free wine hour (too bad it was Fetzer) Cons: ( all of which combined, make this hotel a 3 star) 1. Upon check-in, the valet took my bag, but not wife's. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 2. We reserved a vista deluxe room but were given a room with a view of another building (not a vista). When I asked for what I reserved, the helpful valet (not the one who took our bags) made a call and had us moved to the type of room we reserved. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 3. Looked for the concierge on 3 separate occasions, but he or she was never at their desk. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 4. Asked the front desk clerk for an LA Weekly to see what was going on in town, Her response "we don't carry it because it would be too hard to keep in stock." It is a free paper, had come out that morning, should be available for guests in a 4 star hotel. The person who made the decision to not have it available to guests seems to have missed the point that it is hard to keep in stack because guests want to use it. Also asked for a Sunday paper at 10:00 AM and desk clerk seemed to be annoyed that I didn't get my butt up at 8:00 AM so that I could ensure I got one. Gruffly went to the back office and got me a copy. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 5. Free internet for intouch members was spotty and hotel was less than helpful in troubleshooting. This could easily happen in a 4 star. 6. Location sucks if one wants to walk to breakfast. I know it is LA and everyone drives, but it would be nice to walk to coffee in the morning. In all honesty, I grew up in LA and knew the location before booking, but think that others that are not familiar should have this info. 7. No and/or poor food or drink service at the pool. Went to the pool thinking there would be poolside service. After about 20 minutes of hanging out I went to the front desk to ask about food and drink service and to ask that the used towels in the pool area be cleaned up. I was informed that there is no regular drink service at the pool, but that I could order room service and have it delivered to the pool. I asked them to send a waiter. 20 minutes later the waiter arrived. I tried to order a margarita with a specific kind of tequila, but the waiter wasn't sure if they had it. I offered him three different options and asked him to bring me one of the 3 options. 15 minutes later he arrived not with my drink, but with a list of the tequilas they did have and then asked me what kind I wanted in my "mojito" At that point I cut my losses, informing the waiter that mojitos are not made with tequila, that I had wanted a margarita, and that it I no longer wanted anything because I had little faith that my drink would be correct or in my hand in any reasonable amount of time. This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. 8. Upon check out, valet once again took my bag but not my wife's. I am 6'4" and 230 pounds, my wife is 5'7 and 135 pounds. Who do you think needed help with their bag? This shouldn't happen in a 4 star. All in all, this hotel looks like a 4 star, but IMO the difference between a 3 and 4 star hotel are in the details, which the staff and management of the Palomar have neglected. I might stay here again if I got another incredibly low rate like the one I received for this stay, but my expectations will be severely lowered next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Clean Hotel - Like New”
Reviews.Author: c1033
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our kids. My parents also travelled with us and had their own room. I was quite pleased with this hotel. Although we did not spend much time in the public areas of the hotel, at first glance, everything was very modern and new looking. The staff was great to deal with. They were extremely friendly and helpful. The front desk was helpful in providing directions to various places and answering any questions we had. The room was like new and kept nice and clean. There were no signs of wear on the carpet/walls, etc. Travelling with small kids that touch everything, I was quite pleased to say that the housekeeper did a great job each day. We asked for adjoining rooms and the front desk easily accomodated our request. The only downside to the room was that the washroom door did not have a lock - but this wasn't a big deal. We stayed facing Wilshire Blvd. and have no complaints with noise. I believe we stayed on the 8th floor. Each morning they offered coffee. It was nice to grab a cup of coffee on our way out. Each evening they offerred a complimentary glass of wine at their bar/restaurant. There is street parking up front, but it's impossible to find. The side streets have parking but I believe you have to move your car by 7am. Parking at $30/day added up! That is my only complaint. Having said that, many of the hotels I looked in to charged around this much for parking as well. Overall, I would definately come back and stay at this hotel. The staff were great and the hotel was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benchmarktravel
Reviews.Content: I had 10 days of meetings in Beverly Hills and stayed at the Palomar. This hotel was simply the Best Experience I have had at a hotel - at any price. Fantastic Service, Food and the Bar were top notch (great music), rooms (although small) were very clean, excellent beds, great sheets and a Large Flat screen TV. Staff was extremely friendly and efficient. Complaints? I wish the TV was a bit faster to change channels or had a guide system on it. Parking is Valet only at $30 a night. Tip: Ask for a room on the South SIde of the hotel - Wilshire Blvd can be noisy. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebCole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when visiting family in Los Angeles. The hotel is awesome but, the traffic in LA is something I could never adjust to. I would have rather stayed outside of LA proper. I'd recommend the hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton great as always”
Reviews.Author: midatlantictraveler1
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm a little late writing this, since we stayed in December, but I have good memories of my stay here, so decided to write a review. This hotel lives up to the Kimpton brand, which is my family's choice whenever we stay someplace that has one. Our room was spotlessly clean, had a nice view, and HUGE bathroom. It was a 1 BR king suite. Everything in the room was typical of a Kimpton hotel, very stylish and whimsical... The bathroom was OPEN to the bedroom, so if this is not something you're entirely comfortable with, just be mindful... my wife and I were fine with it though. Wine hour was very nice and classy in the lobby. They did not have a selection of bottled beer as the Kimpton Hotel Marlowe in Cambridge, MA has (another great hotel) -- this would be a great touch for the non-wine drinkers in the crowd. Restaurant was good, we ate there one night and were impressed with the food and service. My only gripe would be the charge for mandatory valet parking. I realize this hotel charges virtually the same rate as every other hotel in the area, so it's not really a ding on them. More on the fact that you have an area of the city that is pretty much unwalkable (but where in LA really is walkable?), where you're required to have a car, and yet you have to pay an exorbitant fee for parking... but I digress. It's a great place to stay, comfortable, with typical Kimpton class. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy we picked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryNYC
Reviews.Content: I don't usually do online reviews, but I try to do it when a hotel has been exceptionally good. This was one of those experiences. The staff was consistently above-and-beyond, the hotel was cool-looking, they did little things like have the New York Times available, the free wine hour in the afternoons was nice, etc. There were even free popsicles in the lobby on a hot afternoon -- a nice touch. The location was wonderful (about 15 minutes walking distance to Westwood Village, but more importantly "centrally located" in LA so that the beach, downtown, LAX, whatever, all feel accessible). Yes, the pool area is small and shady, but truthfully I found it relaxing and cozy. The only other possible downside is the $30/day parking fee (but that's LA, and maybe everyone should just think of it as part of the room fee; in our case, we were willing to spend the 5-10 extra minutes finding on-street parking -- which we were able to do on all 4 nights of our stay with little inconvenience -- and thus saved the $). For us, this hotel was a "find" (especially for the price) and we'd come back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcohn
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and in a good location. Two small complaints, but overall I'd stay there again. The first complaint was the pool. It's small and at the back of the hotel. Seating is limited and so are the towels. The pool is in the shade of the hotel all afternoon (and perhaps morning, we only went in the afternoon). The seating is in the sun for part of the afternoon, but it was hard to find a seat and the pool was cold - had it been in the sun it might have been warmer. The second complaint, was the actual size of the room. My husband worked at the desk on his computer checking email and such and the back of the chair almost hit our king size bed. If he was sitting down, I couldn't negotiate to the other side of the room without climbing over the bed - not what I expect at a Kimpton hotel. Other than that the hotel was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: My husband & I attended the Independent Film Festival, in Westwood, this past week & stayed at the Palomar for 2 separate nights. The location could not have been better plus this property is modern & what I would call hip, with room service & they even allow dogs-a new trend in hotels. The pluses: Very comfortable beds. This is a big thing for us as we have a Temperpedic bed at home & always miss our bed when staying away. Not here! Big, flat screen t.v.'s. (2 in a suite) Room Service that was faster than the time quoted. Lots of little details that make a hotel with a difference such as; everything that you forgot they have it, at Guest Services. For instance: I cut myself & they sent a bandaid & antiseptic ointment on the double! Suites have awesome spa tubs big enough for two & great bathrooms! The Minuses: Room service Breakfast: it was quick but was not prepared as we had asked it to be (plus it was $77.00) & was just ok. We travel allot & find most hotels have this problem. So, it was no different here. Great chefs refuse to cook room service breakfast or any other kind of breakfast it seems. Your better off eating downstairs, where you can ask for something you didn't get etc, or out. On our second nights stay we were upgraded to a suite, as the hotel was almost fully booked. Zero complaint there! The bathroom was huge with a spa tub. I loved it!! But, the air conditioning didn't work in either in the sitting room or bedroom, so we had to call the hotel "engineer." That's a minor complaint as it was fixed quickly & efficiently. But, like most who travel, we appreciate a super clean room with everything in working order before we arrive. No one wants a service person in their room when they are relaxing & a hotel, that's on the ball, should routinely check all the room equipment, plumbing etc. before the room is "turned over" I feel. All in all, the hotel was very nice & we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great base in LA”
Reviews.Author: Bertha_Brown
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotwire through the mystery hotel option (for a really great rate) and after reading some of the reviews on this site I was a little worried about staying there but I shouldn't have worried. Hotel Palomar is a great hotel and a great base for a stay in LA. To the reviewers who said that it was so far away from everything - what do you mean by everything? It is very close to the airport, a short drive to Hollywood/Beverly Hills etc., a slightly longer drive to the beaches - where else do you want to go? We walked everyday into the Westwood neighbourhood for great food/drinks and we also saw the opening of the Transformers movie and a concert by Lincoln Park all walking distance from our hotel. To the reviewers who complained about parking costs - this is LA - it costs money to park at every hotel, restaurant etc. - just get used to it. We also got a discount on the valet parking because we hired a Prius which was nice. To the reviewers who complained about the service - maybe you were rude and did not get the best service possible as we did, especially the lovely smiley valet parking attendants - they were so friendly and helpful and very sweet with our children. Our kids loved the pool and we had a quiet room with a great view. So if you are reading all of the reviews below and getting worried, I would say that those people who were so negative about the Palomar probably have a bad time everywhere they go. It is great. And free wireless broadband - who doesn't like that?

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel that was a super value”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Palomar over the recent Memorial Day Weekend. We chose this hotel for its location close to Westwood, the UCLA campus and Beverly Hills and also because of the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor. This property is located on Wilshire Blvd. and sits among several high-rise residential properties. However, once you enter into the lobby, you would never know that you are on such a busy thoroughfare. During our stay, there were a few hiccups with the valet parking because we had to wait in line for the valet to take our car whenever we returned from our daily excursions. But even so, I must say that this is one of the few hotels (outside of NYC) that I have visited that seem to have a sufficient valet staff; our car was always waiting for us when we called down before heading downstairs. Our room was somewhat on the small size, but it was nicely decorated and was equipped with an acceptable flat panel HD TV, and an AC unit that kept the room cool during the heat of the day – that was a first for us. Other than that, the room was clean, comfortable and the housekeeping staff was superb. We initially had a few problems with the free wireless but that problem was quickly solved. I booked our room through Expedia and got a very nice rate for this grade of hotel, and I am glad to say that this hotel greatly exceeded my expectations. Sadly, we were never able to take advantage of the complimentary wine in the hotel bar nor did we check out the pool. Every member of the staff was professional and gracious and made us feel so welcome. We did have a rental car and if you stay at this hotel, you must have one if you plan on seeing the sights in L.A. This is a fabulous hotel if you would like to avoid the tourist crowds and you are not averse to exploring the local neighborhood on foot. We stayed for 3 days and were able to find an amazingly broad selection of restaurants and bars that were a short walk away in Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Way Overpriced Parking”
Reviews.Author: synthesis
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel in an excellent location. We stayed here for four nights and had very few complaints. The staff treated us well. The decor was beautiful. The beds were very comfortable with terrific sheets. The TV was excellent. The rooms were well maintained and very clean. Happy Hour was fun (though not the best wines in the world). They have fresh coffee and tea in the morning available in the lobby. Try for an upper floor facing the south. if you're facing Wilshire Blvd., you will hear the traffic noise no matter how high up your room. The exercise room is tricked out with lots of brand new whiz-bang machines. The pool is very small as is the entire pool area. There is an outdoor fireplace in the pool area which is a nice touch. BTW, Boulevard 16, the restaurant in the hotel is excellent. Very nicely prepared food, but not too precious. *Major Complaint: This has already been voiced by other reviewers--the cost of parking. It is the only option available and is ridiculously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people”
Reviews.Author: mountainview29
Reviews.Content: I am reading some of these other reviews and feel like I went to a totally different hotel? I stayed there a few weeks ago for a wedding in town and was treated so well by the staff. I got to check in early and the room was just great- everything you could ask for. I am relieved that I didn't end up in the same situation as the poor couple from San Diego but I think it depends on the staff member because the ones I met were very kind to me.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER... BEWARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: love2go_9
Reviews.Content: The rate for our room was good, parking was very overpriced, front desk staff very unfriendly but get the job done. The only two good things about this hotel are the room decor and the fact that they allow dogs. However my boyfriend and I travel almost monthly all over the country, Vegas, Miami, New York...etc... and this was the worst experience we have ever had. Our room/ tax/parking came out to about $180. A day later there was a $400 charge on our card on top of the $180, so $580 for a one night stay. When we called the hotel after spending 5 days tracking down an answer, I finally got a reply that housekeeping had reported that the room smelled of smoke, so we had a $400 smoking charge. We were there for one night for a funeral/memorial service, and neither my boyfriend nor I smoked in he room at any point plus we are non-smokers in general so would not smell of smoke. The assistant general manager Stefan refused to reverse the charge so now we are taking it up with our credit card company. We are both attorneys down in San Diego and are not going to let this one go! It is credit card fraud!!! Please heed my advice and avoid this hotel at all costs By the way my whole family lives in LA and I grew up there so I visit about once a month and was so happy to find a hotel where I could bring my dog, they just lost a potentially regular customer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain at $89.00”
Reviews.Author: bennyboyHouston
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain about this hotel. Great rate, room nice. Parking and food expensive but that is to be expected since the rates are so cheap. Rooms nice, not large. I do agree with the street noise though and it is a bit of a trek to find things to do close by. I would stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Property with Excellent Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: azjeans
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar in Westwood for two nights over Memorial Day weekend. Upon arrival, we were greeted at the valet by a friendly bellhop who took our luggage inside. Check-in was quick and the clerk was friendly and offered helpful information, tips and suggestions. In fact, all employees we encountered at the hotel were very friendly. Our room was on the 12th floor with good views overlooking the city. The room was an average size. The bed was comfortable and the room was spotless. I liked the contemporary décor. The bathroom was a good size and they had nice bath products. There were also several magazines to read in the room as well as the complimentary NY Times available. My only complaint about the room is that at times the walls seemed a little thin. We headed downstairs for the complimentary wine hour. It was the beginning of the Kimpton summer promotion that has summer cocktails and Wii games. We had some wine and sangria and played Wii bowling while munching on cheese and olives. Though we didn’t try the appetizers while we were at the restaurant because we had dinner plans, they looked very good and their happy hour prices were quite reasonable for a property of this caliber. Free tea and coffee was also available in the lobby each morning. As far as the surrounding area goes, we didn’t spend much time there, but it was very nice and there was stuff to do nearby. The pool at the hotel also looked inviting and there was a small fitness and business center on the 6th floor. Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at this property and would stay again. It was easy to find, the staff was excellent, and the property was comfortable and clean. Thank you Hotel Palomar for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel if you do not need to sleep”
Reviews.Author: jonesingFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some great reviews. We experienced quite a bad stay and the staff did not really seem to care. I saw a rate of $123 on Expedia and called the hotel direct to ask a few questions, Reservations offered to match the rate. #1 I was told the beds were queen size in the double rooms.They are not. My two children did not even have enough room. #2 The rooms are so small you actually cannot walk past each other and there is no closet space. #3 Traffic noise very bad. #4 We booked four nights, asked several times if there was a larger and quieter room. Was told no. The pool area is small, there are only five lounge chairs, pool big enough except there is no where to lay in the little sun not blocked by the building. #5 We had to call the operator from the pool to order food, 20 minutes later someone came to take our order. After an hour later we cancelled the order. #6 There are no close restaurants to the hotel. #7 We checked out after two days, we would have only stayed one except we were told we would have to pay an early departure fee. This was not a pleasant time by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in great West LA location”
Reviews.Author: BjornCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Your typical boutique property in a large urban area. Modern design, but some of the switches and devices were odd to operate. By the his & hers animal print wear in the closet (robes and undies), they expect you to have a wild time, alas I was by myself. The rooms are a bit small, but the gym was nice and the wine receptions just super!. A short walk to many nearby restaurants. Only had breakfast in the restaurant (old fashion American fare), but the service was superb!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: tassy3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for 7 nights during our trip to LA. We'd been to LA before so had a reasonable idea of what to expect about the hotel's location and local amenities. We walked everyday into Westwood village. It was a pleasant five to ten minute walk, and our kids did it easily and without complaint. Westwood has everything you need. and we had good access with our car to all of LA. The hotel is stylish but without being overbearing. We felt comfortable there. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room on the top floor overlooked Wilshire Blvd. There is some traffic noise but nothing unbearable. After all, it's LA. In room facilities were good. With kids in tow, we kept the mini bar locked. Restaurant prices were reasonable. The happy hour with free wine between 5 and 6pm was a nice touch. The only downside is the valet parking charge. But as we got a really good nightly rate for our rooms, by the time we added valet we were still in front of other comparable properties in the area. The pool area is great. Some reviewers have commented that it is only big enough for 'five or six people'. Don't know how big those people were, but the pool was ample for our kids and others to have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Roadroute
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire and got a great rate however there are so many hidden charges. Parking, valet only, tips everytime you need your car, Internet and the food is outrageously priced and it is not located near any other restaurants. The location is not that great, near UCLA but everything else is a drive. It took us an hour to get to Hollywood. Rooms are very small and the hotel did not feel clean. Smelled of cigarette smoke and there is no fresh air, windows do not open. The street noise is very bad. If you just want a cheap rate book it on Hotwire. Another reviewer mentioned the pool. We went out there and there is no room for more then 6-8 people and the neighbors behind the hotel look down on the pool area. Not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great, stylish, outstanding”
Reviews.Author: chain909
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palomar in April 09. Compared to most hotels in Los Angeles and Calofornia in general, this place is outstanding. Quite European styled, modern and comfortable rooms and interieur, far away from the boring sand- and earth-colored US standart room boredom. We had a suite on 16th floor with large bathroom, jahcoozi, fantastic view on Los Angeles, panoramic windows. Classic! Who does not mind surroundings with large town blocks won't be disappointed. You'll go to Santa Monica or Beverly/West Hollywood within minutes by car. Next large supermarket is 3 minutes away. A plus: free Wi-Fi. Negative, bad parking situation and expensive parking charges if you park in the hotel garage.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but not in style”
Reviews.Author: GraceyBill
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel bases on reviews. The location is not very good. It is about a mile to any restaurants or activities. Restaurant and room service very expensive, the restaurant was not open for lunch. I think that was a good thing with the prices. The pool was ridicilous. Holds maybe five people. The biggest disappointment was the room size. They are so small, hardly largr enough for one, certainly not for a family. We only paid $100 a night on Hotwire and it was not worth anymore. Oh yes, be careful of the air conditioner and street noise. They advertise free internet yet charge for the business center. Staff was OK, thirty dollars to park though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent boutique hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: misterbitterpants
Reviews.Content: Company booked the room for me and it was pleasant enough. Modern design with some nice design touches although the common area lighting is a little too 'moody' (aka dark). Nicely sized rooms for my tastes, well kept and the staff are very polite and helpful. Nice touches include: - free wireless with a strong signal (still a rarity at higher priced hotels for some reason). - Aveda bath products - LCD tvs with actual HD feeds - iPod docking alarm clock Some minor things: - windows don't open - $40 cab ride from airport - no bar scene unlike many boutique hotels Fatal flaw: - loud HVAC

Reviews.Title: “Classic Kimpton modern style comes to Westwood”
Reviews.Author: kg32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Palomar just two weeks after the doors opened. The way that the staff attended to the property and guests was more in line with a hotel that has been open for many years. As with other newer Kimpton properties, The Palomar is elegantly decorated with a warm, yet modern lobby and restaurants. The daily 5pm Happy Hour is a great way to transition to the evening. Our room was a corner King suite overlooking south Westwood. The sitting area was roomy and comfortable and the bedroom and bathroom were top notch with a jet tub, colorful leopard print robes and premium bath products. While the W is the established name in Westwood, The Palomar will be the place that I'll be staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near UCLA!”
Reviews.Author: daniellepal
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very nice and it lived up to my expectations. Great location to UCLA campus in Westwood. They let me check in around noon without a hassle or an extra fee. I had booked a king room but the one I got was actually handicap accessible so the bathroom was super-sized. I would stay there again. It is located in a safe area as well.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel leaves something to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: vince_q
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and had a wonderful experience, and it ran like a well-oiled machine. The service/staff was excellent. This month, I returned only to discover the complete opposite. I don't know if this hotel is under new management or what, but it certainly isn't up to par with my previous visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TanyaLithonia_Ga
Reviews.Content: We had a great spring break in LA. The hotel was very nice, clean, and the service was excellent. The only thing was that the rooms were small. The double beds were too small for me. Next time I would consider a suite for the four of us, my husband, twin teens and myself. But, other than that, no complaints with this hotel. Service was excellent, they required $30.00 a night for valet, but that was ok, because they were so fast and courteous. Housekeeping kept the rooms clean like I like it, if we asked for extra towels, they were they in a flash. We ate at the Blvd Restaurant for breakfast one morning...so good. The hotel offers coffee and tea in the morning, which was good. The location of the hotel was good...we did Universal, Starline Tours, shopping on Rodeo Dr, we ate at the Farmers Market and shopped at the Grove and Beverly Hills. We also drove to Malibu and had dinner at this restaurant called Geoffrey's..goood! And oh, we took the kids to the Tarpit Museum very educational. So as you can see we had a very nice "spring break", we will return to Los Angeles and stay at the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but far from things to do”
Reviews.Author: cami1978
Reviews.Content: The rooms were up to Kimpton standards -- very nice. The service was great, too. The room service was ridiculously expensive, and the restaurant closed that evening for a private event. So we bought cheese and wine from a nearby Trader Joe's. The bed was very comfortable. The coffee in the lobby in the morning was very good. The hotel was off the beaten path. Cabs to Hollywood were $30 and 30 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Njerseyborn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice, going down hill very fast. Was told it was 100% non smoking. We got a room that was awful and they could not move us because they did not have another room. It just seems like it is headed back to it's prior history as a dump. Had to wait in line to check in and out. Long waits for car. We were supposed to stay three nights and checked out early. Despite the fact we did not get a non smoking room they still charged us for an early check out. Don't bother, there are many other better hotels around. The rooms are very small and cramped.If staying more then a few days you have no closet space.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like LA”
Reviews.Author: rollwaverollnyc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel b/c of the location, close to my work. They just opened.
