Some wrinkles needed to be ironed out, they reacted quickly and professionally whenever an issue arose.I stayed many times over many mths. The hotel was completely renovated so everything was clean clean clean. Much appreciated that. The fitness center was great and often on the empty side. The restaurant/room service never left me hungry. I had one of the best halibut dishes there. The hotel company has a "green" awareness which is also appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience - EVER”
Reviews.Author: glsandrews1359
Reviews.Content: I travel about 25+ times a year for business and personal travel. My stay at the LA Kimpton Palomar was, by far, the best experience I have ever had. EVERY one of the staff we encountered during our 4-day trip was extra helpful, accomodating, friendly. The digs are ultra cool. My 14-year old daugther felt like a movie start. It also helped that the weekend we were staying, the hotel hosted a streaming media industry event. The vibe in the hotel was hot, hip, happening, vibrant. I could have felt old and out of place, but the staff never let me feel that way. The beds are a dream, the room was ultra quiet. We also found a great rate that included parking (a must for this hotel, where your only option is valet hotel parking). The location of the hotel was the best in LA. It was central to everything - the beaches, the nightlife, the sightseeing, the shopping. Yet, each night, we returned to a mellow, safe neighborhood to relax in our great room. Great job Palomar! I will definitely pick your hotels from now on when I travel. Hilton who??

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except for one small issue”
Reviews.Author: RedPatch
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with three co-workers while attending a class held by UCLA. It was for a two night stay. I found the accommodations to be extremely nice. The room was clean, the facility well kept, and the staff polite and helpful. You had your usual city noise that one would expect, but other than that, nothing more. The location was wonderful for us as our class was held just blocks away and within walking distance. The parking we used was valet, and we found them to be quick and courteous at all times. A Continental breakfast was included each day that consisted of juice, coffee, tea, a choice of bread and a pastry item. This was served at their onsite restaurant, which we did not have time to visit during lunch or dinner service. My only problem came with some missing cash that I had left in my luggage in the closet. I reported this to the front desk and mentioned to them that my door also had a problem with not shutting tightly and it required some extra tugging and jiggling. I doubt that the staff had anything to do with this, and most likely, after it had been cleaned the door probably hadn’t shut tightly and someone had taken advantage of that. They assured me they had never had this happen before and would have someone look at the door the next day. In retrospect, I should have placed my cash in the safe, but in all of my years of travel this was a first. I was grateful it was a small amount. I checked out the next morning, but hopefully, the door was indeed fixed. Also, I checked the credit card account I had used for this hotel a few days later and found a charge on it. When I called I was told it was for an item from the mini-bar. I informed them I hadn’t even received the key for the mini-bar and they told me it would be removed and it was. They were very gracious and apologetic. I mention this only so that you check your account after you leave to make sure you haven’t been mistakenly charged for something as well. Overall, I would stay here again. I have to give the hotel a four only because of the incidents I encountered, but it is a wonderful property otherwise. Also, if you are looking for a great place to eat , “The Lobster” down by the Santa Monica Pier area is a must!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay, marred by favoritism”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the Palomar in Westwood, though it was marred by an incident of favoritism. The location is pretty good. Westwood is central to a lot of LA places that many visitors want to see--Santa Monica, Sunset Strip, Beverly Hills. I found that worked even without a car, as I was on this trip. There's a lot of bus service on Wilshire Boulevard and into Westwood Village and UCLA. The hotel is also a short walk from the hotel to Westwood Village, the commercial district that adjoins UCLA. Unfortunately, the immediate setting for the hotel is Wilshire Boulevard, which in this section is a 6-8 lane high speed road, lined by high rise apartment buildings and nothing else. It's safe to walk along and cross--there are signals--but it's very noisy and not very pleasant. Even in my 18th floor room at the window (with the window closed) I could hear traffic noise, though not enough to disturb me at night. The hotel and room were pretty--in the Kimpton mold--as a previous reviewer said. I recently stayed in a Kimpton Hotel in Washington and was beginning to recognize it. The red lit elevator and dark lobby hallways were interesting. The room wasn't huge but it was big enough for one or two and had pretty much the most view that the surrounding highrises would allow. They had a very good last minute rate--$109 for a "Vista" view room, way below rack rates. No complaints on the money side. Where I saw favoritism had to do with a late checkout. They had accommodated an early check in with no problem. I asked for a late checkout to fit my bus schedule to the airport. The desk staff told me that they couldn't have any late checkouts that day. OK, no biggie, late checkout isn't a right, I stored my suitcase with them and ran an errand. When I came back to retrieve my suitcase I saw that someone else was checking out late. It was very annoying to me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel shame about the air-con unit.”
Reviews.Author: tellsitlikeitisSpain
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel after a disasterous stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt. Westwood is a lovely place much nicer than Hollywood. The Hotel staff were all very friendly, the room was lovely and spotless clean very nice decor. We used the hotel bar several times and the staff were really friendly and good company, the restaurant served fabulous food and had a great atmosphere. There are nice restaurants and bars which are quite a walk away but they provide a house car upto a certain distance, we also caught the end of a premier (which we were told happens regularly in Westwood) and the cast of Pineapple Express were supposed have stayed in the very same hotel the night before we checked in Typical! The only problem was that the air-con unit in the room was very noiser whilst it was reaching a certain temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - management went out of its way to ensure a great visit”
Reviews.Author: JoshLondon62
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Kimptom Hotels (Hotel Monaco in Denver and Salt Lake City, Sky Hotel in Aspen and Hotel Palomar in San Francisco) and my stay at this property did not disappoint. The room was great - the photos on the hotel web site accurately reflect their look. Overall the feel is stylish, but does not suffer from the forced trendiness or terminal hipness of many boutique hotels. I particularly liked the big-screen LCD TV, choice of cable channels, bathrobes, L'Occitaine bath products, bed linens, lighting with dimmers and the view from my "Vista" room. High-speed wireless internet was free and download speeds were pretty good. The lamps take some getting used to; touch or tap them to turn them on or increase their brightness. There were some minor service issues which were resolved quickly and efficiently by management. There was a water main break during my stay which didn't cause much of a disturbance beyond a brief alarm in the middle of the night. This was clearly beyond the hotel's control, however. Room service was prompt and the food was very good. Valet parking, at $30 a night, is pricey but in line with hotels in the area. I came and went as I pleased and never waited for my car to come around - I usually called a few minutes in advance. The staff was great all around - the housekeeper who serviced my room was particularly eager to help. She and her team worked around my schedule to look after the room. So despite one or two bumps, I had a great stay and would recommend the hotel to those who like to add a bit of style and fun to their travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DelmarSam
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar was very conveniently located for us as we toured. It was a great launching point for our travel in all directions, to Studio City, the Getty Center and beyond, Beverly Hills, Hollywood and Malibu. The service was exceptional and I have never encountered a more polite and friendly staff. The manager went out of his way to help me by scanning and e-mailing an important document to my daughter. In fact we were just blown away by the customer service orientation of the hotel which I suspect is reflective of the Kimpton chain. Among the nice perks were our choice of newspapers and complimentary wine service in the lobby each evening. The parking is a bit pricey, but I guess that is par for the course in a major city hotel. The parking staff was very quick in retrieving our car.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect LA Home”
Reviews.Author: SimonJWK
Reviews.Content: Having already stayed at this hotel on a mix work/family holiday trip back in August 2008, returning was just fantastic. If anything I thought the hotel had improved. In terms of other services as ever the coffee-to-go in the morning is wonderful, I managed to stop by at one of the wine hour events and I had a couple of great breakfasts in the on-site restuarant Rooms are bright and wonderfully spacious...and how great to have complimentary wifi. Really excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Highley Recommend on Every Level”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms - also recommend upgrading to suite with hot tub. (Ask for one Brad Pitt has stayed in.) Convenient location to freeways, shops and restaurants, etc. Got work done but also made time to use great amenities throughout - dining room, gym, pool and wonderful bar area. Just an overall ten!

Reviews.Title: “Above the Stars, by far, it's at the Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: garydijr
Reviews.Content: When I travel with my family, I demand top grade service to insure my families comfort. The Hotel Palomar LA far exceeded my expectations. The staff is warm and greeted us with smiles, My kids were comfortable with the staff, never a delay when something came up that we needed to make our stay as plesant as possible. I want to say thank you, A BIG THANK YOU, to the management and staff at Hotel Palomar LA, We will only be staying at this hotel when we visit the Los Angeles/Westwood area. Thank you again, it was by far one of my best hotel expierences I have ever had, and I am a very VERY AVID travler. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in the city of Angels”
Reviews.Author: nyroady
Reviews.Content: Great new Kimpton Hotel in the Westwood area of Los Angeles. The lobby area gives you an immediate sense of style in this hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and quick to address any needs. The guest room was really nice. We had upgraded to a spa suite and it was really a cool room. It offered a huge bathroom and amazing spa tub. The room and furniture were really comfortable and had lots of style. I wish I had some of the pieces in my own home. I brought my laptop and the suite had a great work desk and the internet connection worked easily. They did a wine hour each night so that was very enjoyable to grab a glass of wine on our way up before dinner. It has a great location on Wilshire not far from the 405 so our access to West Hollywood and Santa Monica was just minutes in each direction. We did have dinner in the restaurant one night. I ordered the Orchiette Pasta with Wild Mushrooms and it was fantastic. They had a pool but it was cooler out when we were there so never got a chance to check it out. All in all, it was a great experience and I would highly recommend the Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Service at Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: DaddyDab
Reviews.Content: In January, I was the recipient of an award for "24 Heroes" by the FOX Network. Part of the prize was flying to Los Angeles and staying at the Hotel Palomar. From the second you arrived on the property, the staff of Hotel Palomar gave us five star service. Every employee at the hotel greeted my companion and I on sight with a smile. This type of service makes a stay at the Palomar an enjoyable pampered experience. The location of the hotel is perfect. They are located in Westwood on Wilshire Blvd. which is close to everything from the Getty Museum, Grahman's Theater, Beverly Center, Beverly Hills, West Hollywood and Hollywood. Santa Monica and Venice Beaches are just a short drive away. I also loved the facts that they are ecology and pet friendly. Just two more reasons to give them a try. Various services are available and they also had a wine party early evening for their guests in the handsomely decorated lobby. The restaurants and room service both had an excellent choice of selections and more of the signature excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bjo616
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent from the rooms to the hotel staff. The rooms were spacious, clean and well decorated. The location was very convenient to Beverly Hills, Malibu and downtown Santa Monica. The hotel made great dinner recommendations for us on Friday and Saturday night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel and a good value. Location is utilitarian.”
Reviews.Author: Modern_Art_Lover
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Helpful staff. Snazzy decor and furnishings. And the wine every evening was a nice touch -- and good for business socializing. The restaurant food was delicious but inattentive with very long waits, even when told we're in a hurry. The bell staff, tending to luggage and parking, was wonderfully hospitable and efficient. This location was convenient for my business purposes -- and in L.A., roadway geography is key. But there's not much for half a mile around except for Manhattan-style apartment buildings and busy Wilshire Blvd. But a walk over to Westwood Village brings life back to the environs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar-Westwood is as good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: wsbull57
Reviews.Content: I have always been a big fan of Kimpton Hotels but the Hotel Palomar-Westwood exceeded even my already high expectations. The physical structure is stunning, the rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable, the restaurant is amazing, but it is the staff here that really puts this property over the top. I travel for a living and I consider where I stay as my home away from home. Well if it were possible I would like for the Hotel Palomar-Westwood to become my permanent home.

Reviews.Title: “how the other half live”
Reviews.Author: borance
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of this hotel is gorgeous - the unique wallcoverings, the sculptures, the furniture, the selection of colors and on and on. We felt we were surrounded by great beauty and kept finding more. It's located in a really upscale area of Los Angeles and the guests seemed to match. The help is extremely friendly and expresses great willingness to help. However, ... I phoned for a replacement for the four feather pillows because I am violently allergic to feathers. They brought up four new pillows, two of which were also feathers. Had I not noticed, I would have become so ill my vacation would have been ruined. We asked for more foam pillows but never got them. We discovered a naproxin sodium capsule on the floor of each of the two rooms we rented. Our 9-month old granddaughter was crawling on the floor. That could have been disastrous. We found a whole Oreo cookie under one of the end tables. The couch (probably called a day bed) is pretty useless in that one really can't sit on it. The hotel was a great location for the top tourist attractions and fine dining in L.A. We didn't eat in the beautiful restaurant because I don't like American or Euro food. The valet brings your car to you in record time.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: lebyvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night , we thought we will try it first and if we felt comfortable we can extend our stay for three more nights. It's not the first time to stay at kimpton hotels , the one in portland is awesome . When we arrived , three guys welcomed us , they jump all around u and ofcourse they are expecting tips ,one opened the door one opened the other door and someone else to took care of luggage , YES it's nice but a little bit too much . as we r payin 30 $ already for parking . I think one guy for parking is more than enough. the room is nice on the 15th floor, tons of dust(I a not usually a complainer) but the dust so obvious to ignore. Now at night ,first I heard a knock on my door , i openned to find out that it's not my door but our neighbours, requesting some service , that happened 3 times , the last one was around 11 00 pm. Thank God we were so tired that we ignored the noise (I am not sure if there is a bar or soemthing there ) We loved the colors of the room , very elegant Now coffee , why is it so hard on u guys to put a coffee maker in the rooms , YES sometimes we feel like drinking coffee in the afternoon without the need to make a request (there are people who like their life simpler ) bathtub doesnt drain water , so water was sitting till the next morning , I told the conceirge , her answer was "ok !" not even a sorry and that made me decide to leave right away and when we left , same scenario , three helping us to to carry , One handbag and a computer bag It's a nice hotel so it's really sad to see it like that

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of an Emperor or Empress”
Reviews.Author: kooltraveler84
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palomar and it was a really great experience. From the the moment I arrived everyone was so helpful and friendly. And the inside is really smart and cool. . No really, inside its modern, sophisticated, and DEFINITELY feel as if I am in Los Angeles. It has that cool, yet upscale look. I would say its "trendy" but not annoying or too cool for school like some other LA Boutique hotels. It has a COMPLIMENTARY, yes complimentary wine hour everyday from 5-6!!! I'm not a lush but who doesn't love free drinks. Im seriosly excited about this place and I joined their points program because I wanna stay here again and see their other hotels. They have a really cool one opening in Miami. Im actually at work right now writing this review because I want to come back! They have free wi-fi, which for business I really need. Its right in one of the nicest neigborhoods in LA, right next to beverly hills, bel-air. westwood and really close to santa monica. The bed was extremely comfortable, I was basically sleeping on a cloud in heaven. Their restaurant is really delcious also. But mostly what makes the huge difference is the service. Everyone is so eager to help and make you feel really comfortable and at home. Like I said, this is fit for and Emperor, or Empress, a really hip and cool Emperor or Empress

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved every minute! Stunning lobby. Nice room with great view. Loved the big plasma tv and modern finishes. Free wine between 5 and 6 every night. Full service continental breakfast in lounge-like restaurant. One negative, $30 per day parking was a bit much we thought. There is parking on side streets (Selby) , just read signs. Very close to Beverly Hills in beautiful Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bravens
Reviews.Content: Loved the Palomar! Funky decor and comfortable rooms. The staff could not have been nicer. It's not often that my husband and I want to hang out in the lobby but that is exactly what we did during the free happy hour! They even gave us a free ride to the restaurant for dinner. Parking was expensive but the valet's were very efficient. Centrally located and right off the freeway. Only complaint was the barking dogs on my floor but they seems to calm down by the time we went to sleep. Maybe all the dogs should be on one designated floor?!

Reviews.Title: “Palomar needs to work on the details...”
Reviews.Author: tchoneymonner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just okay. It was well kept and had a modern style that was appealing (however we found the amount of animal prints used from the bathrobes to the bedding, a bit much). The hotel had some issues that we didn't appreciate. First of all, we noticed that the staff, although quite attentive, were pretentious and sometimes rude. Twice while we were there and asked questions regarding a charge on your room that we were unaware of, we got the "well this is a 4 star hotel and this kind of charge is quite normal for this type of a hotel." I thought that kind of attitude was unneccsary, as we stay in 4 and 5 star resorts frequently and it had nothing do do with the unauthorized charge on our card. They finally rectified the unauthorized charge (with an attitude), but this kind of behavior was constant throughout the staff, and was just unnecessary. Also, I'm not sure if it was just an issue when we were staying there, but the TV's had very limited channels. Some of the few channels that actually worked had signal problems and very bad reception. We found this annoying when you just wanted to watch TV before bed and relax. They mention how amazing their hotel is constantly while you're there, one would think that having basic, working TV channels would be standard. As previous review have mentioned there is a coffee and tea bar in the mornings from 6am-9am. We would have preferred to have a coffee maker in the room or in addition to the bar in the lobby (standard for all levels of hotels now). There were times when I was working from my room and wanted a cup of coffee in the middle of the day, but had no access to it since the coffee/tea bar was long gone and there was no way to make coffee or hot water in my room. Parking is steep at $30 a day, but the valets are attentive and bring your car around promptly. These are all small details, but things that the we thought The Palomar truly overlooked. It seems that more thought is put into the design and pretentiousness of the hotel, with less focus on the guests. The beds however, were quite comfortable with plenty of pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Except It Needs Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: Boy_Scout
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar Los Angeles does all the right things, but be prepared to take a luke warm shower. Being from the east coast, I was up most mornings around 4 AM. The 3 mornings I was at the hotel I had at best a luke warm shower each morning. I was traveling with two other business associates and they reported the same issue, at about the same time of the morning. Hot water was abundant in the evening. Other than the hot water, the Palomar is a very nice hotel and was very reasonably priced. I would have rated this hotel 5 stars if I hadn't had the hot water problem. This hotel was originally another brand and was recently refurbished as the Palomar. My room was attractive and quiet. The temperature control was good and the bed was very comfortable. The work station in the room was comfortable and efficient. Each morning the hotel had coffee in the lobby. Not just any coffee, but about the best coffee I've ever had. Each evening during my stay the hotel also had a wine hour in the lobby with different wines each night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeSD001
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the Palomar partly because of the good reviews here. It exceeded our expectations. Nice room, everything looked new and spotlessly clean. Neat modern arty decor. We got a complimentary upgrade to a room with beautiful view of LA from the 17th floor. The bed was big and comfy with a bunch of fluffy pillows and a really warm comforter (actually too warm). Most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in a hotel. The staff was great. We didn't need them much, but they were friendly, helpful and efficient when we did. The two nights we were there, the room was extremely quiet. Probably due to the high floor we were on and not many people being around. Some people have noted that the A/C is very noisy. In our room, it wasn't. We could hear it turning on, but the sound was not loud by any stretch. Nice touches - 42" LCD HD TV, large room safe, plush bath robes, high quality shampoo/conditioner. The hotel is in a good location. We caught a movie at the theatre a safe two block walk away. Or you can walk to Westwood Village. Drive down Wilshire Blvd. and there are a ton of stores and restaurants. Hop on the freeway to the Getty Center (which we did and had a great time) or Santa Monica Beach. A few nits - you cannot control the water flow in the sink faucet, only the temperature. More than a few times, I ended up splashing water all over the place due to the high water pressure. You hang up towels to reuse, but they get replaced anyway. Parking is $30 a day, valet only. That didn't bother me much though given the low room rate. We got the AAA rate of $161 a night on a holiday weekend. What a great deal! We really enjoyed our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: skramer10
Reviews.Content: what a great new hotel, i'm telling all my entertainment clients about it. The room was really well done and the staff was one of the best I've encountered. Thanks Palomar, see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Hotel Scene in Westwood/La”
Reviews.Author: Arizona1940
Reviews.Content: I want to say this was a delightful hotel. Well run and the staff were outstanding. The room decor and amenity's were perfect. It was a good location, and made my stop over part of my very long journey from Asia very nice and much easier., and most important memorable Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Palomar”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: We chose The Palomar for a one night stay at the back end of a trip to California because it was a new hotel, in a convenient area, and we enjoyed a stay at another Kimpton property earlier this year. Overall we enjoyed our time here and it offered good value, but we would not want to stay at this hotel for more then a night or two. If you have stayed at a Kimpton hotel, you know the room décor is always unique and a little different. At this location, we did not love the look of the room. The colors were mostly black and brown, with some splashes of brighter colors thrown in. There were too many patterns in the room including a snake skin pattern on the face of the dresser. The room came across as too dark and busy, and not very relaxing. As others have mentioned, the room was a little small as was the bathroom. South facing rooms have nice views, North facing rooms overlook busy Wilshire Boulevard and condos. I believe the hotel used to be a Doubletree before Kimpton took over, and was not built from the ground up as a new hotel. The rest of the hotel is pretty nice with a good boutique hotel feel with a little clublike atmosphere thrown in. We did not use the restaurant but we did check out the pool. The pool is decent size but the pool area is long, narrow, and lined up very close to the building. There are two attractive conversation areas but only five or six oversized lounge chairs for sitting in the sun at a hotel with over 200 rooms. We were at the pool late in the afternoon so some were available, but this is not a hotel for very many people to hang out by the pool. Overall The Palomar is a nice hotel with a central location. The staff was also very friendly and the happy hour is a nice touch rarely found at big city hotels. But not everyone will like the rooms and in a great weather city like LA, the pool setup is not large enough for a hotel this size.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: yuh8n
Reviews.Content: This is a world class property. My wife and I travel the world and have never had a better experience. The food, the staff, the surroundings, I will certainly be back again. My wife had surgery and they were kind enough to host us for her recovery. They had a wheel chair waiting, fresh fruit in the room, and the most amazing room with the finest linens with an outstanding view of downtown LA and the Pacific. I hope that every person has the opportunity to experience the pinnacle of hospitality that this resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnnieB
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel room, and loved the facilities. Had the most amazing meal in the restaurant, and full compliments to the chef. Good location for driving to most of the sights, and getting into downtown LA. However, be prepared to pay $30 per day for parking, and it's too far to walk to the main attractions - you'd need a car. Staff couldn't do enough for us, and we felt very welcome. However, I feel we paid over the odds for the accommodation, and - especially the $30 parking, plus $6 for 15 minutes on the internet (!) If these small things had been included in the price I think I would feel like we had got our moneys worth! Noisy toilet but very comfy bed. Get a key for the minibar which is a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cdngirl7500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 4-day girl's weekend and had a great time. Rooms are clean and decor is great - very LA! The rooms and bathrooms are also a decent size so there is room for two girl's suitcases, shopping, etc. while still allowing room to move. The lobby has a nice sophisticated-but-comfortable vibe and there are all types who stay here - couples, families, business travellers, and those on trips with friends. And there are also pets - we were startled by a beautiful golden retriever when we got off the elevator one morning! Service is very good overall - attentive, friendly and very helpful. The concierge, Paul, made some great recommendations for a Saturday night out including AOC, which we didn't realize until afterwards was such a highly-regarded restaurant. He also gave tips on when to arrive at Bar Marmont so that we could be sure to enjoy the Saturday night vibe and miss the line! A few small things. Room service, although 24 hour, is expensive and the restaurant closes around 10 or 11, so come prepared if you get in on a late flight! There is also a very limited night menu (from 11 PM or 12 to 6 AM). Also seems that there are a fair number of new staff right now. They are all trying hard and doing a great job but some of them don't yet have a good knowledge of the area/sights and some processes - like an early morning check-out - were a little slow. But everyone is keen and friendly - the most important thing. This hotel is in a nice area but you do have to walk a bit to get to shopping, etc. But it's LA so to be expected - just about anyone visiting the city should be prepared to rent a car. Valet parking is $30/day. A little pricey but definitely cheaper than the downtown areas of a lot of major cities - San Fran, NY. We didn't look into other parking options so don't know if self-park is available. Overall a great stay for two girls looking for a fun weekend!

Reviews.Title: “incredible and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: peacewellnesscenter
Reviews.Content: We found the Palomar Hotel to be beautiful, first rate and very customer oriented. We were treated like royality and felt like our vacation was worth the trip. Great Job to everyone there. We will be coming back!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my birthday, my housband and I decided to make a trip to L.A., and after an exhousting search, decided to book the Palomar in Westwood. It was our first time in the area, and were very pleased with the location of the hotel. It's on Wilshire Blvd and eventhough its not on a commercial zone, (The Westwood Village its about a 10 min. walk) the area its beautiful, full of trees and charming houses, we had the chance to walk in the neigborhood and were delighted ! The hotel its very modern, super clean and well decorated. The rooms are very comfortable, the bed is super, the pillows and linens are very nice, and the bathroom has a nice size too. Very good service at the restaurant and the food is good but a little expensive. A plus are the wine hour from 5-6 p.m, and coffee and tea bar in the morning. All the staff is very attentive. Also I want to recommend if you're in the area: Vincenti restaurant its the best italian I've ever visit!!! It's in Brentwood and its a 5-8 min. cab ride, very well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Service and style”
Reviews.Author: LoveLA63
Reviews.Content: If you have business on the Westside of LA the location is great. I like a contemporary style so the decor was appealing. The morning complementary gourmet coffee in the lobby is a great touch as it has a living room feel to it that lends itself to easy conversation. I am generally focused on my business but I found it nice to relax for a bit and meet some interesting people before getting on with my day. I prefer suites hotels and this one has huge bathrooms, definitely larger than most. The jacuzzi tub is big enough for a party. The rooms were good size with flat panel TV's in both the living room and bedroom. It was either recently built or remodeled as everything was new. The staff was professional with a high end touch as you would expect from a hotel in this range. I have only stayed once so my impressions may change over time. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: We switched our Los Angeles room booking to the Hotel Palomar at the last minute because I received a great deal via email from Kimpton. (I am a member of their In-Touch loyalty program.) The Hotel Palomar is relatively new, located in a remodeled former Doubletree. The building itself is pretty uninteresting, but the inside has received a huge makeover. The lobby was small-ish, but comfortable during the evening wine reception. The regular rooms felt a little on the small side, but I think this was mostly because there is too much large furniture packed into them. The king bed in our room was very very comfortable with great linens. There was also a desk, dresser, two nightstands, coffee table, and chaise lounge in the room. Our room looked exactly like the pictures on the website. The front desk staff was pleasant and housekeeping did an amazing job of keeping the room neat and clean. We ordered room service one night and the person delivering was very friendly and personable. Only the valets were a little surly. The location isn't very exciting, but it's near UCLA and very central for doing other things in the area. We were an easy drive from the Getty Center, Santa Monica, West Hollywood, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to miss with this new Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: RogerWM
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel, and were very pleased. The rooms were well appointed, very clean, the staff efficient, professional and extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Westwodd”
Reviews.Author: LittleCupcakes
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a not bad one night stay at the Kimpton Westwood. I was in town to see a play at UCLA and the hotel was well-located for that purpose. The rooms were nice, not great, and a touch on the small size (I had a Deluxe View room). The view was indeed terrific, but they charge a bit more for view rooms. There was excellent water pressure, and the bed was very comfy. Check in and out was quick and efficient, and the staff were helpful at every turn. The bar staff in particular impressed me. Even though the small but stylish (actually, nearly everything at the hotel was small and stylish) bar was nearly empty, these folks were running around doing all sorts of work, instead of leaning back and texting while waiting for closing time. Bad news: the minibar in the room rattled all night, and the A/C system was quite loud. The elevators were slow. All in all, a good stay. It's not cheap, but if need a cool place near Westwood, you could do much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jchgo972
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Palomar last week and was very satisfied. I have stayed at many Kimpton Hotels including their Palomar brand in SF and Dallas. The staff were very friendly, my room was well laid out and I loved the location on Wilshire (as I stayed for business). My coworkers complained about the A/C being loud but I had no issues. The valet had a few missteps but were very apologetic. I would definitely stay at the Palomar again... I also ate at the bar for dinner twice and the bartenders were extremely friendly and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar - Westwood Los Angeles is simply Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: PalmSpringsSpanky07
Reviews.Content: From begining to end a great experience. Excellent welcome and friendly valet staff. The front desk transaction was seemless! We loved that this was a pet friendly hotel. The room was amazing they really did this place up with quality materials. Unlike most hotels the restaurant was wonderful. Try and get the private dining area on the right side... The location allowed us to hit Beverly Hills for shopping and than go to my medical appointment on monday at UCLA. Just Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “The finest hotel in LA for it's price, just add self parking option”
Reviews.Author: Ronald_1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the Palomar hotel in Westwood, mostly based on location, an attractive 50% off offer on Expedia and its #1 ranking on Tripadvisor. And this is sure the ranking this former Doubletree hotel, now stylish renovated by Kimpton, deserves. Not just for the big spotless rooms with countless amenities like a huge LCD TV and the best king I've slept on during my whole 4 week stay in the USA or the excellent location (just minutes away from Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and UCLA) in a safe neighboorhood. Most of all this hotel is my new LA favorite spot because of the most attentive and truly friendly staff. From front office, to bell and valet everybody gives you that warm welcome feeling like you are at home and will do almost everything to make your stay as pleasant as possible. I cannot remember any other hotel on the many trips I've made to the USA where I found a similar experience. They even offer a complimentary wine hour, but we were to busy exploring LA to join ! Only thing missing was a balcony to enjoy the streetlife or hotel view and the WiFi reception was unfortunality rather bad. But nevertheless this hotel would be my choice again next time (hopefully again with a good Expedia offer 'cause their rack rates are kinda pricy for me, though worth the money). Final remark is that the hotel parking is also pricy (USD 30 overnight) and they only offer valet service. As an European I'd prefer to do the parking myself (although the valets are most attentive) but I simply find self parking more comfortable. So it would be perfect if the hotel would offer self parking too, their indoor parking lot is huge and the infrastructure surely allows possibility of self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, exceptional staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tibsenkid
Reviews.Content: Usually stayed in West Hollywood, but, heard from a friend about this place in Westwood. Tried it out and found everything, from the welcoming front desk folks to the housekeepers, not to mention the fabulous bed, made it one of the nicest hotel stays I've experienced in a long time...and I just stayed at the St. Regis in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Beautiful, comfortable, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Paris1scarf
Reviews.Content: Here is a great choice for the Westwood/Santa Monica area of Los Angeles. We arrived at 10:00 pm, exhausted, and experienced a courteous and quick valet service. Being unfamiliar with the Kimpton brand, we were pleasantly surprised when we walked into the minimal, but beautiful lobby. Our quiet room was designer beautiful (and I usually do not care for contemporary styling). A sliding bathroom door done in knockout red greeted us. Then we saw a headboard soaring above 5 pillows, a curving sofa, and a widescreen television! L'Occitane bath products are offered, and bathrobes are in the closet. The bed was so comfortable, but we did not care for the comforter...too hot for LA. The pool and pool area are small, but the lounges are comfortable and towels are provided. No drink service at pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TheFunBear
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived the staff was extremely gracious and helpful. Check in was a breeze, and advice from the concierge was very helpful on what to do in the area and how to get around town. I booked a Vista Deluxe room and was not disappointed in the least, bed was comfy, room was quiet, nice big TV, nice bathroom, good water pressure in shower...all good. One of my friends booked a Spa Suite, it was Awesome, I have to admit, I was just a bit jealous... We hung out with our friends one night in the hotel restaurant Blvd 16 and had a great time and tried most of the appetizers which were great. I wish we would have given the entrees a try, but maybe next time... The chef even came over and took a minute to sit with us, he mentioned that the hotel is also pet friendly which we didn't know. It was nice to run into someone who loves dogs as much as we do! All in all, a great experience at the Palomar, I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite found its soul yet”
Reviews.Author: JeffBarnes
Reviews.Content: Let me firstly say that there is nothing wrong at all about this hotel. It is in excellent condition (quite new I believe), the staff are friendly and helpful and the room we had was absolutely fine - especially the bed. It just seems to lack an identity and character which I expect will come in time. The location is not great as it sits on the busy Wilshire Boulevard (not noisy inside though) and it is a good walk to find somewhere to eat if you want to step out rather than eat in the restaurant which is soulless. The best place to go is up towards UCLA. Forget the pool - it seems to be an afterthought and barely gets the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: focuscc
Reviews.Content: We had a 7 night stay as part of our annual holiday to the USA from the UK. The room was small for 3 people (me, wife and 13 yr old daughter), the beds were only regular double size and not the usual queen that we get in Florida but the room would have felt even smaller if they were. There was no mirror in the main room which caused problems when you have 2 ladies trying to get ready at the same time, we ended up having to buy a mirror from Walmart. Like others have said the A/C was noisy but because we were so tied from all day sightseeing it only caused slight inconvenience, in fact the A/C from another room woke me up more than ours!!! The $30 valet parking was expensive especially when you include a tip every time you want it. For the 7 nights it would have cost $210 + tips so after the 1st night I parked in the street 1 block down as parking was free between 08:00 am to 06:00 pm and 2 hrs during. Because we were out all day I had free parking from 10:00 am to 04:00 pm and never had a problem finding a space and only 2-3 minute walk. As I don't drink wine it would have been nice if beer was offered as an alternative during the free happy hour. We did have to call the front desk at 02:00 am Saturday as the next room guests were playing loud music and singing along (badly), but security was sent to the room and it got quiet from then on. Overall it was a pleasant stay but I would find someware different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Diego1
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I've been to in a very long time. I've been to a few Kimpton hotels in different parts of the country and they have very consistent service but the Palomar sets the bar for this company. I had a few setbacks on the trip with lost luggage/phone and the staff was very helpful in guiding me to the right places. It was great- I was there with my girlfriend (business trip turrned vacation) and it was incredibly romantic - a beautiful room with views, perfect restaurant and really just a great LA experience. If you get the chance stay there!! I love this place and I'll definitely be there next time I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice but.....”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_SF
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed over a Fri/Sat night weekend. First off, the location is super safe and can't be beat. It's on a great stretch of Wilshire Blvd., next to Westwood/UCLA, close to Santa Monica, LAX, etc... and beautful residentail neighborhoods.I thought the front staff to be very accomodating and nice. The hotel is chi chi boutique, the rooms are smaller but nicely furnished, the restaurant had really great food, i was surprised by that. The pool area in the back is totally cute as well. Downside, the A/C is extremely loud! Like crazy loud. It scared me! I couldn't sleep with it on and during the day, i tried not to listen to it. An engineer came up and checked it and said I actually had a quieter room. I could tell this was a refurbished older property, as I could also hear the upstairs shower & sink, something you expect in a motel. The $30 a day parking was steep but at the same time, it was kinda convenient, becuase you just went out front and in a minute, the valet had your car for you, so you pay for your convenience. I only paid $179 which was i think worth it in this area, however if i had to pay something like over $300, i'd rather fork out at one of the older grander hotels for that kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aftab-D
Reviews.Content: Great location, great accomodations, great design. I had dinner in the restaurant and ordered room service for breakfast, In both cases the food and service was outstanding. The hotel deserves an A. I will return again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get good price”
Reviews.Author: DANTRIPFREE
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel in a very good location. Really a good choice if you'd like to visit the best of LA. Close to BH, Bel Air, Holliwood, Ucla, ecc. The hotel is really new but the AC was very, very loud in my room. Good hotel but...quite expensive...wait for the right price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: wilbo-wanderer
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, traffic horrendous - why does everyone in LA travel at the same time? The hotel was a welcome sight. From the valet parking onwards the staf took control and made our arrial as easy and enjoyable as possible. Still served dinner at 10pm - ararity in California. Room great with excellent views. Close to the Getty Center which is why we boked it. Lived up to our expectations of a Kimpton hotel having stayed with the same chain in Chicago. Dinner well above average.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: hannahkumar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king bed suite for 5 nights. after reading the reviews on trip advisor. What a Nightmare. The hotel is located at the center of everything, the Rooms are okay but the noise is terrible . None of us could sleep all night . The AC was too loud and we were given the top floor so the room was very hot and we were not able to use the AC because of the noise,. The Road noise was the worst, every single second we were able to here the traffic. It is not worth the money. The front desk Staff were very indifferent to our problem. Please don't stay in this hotel Hannah

Reviews.Title: “way too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: ck_in_the_OC
Reviews.Content: beware, the expense does not end with the room charge! for a famiy of 4 to sightsee in la, we booked this hotel because of its central location. my husband is a frequent business traveler LA and says that downtown is not safe at night. we balked a little at spending more than $300, but figured we'd have this SUPER room. for the price we got a average sized room with artsy furniture. the room was not ready when we arrived and the toilet would not work unless you took off the top of the tank to manually flush it. we were shocked at the $30/day parking. we made the mistake of ordering a pot of coffee and 4 OJs one morning and couldn't believe the charge was more than $60!! in summary it is a NICE hotel, but i don't think you get what you pay for. i've stayed in much nicer hotels for less. i would not go back there unless someone else was paying the bill.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: keithblaser
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 2 days and three nights along with my mother, father and sister. We loved every minute of it! The hotel was so warm and inviting it made it hard to leave everyday. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. The General Manager of the hotel, John Duponce, was at the front desk when we were checking in and came around to shake our hands and welcome us personally to his hotel. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. We loved the bathrooms! The restaurant, Bvd. 16, was absolutely beautiful. We expected the food to be average since we were dining in the hotel, but to our surprise it was amazing! The chef did an excellent job creating the menu. What we liked to take away from this hotel experience was the overall FEEL you get when it's all over. Sometimes its hard to pinpoint WHY we (people in general) feel a certain way. All we know is that it was good or bad. In this case, we felt at home, comfortable and taken care of. We felt good and Hotel Palomar made it happen. We will definately stay here again when we return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel IF You Get The Right Price”
Reviews.Author: ttocsffej
Reviews.Content: As a regular "Kimptonite," I stay at many of their hotels each year. As a frequent visitor to L.A. I was even more interested to see their entry to the market, and so I booked a stay here in July. When pulling up to the building (in a great block of Wilshire close to UCLA and Westwood,) I remembered it to be a former Doubletree, where I had also stayed in the past and not had great experiences. On the whole--what a difference Kimpton makes! However, for the price paid--$359 per night at the time--I have some quibbles. The staff, as pointed out elsewhere, ranges from "overly familiar" to "downright snotty," depending upon where they are stationed. (Those behind the desk need to loosen up a bit, and those attending to baggage and parking could be a bit more polished. On the whole though, not bad--particularly for L.A, and management seems to be trying to strike the right tone.) The lobby is minimalist in style, while still managing to be warm and inviting due to the earthy color scheme and furniture. However, the double-sided glass and marble fireplace, a nice touch, was a bit TOO warm for July. It heated the lobby area to an unacceptable level, making it somewhat uncomfortable to linger over the generous and complimentary evening wine reception. Some advice--either turn off the gas in the summer or crank up the air conditioning! As is the usual with Kimpton Hotels, the common areas are really nice, and this is especially true of the workout room. It has card access, individually controlled AC, and lots of top-notch elliptical and treadmill equipment. A bar cooler with complimentary bottled water and chilled towels is a nice touch. Now to the rooms: I'm afraid no amount of offbeat animal-print furnishings, black brocade headboards, turquoise bolster pillows and wooden sliding bathroom doors can disguise this building's more proletariat origins. The rooms are narrow and fairly small, with a very conventional hotel layout. So while this is a nice decorating effort, the room layout leaves a lot to be desired. In fact, with the scale of furnishings used, the rooms border on "cramped"...largely because they are so narrow. The bathrooms are reworked but still not what I would call luxurious, with a small (5ft.) conventional tub and shower combination. Tip: the so-called "Vista" rooms have a truly unexceptional "view" of the UCLA area and are not worth the extra bucks in my opinion. The upcharge for them is almost insulting. I suggest a standard Wilshire-view room; in these you may at least spot something "interesting" going on in one of the many highrise condos across the street!! More than anything, it's the conventional layout of this non-descript 80's hotel building which lets down the Palomar. The decor and everything that goes into running a fine hotel is in place. The problem for Kimpton here will be the rates. Once crossing the $350 mark, there are many other nicer choices in better locations, as far as I am concerned. This hotel competes with others such as Joie de Vivre's "Angeleno", but not with the true four or five star hotels in the area--which, these days, are often running specials too. Do I recommend the Hotel Palomar and would I go back? That depends. Actually, I am doing so in August for two nights for a special rate of $179 per night. At that price it's a steal...and HIGHLY recommended. But when the rates go back up to the mid $300s or more, I am likely to stay elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Shagadellic”
Reviews.Author: travellingchef81
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay in LA. I liked the morning coffee, location and privacy. rooms are very nice and attendants are detail oriented. My favorite place away from home. Bravo Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 'Modern' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fedexflyer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is the latest location in the Kimpton Group's chain of boutique hotels. All of the distinctive Kimpton touches are there - evening wine reception, premium morning coffee, very comfortable bed, L'Occitane toiletries, great upscale restaurant on-site. The Westwood-area hotel is easily accessed on Wilshire Blvd., which is good, since most area restaurants and shops will require a drive (or at least a very long walk). Everything looked new, which makes sense as the hotel was extensively renovated and has only been open as a Palomar for three months. The staff seemed friendly and eager, but unpolished (I generally don't expect to hear the terms 'cool' and 'awesome' being used by the staff during check-in). The rooms seemed somewhat smaller than usual, but were clean, and included both very nice details (42" flat panel television, chaise lounge, ample lighting with touch controls) and disappointing shortcuts (no HD on the TV, cheapish furniture). During my stay I was able to enjoy a dinner at BLVD 16, the combination restaurant/lounge just off the lobby. The food was good, the service was very attentive and the atmosphere was festive--the restaurant was still quite busy at 10 at night. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and recommend the Palomar, particularly if you like your hotel with lots of 'attitude'.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto the below review...an excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: I usually write pretty detailed (and hopefully helpful!) reviews, but I just saw the new review below from 'bocafive' and my experience was absolutely identical on all counts. I've stayed at most of the $400+ per night L.A. hotels, and for less than half of the price, the Palomar was exceptional. To echo bocafive's experience, we enjoyed the convenience of the location, fantastic value, quality and style of the renovations given it's an older hotel, the friendly and efficient staff, and free wireless access. The a/c might be a little loud as others have said, and the walls are on the thin side, but neither of those issues did anything to diminish the quality of our stay. The one thing I wasn't expecting was the huge wine reception crowd in the lobby when we arrived, which made it very loud and chaotic, but it was much more peaceful and quite attractive environment later in the evening when we returned from dinner. This location is fantastic for anyone visiting UCLA or Beverly Hills businesses, as the BH border is just a couple of minutes up Wilshire. Kimpton seems to be pretty generous with perks for its repeat guests --- I got a ridiculously low rate with free parking via an email offer as a prior Palomar San Francisco guest. I'd suggest that anyone considering a stay here (or at any Kimpton) sign up for their special offer email in case something like this is offered again. Overall --- sure, I'd rather stay at the Peninsula or the Beverly Wilshire, but I can only swallow their big rates on more special occasions. I've shopped the competition, and especially under $250, I think the Palomar is the best overall value in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Sw
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for three nights. We liked the hotel and the location. The room looked modern. We got a great deal (close to 50% of the normal rate) so it was good value for us. The only complaint would be the noise. You could easily hear the neighbor above walking around and slamming doors. Also the AC was very loud. Btw, there are stores, coffee shops etc only about one block away (a few minutes walk).

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST...”
Reviews.Author: HIPPINO
Reviews.Content: We have just left the hotel: what a wonderful experience!!! The hotel is brand new and the staff is incredibly helpful. Our room, a king deluxe, was decorated with design furniture and in the wardrobe we found bathrobes (Roberto Cavalli style). In the lobby, you can have a cup of coffee in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening. The location is also great: Westwood is quiet, but near all the attractions. Don't forget to plan a visit to the Getty Musuem: the view is stunning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: bocafive
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my last night before flying home from Los Angeles. I stayed at that Beverly Hills Hotel and Shutters on the Beach before the Palomar/Westwood. Although the Beverly Hills hotel is in a different catagory...the Palomar was an excellent value and a fine choice for tourists and business people alike. I booked the hotel at 189 on a AAA rate which was a great price for a great LA location (Wilshire Blvd). The hotel is older and recently renovated. Check in was first rate, the valet was super friendly and smiling and they knew my name by the time I approached the front desk. The staff were really friendly and welcoming. My room was a typical sized chain hotel layout but the renovations and decor were really edgy and super comfortable. Great linens, great big screen television, desk, FREE wifi, and a cool bathroom with stylish sink/ammenities. Of note, the hotel offers a free wine hour in the evening which was well attended, the lobby is eclectic with a fireplace, very comfortable. Hotel security was visable and reassuring. I did not get to the pool or restaurant. I want to give kudos to the front desk staff. My son and I went to Westwood village for a movie and could not find a cab to take us back to the hotel. I called the desk and they dispatched a cab to us in just a few minutes. When we were checking out they gave us detailed information to get to the Orange County airport. Great job! This hotel is great for those who want a great location, great service and a reasonable price. I will return there when in LA. The hotel is a welcome addition to the Los Angeles market and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadagain055
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this Hotel. It was evident that the Hotel had just undergone a complete renovation and the finished product looked great. The decor was very hip. The building and grounds were clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and attentive to my needs. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Westernman88
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and wasn't terribly impressed. Rooms are nicely decorated and the bed is comfortable but rooms not overly large and somewhat noisy. Poor cable without many channels. They have large flat screen TV's but analog picture quality and no HD. The staff is inconsistent at best. Turn down serivce occurred the first and last nights but not the middle two. The restaurant brought me the wrong order twice at breakfast; on the thrid try the eggs were overcooked but I ate them anyway. The bar charges $8/drink and doesn't even have nuts or nibbles, even for a fee, much less complimentary. The sole choice is a $12 plate of olives. Not too tasty with a margarita. It has a superficial eco-friendliness, but changes the towels daily no matter where you hang them. The hallways are kept about 60 degrees and of course the hotel windows don't open. The water faucets do not permit you to adjust the rate of flow so it is always full force. Good location for the west side of LA though.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MikeDJ
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience! New paint, carpets and a few pieces of cool furniture can't disguise the inherent shortcomings of this renovated hotel. (I am told it used to be a Doubetree, and that's the level it remains at). The rooms are too small, the AC is so loud you want to cover your ears the whole time you are in the room, and the walls are so thin that even if you turn yours off you'll hear your neighbor's AC (not to mention their bathroom visits). And don't get me started on the pool: tucked away in what feels like an alley behind the hotel (between the hotel's dumpster and the washing facility), with a grand total of five sunbathing chairs -- try fighting for one on a Saturday afternoon - and a bunch of shared couches. Half the equipment in the fitness center fails to work properly. True, the staff are friendly, but this "boutique" hotel is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rizzo020
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, beautiful rooms, nice staff, good location close to UCLA. Westwood Village very cool and close. Staff was very nice and ready to please. Would definitely go back and recommend. We had booked the grand opening rate of $229 and for an additional $100 got an amazing suite. Really liked it. In the mornings they offer free coffee and evenings a free wine hour. That right there is a big savings.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palomar Los Angeles - Westwood - a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 10740 Wilshire Blvd at Selby Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90024
